Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location, fantastic friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: CraigChicago
Reviews.Content: We loved the Grand Hotel Central. The location is perfect - the hotel is next to the Barri Gothic and next to the La Ribera/El Born, but not in the middle of either, so congestion and traffic flow is not an issue. The hotel is modern and efficient inside, but retains a good deal of charm from its original construction 100 years ago. The interior is much like a W Hotel - very sleek and modern - so don't anticipate a quaint, 1900's interior. The staff was friendly and spoke excellent English, Spanish and Catalan. They made dinner reservations for us frequently and handled many issues for us. I highly recommend this hotel. One piece of advice - most of the light switches are on the bed's headboard panel, if you can't figure out how to turn on a light, call the front desk - they sent someone right up to show me. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: mervav
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights in March. Great location, clean modern rooms and great service! Unfortunately we didn't sleep well, since the weather was quite warm for March - but, the aircondition in the rooms was not turned on for the summer yet! We were upgraded from our standard rooms, which did not allow the windows to be open, but in the superior room the temperature was the same. With the windows open it was also hard to sleep because of the noice from the street. BUT; if you go there when aircondition is on, I definately recommend it! Rooms, location, roof terrace and service is excellent. Nice breakfast with Cava, free water and coke in the minibar (free cava in the superior room). Missed free internet in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BE_2103
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in April. Overall, we enjoyed the stay - staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was on the small side but comfortable and well-appointed. Breakfast was included and decent, although lacked variety - the scrambled eggs tasted 'powdery'. The location was excellent, with easy access to all major sites, which was the key reason we chose this place. Noise was an issue though but can't have 'em all, so request for rooms on higher levels and not facing the street. Nice views rrom the rooftop, did not try the pool as it was too cool.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good -- just need to smarten up on a few little things -- and fix the airconditioning!”
Reviews.Author: vague travellers
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a hotel that is a good place to stay. The building has some history, the location is great and the bed and room set up and furnishings comfortable. The staff were always friendly and willing to help. And they checked us in a couple of hours early which we appreciated. The front desk was always cheerful and happy to make suggestions of places to go and how to get there. There were a few minor annoyances that it wouldnt take much to fix. Wifi wasnt free (but on the other hand some soft drinks in the mini bar were which was a nice touch. Wifi was very infrequent in our room (but they did give us a cord for wired). There was work going on a couple of doors up from our room (but it was ok and I guess you have to do that sometime). The pool was shut for a function the night we went up (but lots of hotels do that). The airconditioning in our room didn''t work although it did in the corridors -- they never did fix it or get back to us -- as the window was open when we got there maybe the last person had the same issue. Don't get me wrong on this -- this isnt meant to be a whinge, just to illustrate that in my view it wouldnt take much for it to be great rather than almost there. . We had a good time there and would enjoy going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, wonderful roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: Joysey
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in this hotel over the Easter holidays. We were on the 4th floor, and had a lovely view over the old city walls. The location of the hotel is the main plus point. It is close to the Ramblas, about 10 minutes walk to Barceloneta and less to the harbour area and right next to the Barri Gotic or old town. There is a metro stop just steps away from the front door if you want to go further afield. The room was nice - very contemporary and minimalist, the bed was huge and extremely comfortable and it had a large bathroom with full size bath. The mini bar was stocked each day with soft drinks which were complimentary. This was a nice touch. The roof terrace is wonderful. The pool is not large, but it is nice to have a pool in the centre of Barcelona and the views are superb. We went up there in the day and also when it was dark - this is a must. Staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful. We did not have breakfast - instead we went to the market just a short stroll away in the mornings and bought freshly baked goods there and coffee and fruit juices. We enjoyed our stay here, the convenience of the location and the roof terrace mean we would definitely go back and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug23Uk
Reviews.Content: First trip to Barcelona and this hotel was perfect for exploring the city. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Only disappointment was that we booked the 'Barcelona and Romance' package with the hotel, which promised luxuries such as breakfast in the room and Cava in the room - these were not present when we arrived and we had to return to reception to ask them. They then provided the Cava and other goodies, but as it was a surprise for my husband's birthday it was spoilt as the initial impact was missing as we went down to reception to ask. Breakfast was in the restaurant each morning, as although we asked several times how breakfast in the room was organised we were still no clearer and therefore ended up just having it in the restaurant - a shame! However, saying all that - it was a lovely hotel and our evening meal in the Restaurant Avalon was fantastic. Would visit again, but probably not on one of their special packages as it wasn't worth the extra.

Reviews.Title: “Rather impersonal, but a good option for first time visitors”
Reviews.Author: giorgionet
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal for first time visitors to Barcelona who are seeking a high level of comfort, hip decor and a great location for exploring the city. Breakfast is nice, the top floor terrace is ideal to sip a cocktail while watching the sunset over Barcelona and the pool (better said the tiny pond) is a pleasurable anti-heat in summer days. Having said that, here we go with the downsides: - the hotel really lacks personality (you could be anywhere in the world...nothing reminds you of Spain or Catalunya); - service is friendly but not always what one would expect from a hotel of this level (for example, no one helped with luggage upon arrival); - rooms are clean and quite comfortable but really small and if you happen to stay on a low floor (like we did) you need to be used to sleep with noise if you don't want to spend the night counting sheeps. Overall a good choice, but for our next visit we would probably like to try another place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Location”
Reviews.Author: barrogers
Reviews.Content: this was our first trip to Barcelona so we did not knwo what to expect from this hotel. We arranged a taxi from the airport to the hotel which was quite expensive at 40.00 euro one way. i would recomend getting the train so long as you dont have too much luggage as this is much cheaper and really just as convenient. The hotel itself was very nice. We arrived quite early (10am) but had no trouble checking in as our room was available for us. We had paid for a superior King room, which we had hoped would have city views as advertised but unfortunately we only looked onto a neighboruing wall. this didnt matter too much though as we had not travelled for the view from the room. im not sure thogh if the upgrade would be worthwhile, but i guess this will depend on each individual. the room was spacious and had an enormous bed. i think it was two singles together but was very comfy. the TV had a couple of english channels mostly news and film four. all standard bathroom appliances and plenty of waredrobe space. The hotel itself was not very sound proofed. we could hear alot going on above and beside us. it didnt effect us too much at night as we had a few drinks in but if you were just trying to chill in the room it was a little annoying. unnfortunately we did not eat in the hotel so i cannot comment here. the hotel was tidy and when we left our 'turn down' sign out the room was turned around very quickly. the rooftop bar would be amazing in the summer. it was quite cold when we where there over Easter but that was down to bad weather only. its a great place to have a couple of drinks or even just chill and read if thats your thing. i would warn through the bar is VERY expensive. 1 Vodka Tonic was 9.50 euro!!!!! so buyer beware when signing to the room as this can be quite a shock on the bill otherwise. the spa, well i say spa, the wellness centre as it is called was very good. We had massages and a pedicure and they were both very good. A full body massage was 98.00 euro and a pedicure around 50 i think. Gratiuity not included. we had no trouble making an appointment but do note it is only a room so two appointments cannot be carried out at the same time. the hotels location is bar far its best selling feature.we were only a two minute walk from Las Ramblas and all the best shopping. the city bus tour stopped just up the road and there is plenty of public transport nearby. if i am honest if i was going back i would likely stay closer to the beach than the city but for first time visitors this is the place as it is easy to walk most places.

Reviews.Title: “Young family”
Reviews.Author: SebastianHuber
Reviews.Content: We were staying with our 5 month old child at the hotel. The staff was very helpful with all our needs. They gave us a welcoming feeling and helped us with all our special needs.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel Central”
Reviews.Author: monalisasmiler
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay in Barcelona. First impressions of Hotel were good a lovely old building offering a welcoming modern reception. All corridoors are modern and clean. The rooms themselves are also modern with wooden floors and offering TV and also docking station for the ipod/iphone. Wifi is not free but is chargeable of 5 Euros a night, which is a little excessive considering the hotel price. Our room was on the small and dark side and also disappointed with the twin beds, not in keeping with a romantic city break. Another strange thing we found with the rooms was the bathroom facilities, toilet and shower are separated by glass sliding door, not the best for privacy if sharing a room and the wardrobe is rather small separated by a curtain - tip take plenty of coathangers too. What did spoil our stay on the second to last night we were two doors from the Hotel when my bag was ripped from my shoulder taken with my phone and belongings in. The Hotel allowed us to use the phone to cancel my phone but advised us to go to the Police, which we did get a Taxi, the Taxi did not have a clue where to go and dropped us in the centre for us to try and locate the police, not the best situation after you have just gone through this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ramjam275
Reviews.Content: I originally stayed at the Grand Central several years ago when I was in Barcelona on business. Based on that experience, I booked a 4 night stay as part of a family holiday. The hotel is very well located in the heart of the Gothic quarter. Staff are very friendly and helpful and the service is excellent. We arrived late on a Wednesday evening and were checked-in by a very helpful receptionist. She recommended some local restaurants that we might want to try and her recommendation was spot on. The rooms were comfortable, spacious and had an air of luxury about them. A free minibar in the room was a pleasant surprise and it was stocked with water and cola and a chocolate. We slept well although the pillows take some getting used to, being so long and slim. The electric window blind is a nice touch and proved a hit with our kids. The only negative thing is that the clock radio is turned off every time you remove the key card from the electric switch by the froint door meaning you have to reset the time every time you re-enter the room. The breakfast is very good and worth trying. Although it can be a bit pricey, it's well prepared and there's a good choice of hot and cold dishes, as well as proper coffee. The swimming pool on the roof is an additional bonus and the views on a good day are fantastic. We spent a relaxing day lounging around, taking in the views and soaking up the sun. There is a bar by the pool that caters for snacks and drinks. Overall, a great location and wonderful service made for a great stay. Would definately recommend the Grand Central.

Reviews.Title: “great breakfast, beautiful pool”
Reviews.Author: a1110
Reviews.Content: booked on a cheap deal and got the worst room in the hotel! but despite the noise from the refurb going on in the room next door it was nice. rooftop pool was beautiful but cold in october! the sun didn't ever seem to get to it either which was a shame. the bar was empty in the evening too which i couldn't understand. breakfast was gorgeous, as much as you can eat with cava and fruits and pastries and tortilla. very good value. communal areas were very relaxing and staff were nice. booked us into another restaurant (notoriously hard to get a booking at) with no trouble. they have bikes you can borrow if that's your thing.

Reviews.Title: “Wet....but still fab”
Reviews.Author: MrsWim1959
Reviews.Content: Ok so April showers expected in England but Barcelona...and for every day we were there...ho hum! Still great hotels provide umbrellas and the Grand Hotel did just that! This hotel was fab...loved it...the staff were so helpful and friendly. We arrived very late (6hr delay) but no problem... table booked for us in restaurant... meal was tasty and wine was welcome...and reasonable price compared to other restaurants we tried. Breakfast was included in our deal... very good! Rooms were as requested: at the back, high up...lovely view over city rooftops... quiet, clean, next to each other...Dad's free bottle of Cava to celebrate his 80th was welcome! Location is super... straight across the road into old Barcelona... a few minutes away from the tourist bus stop (needed that...best way to see Barcelona in the rain!) Can't say we used the pool but the view from there is wonderful... Only thing is, we will have to come back when it isn't so wet...and will definitely stay at the Grand Central again!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel Central”
Reviews.Author: hunter22
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel Central is in a great location that was right by Born district which is the hot food & nightlife district, walking distance to the beaches, the Ramblas, The Mercado(most amazing food market I have ever seen), the Barcelona Cathedral, the 5th Ave of Barcelona Placa Catalunya, the Dali, Picasso museums, and many more museums and Art galleries. The rooms are minimalist yet comfortable. One of the highlights is the rooftop lounge and infinity pool...it was incredible oasis to take a break from it all...The staff were all fantastic and were very helpful in regards to restaurants, beaches, sites etc...

Reviews.Title: “Probably One of The Best”
Reviews.Author: John36
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel after much trawling of this website. It is very well positioned for the old town and most of the sights. However it is on an undeniably noisy main road. Having noted the recommendations on Tripadvisor, I particularly asked for a room at the rear of the hotel. I booked directly, by telephone, with the hotel - always the best route for getting the best deal I find. I was offered a good rate, including breakfast. On arrival I was told that we had been upgraded to a Suite. However this turned out not to be a Suite as most people might expect with a sitting area or similar. The rooms are well finished but quite small. Even the 'Suite' had room for only one chair in front of the bench-like table along one wall. The justification for calling the room a Suite seemed to be that the entrance door did not open directly into the room, but into a short corridor affair. The bathroom was nicely fitted out. Everything was, otherwise, adequate. I wouldn't choose to pay extra for a 'Suite' though. Although the room was on the side of the hotel, overlooking a side alleway, some traffic noise did penetrate but really no more than the noise from average air-conditioning. Incidentally, the a/c was working and could be controlled to maintain a comfortable temperature. The breakfast was good, but expensive if not included in the room rate. If it hadn't been we would have eaten out. Service was good and the Internet access was free on the hotel's three PCs'. Our only complaint was that some sort of a a conference was being held at the hotel, and the delegates regularly blocked the doorway and pavement having a smoke, with no control exercised by management. Not a good image for a top rated hotel. PS. If Julie B Green from the States reads this "Contact me and I'll tell you where I found your credit card - it's safe!"

Reviews.Title: “Great Friendly and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: BeckyD83
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrific. It had a great central location and amazing staff. When we checked in we were given a map and areas of interest pointed out to us. All the staff were helpful and spoke enough English to assist us with all of our needs including finding a local laundermat. (Which is just 3 blocks away). Amazing view of the city from the rooftop. Another plus was that we were able to check-in in the morning when we arrived as they are used to American flights arriving early. The rooms are a bit tight but as you don't spend much time in your room, that is not a big deal. The breakfast is quite good and it was refreshing to have a mini-bar with free items - water, coke, juice. (That is hard to find in the US.) The hotel was always clean and rooms were cleaned every day. Only complaint is the euro style shower.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mn3
Reviews.Content: The two stand out features of the hotel were it's location and rooftop pool and bar. It was a brilliant base for exploring the city with many main attractions a short walk away. The rooftop pool and bar were fabulous. Patio heaters and blankets were a welcome touch. Although a superior room it was not spacious. It was very clean though. There were no tea and coffee making facilities in the room but the fridge did contain free bottled water and some other soft drinks. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Overall it was a great hotel in a superb location. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kathy C
Reviews.Content: Very modern hotel centrally located in Barcelona. This hotel is very close to the Cathedral and within walking distance to many tourist attractions including Las Ramblas and Port Vell. I requested early check-in and my room was ready when I arrived. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. My room had two double beds pushed together, but it was not a deal breaker. Very modern fixtures in room; great roof-top terrace with good views of city. The Jaume I train station was only a couple of minutes away from the hotel, perfect if you need to take the train. Overall the room was clean and I did enjoy my stay in the hotel, however, there was a little bit of mold in my shower and the shower floor looked in need of a bit of bleach. Thankfully flip-flops were provided so I showered in them.

Reviews.Title: “Expected better”
Reviews.Author: D0dy
Reviews.Content: It is a trendy hotel with excellent location just in front of the Cathedral. Many attractions are reachable by walking. We arrived earlier and they gave us a room different we booked (smaller and not street view). They changed it without any problem but it was not a good start. The room was conformable, good size but the bathroom was a bit smelly and we could not control the room temperature, it was very hot. The breakfast is ok, nothing very special. Do not expect too much from the free minibar as it includes a coke, orange juice and few bottle of water. Overall the good location of the hotel made us forget the problems and we had fantastic time in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent across the board!”
Reviews.Author: emmyanddee
Reviews.Content: We would definitely stay here again! Location couldn't be better and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. We were able to check in early (without notice) and they held on to our luggage after we'd checked out so we could continue to sightsee before our evening flight. Our room was very quiet and had everything we needed for the weekend. This was our second stay in Barcelona and we thought we'd done well the first time but this hotel and especially the staff really exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: casadelren
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay here again! Everything was outstanding and I absolutely loved it! The bed was comfortable and room clean, spacious and cozy. The staff was friendly and helpful. Massage at the spa was great too. We were allowed to check-in early and our luggage was held so we could get a room on the top floor. The rooftop terrace was amazing and drinks and snacks delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Faboulous - from beginning to end”
Reviews.Author: Crippa
Reviews.Content: Booked through a hotel booking site (Hotels.com) and got a great price. Always when I do this I get a feeling of not being a "real customer" but more of a cheapskate that tries to live a more glamorous life than I really can afford. And - then expect the hotel to treat me likewise. But at Grand central there was no such feeling. Beginning the initial e-mail contact where my wife asked for a room a little bit higher up(to avoid traffic noise) where she also mentioned it was our anniversary which was both answered and with a promise of doing their best to fulfill our needs. Upon arrival we got a great reception and they asked us if we had dinner plans and when we told them and the very nice lady in the reception gave us some extra restaurant tips to check out. The room was on the 4th floor, still some traffic noise - but it's a large city so what you'd expect? In the room there was a bottle of cava and a card congratulating us on the anniversary. WELL over expectation. The roof top bar is an absolute must. We spend late afternoons there after an activity filled(well, a lot of walking actually) day. The nice sofas, a bottle of rosé wine/beer and some nice music. Perfect for relaxing from the busy city. Also perfect to start your evening before going out when they light up the small pool and the bar. We didn't have the breakfast since it seemed a liitle to over priced for us (€25?) but also since we prefer eating at small street cafés etc. The room itself was very spacious, with awesome design, nice comfy beds and soft bathrobes to kick back in. If I should complain about anything - well,.maybe the heavy scent of musk in the hallways/elevator. Some cleaning staff had gone wild with that stuff. A pleasant experience for the first minute but if you waited for the elevator a while - you'd feel the headache coming... But that's all. Everything else was very thought through and nice. A top three in the world on my list. (Also, when mentioning them on Twitter, they were fast to reply and acknowledge you - an extra plus in my book)

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Kymbos
Reviews.Content: This is truly the best hotel experience I have ever had and I have had a few. From the moment we arrived we were treated to the friendliest, most unobtrusive yet super efficient service we have ever seen. I honestly didn't think it existed. We were upgraded to a Loft Suite and allowed to check-in early. When we walked in to our room we were extremely happy - it was luxurious yet understated. The gentleman who escorted us to the room gave us a thorough run through of the workings including the free minibar which is refilled every day. Free Cava - what's not to love about that! The communal areas of this hotel are just as impressive as the rooms. The rooftop terrace is nothing short of spectacular. We spent a lot of time up here basking the beautiful winter sun and enjoying the relaxed vibe. We didn't get to use the infinity pool as it was too chilly but even as a backdrop it hit the spot. We were offered a promotion on arrival for the breakfast. At the standard €24 I think it would be far too expensive but for the €12 we paid I think it was fair value and a lovely way to start the day without having to venture too far to refuel. Seriously though I could go on and on about every single detail but the most outstanding thing about this hotel is its staff - they are exceptional and make the visit 7*. Do yourself a favour and stay here - there is nowhere else in Barcelona I will be staying forevermore!!

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC!!!”
Reviews.Author: Filipe B
Reviews.Content: I have no words to say how incredible was my experience in this hotel. Lovely staff, lovely atmosphere, the food was gorgeous, the location was brilliant, and Mariella had an important credit on my acomodation. EXCELLENT!!! I WILL ALWAYS COME BACK! THANK YOU ALL! I stayed from 03/02 til 07/02. Filipe

Reviews.Title: “So quiet ... so nice ... so central”
Reviews.Author: Athlet
Reviews.Content: The first thing that called my attention is how quiet the rooms were, specially in such a central location. The rooms are nice, modern and with a decent bathroom. Breakfast was good and the restaurant (we had lunch twice) absolutely fabulous. The staff was very friendly ..honestly there's not much I can think they should improve. We had a fantastic stay Tip for runners: The gym is on the 7th floor, just between the rooms. I felt a bit guilty by using the (loud) treadmill at 7 AM, I wish the isolation would have been better, or the gym placed on a different place. In the gym itself there were maps for a couple of 5 & 10 km circuits downtown. I didn't use them, so I can't say how "realistic" it was to run from traffic light to traffic light

Reviews.Title: “Really very good”
Reviews.Author: esmeingers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located in a very picturesque area of Barcelona. The rooms are minimalist and comfortable with good facilities generally. We came in winter so could not (or rather weren't brave enough) to use the pool, but it looked great and had spectacular views of the city. The staff were really very friendly and you couldn't fault them at all. Contrary to many reviews we found this hotel very quiet and were not disturbed by road noise at all. The overall ambiance is chic and laid back with ambient music, mood lighting and lightly scented candles burning everywhere. Breakfast was a self service buffet consisting of great self serve coffee machines serving Nepresso coffee (I had coffee machine envy!), fresh juice, cooked breakfast cheeses etc; ok not exceptional but very good nevertheless. We even had a cheeky free Cava with breakfast daily! The negatives (there are few and I'm being really picky here) The bed was a double and felt small for us used to a king-size bed. The room was very hot no matter how high we had the air conditioning and the air con unit seemed pretty ineffective to boot. The room we stayed in had messy grouting in and around the tiles, but I think people who are design conscious do notice these things, and generally the bathroom needed a bit of sprucing up. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel. It was fairly good value for money and I would definitely stay here again. Please do go, you won’t regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay. Couldn't be more helpful!”
Reviews.Author: FRANCOPHILE650
Reviews.Content: The name of the hotel is Central and you really couldn't get any more central. Just a short walk to La Rambla and right next door to the gorgeous cathedral. Reception stafff could not have been more helpful with perfect English and lots of useful local information. The hotel itself is a rather funky affair with understated colours but a very relaxed vibey atmosphere. The rooms were very well laid out and certainly used all available space. I can't fault the staff and the service and we had a lovely couple of days, and the ever helpful reception even allowed us to check out at 4pm because of a later flight! Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a centrally located hotel in Barcelona, as good for a business traveller as a romantic couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: Duckman9999
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights including 31 December. Excellent hotel, very comfortable rooms and superb staff. Unfortunately the aircon was switched off (heating only) and the room got incredibly stuffy. On our last night we asked if they could open the window (4th floor) which made a huge difference. The roof terrace is great, but we didn't try the pool! Breakfast is OK - service a little chaotic, food not hot. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Otherwise Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: CAKennyboy
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is first rate, walking distance to many of Barcelona's highlights. But service has been spotty. For example, we came back to our room after a day of exploring, right around 4:00 and the room had not been cleaned. When we called the front desk and complained, it still took the stuaff a half hour (and another unhappy call) to get service. Additionally, charging 5 Euro for wi-fi is so chintzy and cheap, and worse, the connection speed made it almost unusable. The room itself is very small, the TV reception on several channels was poor, and the heat/air works very poorly. The breakfast was fairly minimal--compared to the lavish breakfast we received in our hotel in Madrid. And someone needs to tell the staff that elevator versions of 1980's hits (Wham and others) piped into all public spaces is just not everyone's taste.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Sabbatsveld
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in Barri gotic area,friendly staff,nice rooms,very good and late breakfast. On top of the roof it was a pleasure to sit in the sun and to relax of a great view. It was a pity the airco wasn't on in wintertime.Rooms were too warm,we had to ask to open the window each day.

Reviews.Title: “Place to not stay”
Reviews.Author: Chris W
Reviews.Content: The positives - location and cleanliness. The negatives - street noise ( windows not soundproof at all ) , too warm ( had no heat on and room still stayed over 80 degrees each day), parking is down the street, but does not tell on web site, parking is more than what website says, room too dark - designer felt lack of light may make it feel more expensive?, room too warm ( cannot say this enough ).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, with Pool”
Reviews.Author: LubricationWine
Reviews.Content: Superb downtown location, with quiet modern rooms, and front desk staff always eager to please and help. The draw for us was the pool, as this is hard to come by in this city. However, as its pretty small and the area around it is too, you need to get up early to get a lounger as it fills up very quickly. Unfortunately other guests thought it apporpriate to come up and lay towels down and dis-appear for th most of the day, which is pretty off. Not the hotels fault. The serice at the roof top bar is pretty sketchy and often a little surly. Usually we stay at 5 Rooms an amazing B&B further up the main street. Totally different experince, but for a hotel, downtown, with ability to cool off in a pool, I'd recommend the Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: KonMinAri
Reviews.Content: Great location, great service, great room, friendly staff, stunning view from the roof garden (with small but beautifull pool) and mosto of all silent room!!!! only some little noise from the street but once on the 7th floor that was ok. Great choice for our 21 month old son, central area, min. away from everything. Very good restaurant quality, reasonable priced. The design of the room was simple and modern although a little bit dark. Everything looked clean and new and everyday refill of the mini bar was a plus. I only have one "black" point... why 2 single beds? I always wondered when I see that they have single beds... I would have prefer it if it was a queen or king bed instead... Free internet with Mac at the lobby area but payed wifi (5 euros/day) if you wanted access from your room.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous property - wish their wasn't so much street noise.”
Reviews.Author: Jpresskin
Reviews.Content: We had the 2 room suite and it was elegant-Bathroom amenities were divine. Hotel location in hard to beat. Hotel management goes above and beyond for it's guests and they even stock the minibar for you gratis. The TV selection was poor and when the windows are open there in noise from dusk to dawn. Buffet breakfast was basic but good. I would stay here again easily if only the outside noise could be remedied. Overall, loved the place

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel close to the old town”
Reviews.Author: Teein1
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 9am in the morning and the staff (very smiley and helpful) allowed us to check in at 10.30 without a comment. Roof top bar and pool is awesome but, in December, too cold to really enjoy. The rooms are nice, not extremely big though. Very quiet, our room was overlooking the back of the hotel and we did not hear a thing at night.I shared the room with a friend and whilst I usually love the design bathrooms made out of glass, we literally had NO privacy ! We literally had to leave the room so that the other one could go to the toilet or have a shower in piece. Breakfast was ok - nothing fancy though.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location”
Reviews.Author: WinchesterGranny
Reviews.Content: We went for a significant birthday, our first trip to Barcelona and we are both pensioners. The location is fabulous; ideally placed within the older part, opposite the Gothic Cathedral and equi distance to shopping and the sea. The staff were very friendly and helpful. When we went to our room we found scaffolding immediately opposite our main window and so asked to be moved. This they did within 10 minutes and I suspect we were upgraded. The rooms are very modern and it seems a little as if design is more important than functionality, with two using the facilities and wardrobe space - better use could have been made of the space and why only one chair? Blinds are wonderful, you can sleep until you choose with no light or noise to disturb.Rooms were a bit airless and underfloor heating tricky to adjust. Dinner was fine but the restuarant lacks ambiance - better for breakfast, which was adequate but not sensational. Bar service in lounge a bit slow - a proper "lounge" bar would massively improve this hotel. Considering the location and helpfulness and friendliness of the staff I think I would use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Intimate atmosphere, staff first class”
Reviews.Author: Garry P
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel, suitably grand and very central so it does what it says on the tin. The food was excellent in quality and freshness with a wide choice available. The pastries at breakfast were particularly delicious. The staff were friendly, helpful, capable and efficient providing first rate service going the extra mile in providing it. The Hotel is stylish in a gucci style sort of way, with rooms which are ideal in size and luxuriously equipped in a 21st century style without being overlavish or too flashy. Everything worked and an abient comfortable temperature in the room was easy to achieve. The muted tones in reception contrasted well with the main glass lift and abundant steel finishes around the secondary lifts, in all a tasteful relaxing reception offering a quiet laid back contrast to the bustle and competing colours in Barcelona. It is a tasteful, understated modern elegance in a lovely classic hotel building. We enjoyed staying there immensely.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Average room.”
Reviews.Author: jcw4b
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The room was quiet as it was at the back of the hotel away from the busy road that the hotel is situated on. The room was not especially large but was very clean but somewhat austere in appearance. Like many European hotels there are no coffee and tea making facilities in the room which is inconvenient. The breakfast is good (and includes glasses of cava !), however the seating is not the most comfortable. The rooftop pool and bar were closed for winter. The location is excellent for Las Ramblas and the waterfront, and the staff are very friendly. Overall, this is an above average hotel but don't expect a large room.

Reviews.Title: “Honest opinion”
Reviews.Author: AllanFraser
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Grand central in October for four nights with my wife and son, in two seperate rooms. Looks cool on the website, and is in a great location, but in reality is ok but not super cool like you would expect. Rooms were quite cold in both appearance and temperature, the a/c did not work properly! The shower pressure was also very poor. Free soft drinks and water in the minibar helped. The rooftop pool/ bar was very nice, but the whole area, only gets the sun up to 2pm due to it being overshadowed by a taller building next door.Am sure it would be fine in mid summer, but in Oct half term hols, it was a real shame that the bar was also not open every day, only some nights from 7pm, which was very odd, given that when it was open the area was very busy, and everybody was looking for some F&B after a days sightseeing around 4pm. As there was no other bar in the Hotel getting a drink was an arduos process of having to go to the restaurant, where I felt like an intruder, with very poor service. I then had to carry the drinks back to the terrace, by hand, and they were all in plastic tumblers...nice! On a plus side- great location for everything in town!

Reviews.Title: “If you have only one night in Barcelona, this is THE place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BobDaFish
Reviews.Content: We extended our cruise by one night in Barcelona and selected the Grand Central Hotel. The lobby was modern with a quaint central glass elevator. The hotel held our luggage while we walked the area and had a delicious breakfast at a nearby coffee shop. Returning the hotel, we found out that we had been upgraded to a wonderful suite that provided the space to spread out after having been quartered in a cruise ship room for several days. The bed was so comfortable, my wife was looking to find the manufacturer. They delivered some warm cookies which was a nice surprise. We headed to the rooftop pool and relaxed in the sun while enjoying drinks, snacks, and the view of the gothic quarter. The location provided a great starting place for a walk to dinner, as well as a walk through the Gothic quarter the following morning before a flight home. The hotel's pastries and coffee provided a delicious start to our day.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: shezalina
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend for 5 nights in November 2011. We had struggled to find a hotel as none of them seemed to have the right combination of location, style, comfort and a reasonable price. We chose Grand Hotel Central and were so pleased that we did. The location is great, on Via Laietana which is a fairly busy road, with a Starbucks next door. 5 minutes walk to La Ramblas, about 10-15 mins walk to the Port area and 10 mins walk (if that) to Plaza Catalunya and up to Passeig de Gracia for some fab shopping! The rooms are a good size with two good sized twin beds. The windows have automatic blinds which can make the rooms pitch black and no noise comes through so you get a really good nights sleep. An iPhone docking station, strong hairdryer, robe and flip flops are provided. There is a small gym and a fabulous rooftop pool and bar. The bar is closed over the winter months but we could take a bottle of wine from the restaurant up there. There are also bikes in reception that you can rent out for the day and the staff and friendly and chatty. Probably the only downside is the lack of free WIFI for guests in the rooms. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to someone looking for a comfortable stylish hotel in a good location. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bieken
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Modern and clean but rooms are quite dark. Breakfast is correct but limited choice. Staff is very friendly and helpful We stayed in room 315 and we could hear the metro late evening and early morning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice ambience and location but mediocre in other ways”
Reviews.Author: BastiAina
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in November 2011. The location of this hotel is topnotch. One is very close to the gothic quarter and Paseo de Gracia which are very enjoyable to explore on foot and also communicates well by public transport with other Barcelona landmarks. The rooms are decent-sized and are well-appointed. Yet just like another five-star hotel I stayed at in Barcelona last year (Hotel OMM) the service and attention levels are not at par with more established luxury chains like Mandarin, for instance. Like young wine, this hotel has to mature and focus on giving more attention to detail befitting of what they charge per night, which is not little money. Wi-fi should be standard and free. They charge 5€/day for access. When it started to rain, they had run out of umbrellas for guests at the reception. Drop the useless robe and put umbrellas instead in every room. The gym is tiny, more a room with equipment stuffed into it. I was not the only guest grioing about the gym during our stay. This is perhaps a personal preference I was disappointed that windows don't open easily (I like some fresh air into the room before sleeping) and to do so someone must come from reception to open and close them for you. While the parking is expensive ("special" rate of 28€/night) at a nearby public garage they gave us a hard time with it because when we wanted to drive somewhere they had not informed the garage as they should have and as a result we could not get out until we had called the hotel, told them about our predicament and so on. Would We stay here again? No. We will take what we paid them and go elsewhere for less money or for better attention for same money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location very chic but limited bar and lounge areas!”
Reviews.Author: Sichal
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay as it is right opposite the cathedral square. Second time I have stayed here, my room was a little dark and gloomy and as it rained heavily during my stay the lounge areas in the hotel are very limited as only a few sofas by the lift!! If its all about good location go for it!

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Barcelona: fantastic in every way”
Reviews.Author: PassportandVisa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in October 2011. The hotel is in an excellent location in the Barri Gotic close to everything Barcelona has to offer. Staff is among the most friendly I have ever encountered Our room was the loft suite on the 7th floor which we were upgraded to upon arrival. Our windows faced Via Laietana which is a busy street but we did not encounter any traffic noise at all. Decor was very modern and tasteful and the bathroom was enormous. There is a lovely bar and pool on the roof (closed in winter) and a library/lounge area downstairs. Breakfast was included in our rate and the Avalon restaurant where it is served is very modern with a huge selection each morning. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: ramboyandy
Reviews.Content: Our party of eight stayed at this hotel last week we had a great time the hotel was in the perfect spot. Most places of interest were within walking distance.The hotel food exceptional and superb value.The rooms were good only down side was no tea or coffee but plenty of places nearby to grab a coffee or you could go down to the restaurant. We went else where for our breakfast as there were so many choices.The drink prices in the hotel and surrounding area were a lot less expensive than i was expecting.We went for a swim in the fab roof top pool but unfortunately it was a bit on the cold side not surprising as it was october.We used suntransfers from airport to hotel and they were waiting for us and it was an ideal way to transport such a large party.This was a great hotel and would advise anyone who cannot decide where to stay to come here you will not be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, central, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: jentow
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good central location to get to anywhere in Barcelona. We walked almost everywhere, although the hotel is close to transport as well. The rooftop pool and bar was a fantastic oasis from the busy streets. The only complaint we had was that there was a fair amount of traffic noise, even though the windows are double glazed. They have done what they can with a refurbished old building to keep the sound out but I guess there's only so much you can do. Still, it didn't keep us awake (and I'm a light sleeper) so, all in all, not at all a show stopper.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel in superb location”
Reviews.Author: Kmmnicoll
Reviews.Content: Was a perfect venue for our girlie 40th birthday celebration. Clean, spacious and modern rooms. Great location. Roof top pool area was a bonus. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “To infinity and...Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: MarkPLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent two night stay in Hotel Central with my son. We had a spacious double room and excellent breakfast for EUR 220. Great location in Barri Gotic - 5 mins from Picasso Museum, Cathedral and 10 mins walk to Las Ramblas. Easy metro connection to Nou Camp. We also walked to the Gaudi buildings in Modernista district. Staff were friendly and we borrowed electric bikes (at a cost) from Reception. The infinity pool and roof top sun terrace/bar is a major plus. Pool is small but sunny and with an incredible view. Perfect for s retreat after shopping, sightseeing or watching Barcelona play Santander.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: maddiemoo1105
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Excellent service. Staff is most helpful and friendly, everyone! Rooms are very reasonable size. Pool and skybar are great. We had an awesome time.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: Bruce H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2010 and were very pleased it was the first snow in Barcelona for many years and getting back to the airport was tricky the hotel was great first class breakfast and the rooms were triple glazed and were very quiet with blackout blinds in the glass which were electrically operated which were great for a good nights sleep. El born district is just around the corner and perfect for evenings away from Las Ramblas the tube station Jaume is just a minute away. I would stay here again keep up the standard.

Reviews.Title: “Central as its name”
Reviews.Author: Marielondon1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night only, I wish it could have been longer, its a fabulous hotel, modern and clean - lovely room, very comfy beds, nice shower area and complimentary mini bar. Near La Ramblas for all the lovely restaurants and bars, near to the bus stop for the tour buses. The roof pool area was stunning and the breakfast included was very good - would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Honeymoon :)”
Reviews.Author: e11en84
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights for our honeymoon. They knew it was our honeymoon, and we were lucky enough to get upgraded to one of the top-floor suites. The rooms was spacious and modernly decorated, massive bath and plus a seperate wetroom type shower. Loved the cakes, chocolates and cava that greeted us most days too. Wifi was an OK rate, and while I had one issue when it stopped recognising my username, the staff fixed it up for me instantly. Location was awesome. Safe but central, walking distance to most of the tourist bits, cafes and underground. We're usually go-go-go type travellers, but as it was our honeymoon we took some time out, saw what we really wanted to but spent a lot of time (for us, anyway) just chilling out in the bar in the late afternoons and often again once we'd back from exploring the restaurants at night. We couldn't fault our stay. Thanks for an awesome honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Great central location modern and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Rob T
Reviews.Content: 2 night stay. Great location in the old part of town. Very helpful staff. We had to pay for wifi which only worked for a day and then didn't but they credited us back the €10 fee. We didn't get breakfast included but many cares locally. Rooms are modern and comfortable. Rooftop infinity pool lounge and bar was great at night . Free stuff in mini bar was a nice touch. . Library reading room was a nice touch. This was the most expensive hotel on our 5 week trip in Europe but we think Barcelona is expensive for hotels. we really enjoyed our stay at the hotel and the City

Reviews.Title: “Great Barcelona hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: magical724
Reviews.Content: Grand Hotel Central is located in the Barri Gotic district in a very easy location. Upon arriving at 10:00am, we were happy to find that our room was ready! We were in a Loft Suite on the 5th floor, facing a pretty side street. The room was exactly as it’s represented on the website. It has a large bedroom with 4 windows and a spacious 2-part bathroom, with one large shower unit and one shower/tub unit. Although it’s big, it’s just okay in term of décor. Our main shower was clogged the entire time we were there, resulting in several soaked floor incidents. The bedroom itself was comfortable, but it was disappointing that the windows did not open. Especially on the lovely days we visited in September, it would have been nice to have some fresh air in there. For the price we paid, we have no complaints (booked through a promotion directly off the website). Here are some pros and cons we found at the hotel: PROs - Modern & Clean - Nice touches, like fresh baked muffins at turn down (this wasn’t consistent however); free mini bar with small waters, 1 coca-cola and 1 OJ (no substitutions allowed) - Two internet enabled PCs in the lobby, free of charge - Very quiet – they aren’t kidding when they say the walls are virtually sound-proof - Near everything! We took a cab only one day, and that was to Park Guell - Complimentary city guide published by the hotel; on the website it was advertised for 10euro, but one put in our room complimentary. It was better than the Frommer’s guide we brought and we used it to explore the neighborhoods - Rooftop Pool and Lounge – absolutely stunning. The water is freezing in the pool but it’s worth a swim – you feel like you are swimming off the edge of the building! Also very relaxing in the day and in the evening for drinks. They offer a variety of snacks as well; I’d skip the small snacks (which are the equivalent of Lay’s potato chips) and opt for the sandwiches. Are they overpriced? Probably. But they are simple and good! We loved the toasted ham and cheese. Also a variety of fresh juices and some drinks (limited). - Front desk was friendly enough if you required assistance. - Wellness Suite: I had two massages from Mareia – she was great! Very friendly and skilled and not to be missed CONs - No open air in rooms; windows bolted and no balcony options - Pool could get crowded and loud in the late afternoon when other tourists were arriving for pre-dinner drinks. - Service at the rooftop bar was pretty bad. First of all, I’ll say if you want something, go directly to the bar area; don’t wait for them to come to you or you’ll be waiting all day; it’s easy and convenient this way. However, the first day, the server ignored us for about 10 minutes and kept talking to her co-worker. Half the service staff we encountered over the days seemed annoyed at their jobs and clueless, although there were a few “okay” experiences. Two nights (early evening) they literally “ran out” of almost every liquor. They keep the bar barely stocked, only very limited wine selections, and don’t seem to know how to make very many cocktails. We had drinks at Hotel 1898 one night and had a completely different (and better) experience. - Front desk, although friendly, is not going to go out of their way necessarily; I came down with a bad sinus infection the fourth day we were there. My partner went down to see what they could do for us or if they could let us know what to get from the pharmacy (we spoke only basic Spanish). They pretty much just told him to go the pharmacy and offered zero additional help. Also, when we asked for restaurant recommendations, they were the same 3 places in all the basic guide books – no really insider information. - Certain small inconveniences: There are no wine glasses or openers in the room; and you can’t request one because, as they told us “they only have one” at the hotel; so you must call room service, have someone come up, and open your wine. Wireless internet in the room is 5euro a day. Again, you can’t just log on, you have to go downstairs and get a user name and password. Small things, but many hoops. We enjoyed our stay. I would definitely entertain staying here again, and would recommend it, based on what the traveler was looking for. But in my next trip to Barcelona, I will probably try staying somewhere else first. I liked Hotel 1898 from what I saw. It offers balcony rooms, a full bar on the rooftop and much more seating; the pool isn’t as spectacular, nor is the location on La Rambla, but I’d probably give it a try. Good places to visit in the hotel area: - Cat Bar: Vegan and beer bar; open late - La Locanda: if you get tired of tapas, try the Italian food here. The pizza and lasagna are fantastic - Gilda by Belgious: Our favorite restaurant. Small, hip and delicious, with great service - La Cervateca: Hip beer bar – one of the only there, with a great selection and cool vibe - Vincon: For shopping on the Passage di Gracia Happy Travels!

Reviews.Title: “In Barcelona wtihout a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Guto J
Reviews.Content: I made my reservation, in the Official Website of the Hotel 45 day's before my Trip, and when I get there in a 240,00 Euros a day, for my surprise I didn'd have a room, you know why??? Because the organization of the Hotel falied!!! For my Surprise a received today a e-mail to qualify my staying... so it's up to you I'll never in my life gonna try to book in this hotel, imagine in the end of your trip, tired 22:00 by the evening, you get the Hotel and someone say we don't have your room, because we fu... it, and the really don't know that happen's cause they sent me this mail!!! It's a totally desorganization, imagine staying at the Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Laraine8
Reviews.Content: We were here for one night before leaving on a cruise. I loved this hotel so much I almost didn't want to leave! After flying all night and arriving at 10AM, it was a nice surprise to be able to get into our room to leave our luggage and freshen up. The room was spacious and had a mini fridge with cold water, juice and 2 small bottles of champagne. Urko at the front desk was wonderful in directing us to get started on our exploration of the city and the location was only 1 block away from a stop of the HOHO bus. Well situated near Las Ramblas and its alleyways, (and, with a Starbucks on the corner for a cold Frappucino) returning to the hotel was a nice relief from the crowds just a block or 2 away. I only wish we had been there longer to enjoy to rooftop pool and bar. The views were terrific.

Reviews.Title: “michel.martin@skynet.be”
Reviews.Author: K-ZA
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights in Gran Hotel Central. Room: Very nice, very clean and very very quiet. The rooftop lounge and swimming pool are a delight. Special thanks to all the friendly people at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: abc10
Reviews.Content: Can't fault this hotel for comfort, cleanliness and value for money. The staff are excellent and the location is ideal. The hotel looks over the Cathedral and the Rambles is a 5 minute walk. Breakfast is great if it is included in the room charge but I wouldn't pay extra for it, there are lots of cafes locally.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter J
Reviews.Content: We had 3 days here in August and the hotel was a significant factor in us enjoying our first visit to Barcelona so much. The location is ideal. Staff were very helpful. The room was very large with a very modern but appealing decor. Price was probably a bit more expensive than we had paid elsewhere in Europe but was still fair value. I thought the restaurant was superb both at breakfast and dinner. The pool is a nice feature but is dominated by smokers.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect..has everything!”
Reviews.Author: L0rraineS
Reviews.Content: We've just spent 5 fantastic nights at this perfect hotel. From the moment you walk in you notice the calming ambience which is a wonderful contrast to the busy city outside. The room was large with lots of extra touches, a cotton bathrobe, Rituals products, fridge stocked daily with water, a coke, an orange juice and a couple of chocolates with the pattern of the Barcelona pavement stones on, and a Hotel Central bag which was handy to take items up to the rooftop pool. The rooftop is an amazing place to relax, sunbathe and have a drink either before or after sightseeing, has amazing views and is such an experience to be up there. If I was going to be picky at all it can be a little noisy at night when your trying to sleep, apart from the city noise and traffic you can hear the subway trains that run underneath the hotel, just take some earplugs if your a light sleeper and it really is the perfect hotel, in a great location with friendly staff and the atmosphere that while your staying there you are special and deserve all the luxuries this hotel has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “NICE BUT NOT GREAT”
Reviews.Author: Barbara S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Barcelona at the Grand Hotel Central after our Iberian cruise. It was very hard to follow the experience we had (which was fabulous) on the Regent Seven Seas cruise line, but that's for another review. We had spent one day on tour from the ship and went to a lovely winery in the hills of Barcelona. Then we stayed on for 3 more days at the Grand Central. It was located in the Gothic City area which was very well situated. The staff was very nice but we found the hotel to be a bit dark. The hallway was dark, the rooms were dark, the lobby was dark. The rooms were okay, nothing special. One thing we did find outrageous was that we wanted some ice, which they brought up (none in the hallway as in other hotels) and we were charged about 5 euros for it. For ice??? There is a rooftop pool area which was very nice. Our plan was with breakfast which was not really great. We had to pay for one breakfast because we checked in early. It was expensive for such a poor selection of food (buffet only). The rooms were clean with electric window shades. On the whole we didn't love Barcelona -except for the Gaudi buildings and church which were amazing. The other negative about the city was that we were warned over and over to beware of pick pockets. Everytime we went out it was always with extra caution especially on the Las Ramblas which was nice but very crowed. We did fall victim to being pick pocket on a very quiet residential street. BEWARE if you are standing under a tree and you feel something wet on your back and realize it's was a pigeon doing his job, only to have a very nicely dressed man come out of a very nice apartment building offering you help you with some water to clean you up. He also helped himself to some money in my husband's pocket. So needless to say I know this can happen anywhere, but it did leave a bad taste in our mouths. If you do go to Barcelon stick to the Gaudi exhibits and you only need about 2 days there.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: StefanAnn
Reviews.Content: The hotel has comfortable, clean, modern and large rooms. Breakfast is very tasty and nice (fresh fruits, juices, sandwiches...) Friendly and welcoming staff.The location is perfect for visiting the city: within walking distance from the cathedral, the shore, shopping area, Plaza Catalunya and La Rambla. The rooftop terrace is great: looking over the city, with a nice swimmingpool (but cold water in the middle of July?), free towels, and all that in a relaxing and loungy style. (too bad the bar closes at half past midnight) We'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and centrally located in the Gothic District”
Reviews.Author: drseimdc
Reviews.Content: The Grand Central Barcelona is a super modern hotel located in the heart of the Gothic District of Barcelona within walking distance of the Picasso museum, the archaeological ruins of Roman Barcelona, and the underground. The rooms are clean, the staff is multi-lingual, and the rates are reasonable. The restaurant serves great food too. There is an infinity pool on the top floor which is small but has a great view of the skyline of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kikaa
Reviews.Content: Very well situated hotel, with great staff, clean and comfortable rooms and relaxed pool and lounge are. Also great view over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, modern hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: grifflin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night at the end of a cruise. We were happily surprised by the beautiful modern decor. The room was perfect, the bed very comfortable. We didn't have time to visit the pool bar or the pool but they are also beautiful, the view from the roof is great. The location was also wonderful, lots of great restaurants within walking distance. We were a little shocked by the price of breakfast--50 EU for 2 adults and 1 child, so it would be worth going to a cafe instead.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in centre of old Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: LondonJohnsy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my kids in August 2011. Great service, smart trendy rooms and public spaces, friendly staff and enjoyed the roof top terrace and bar. Location in Bari Goti perfect for site seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: MMas9
Reviews.Content: There were many, many more positives than negatives with our stay, and I would certainly recommend it to others visiting Barcelona. Location: Just can't be beat. Right on the edge of the Gothic quarter, walking distance to Las Ramblas/La Boqueria, 1.5 blocks to the nearest subway stop, and walking distance to Barceloneta and beach Staff: very helpful, always courteous, and each made an effort to help with my spotty Spanish. They also provided us with a great map and a few recommendations for authentic Catalan Cuisine. Rooms: Our room was large - especially by European standards - , clean, well decorated, and comfortable. We booked something called an Executive package, which is an upgrade that includes a couple extras in the mini-bar, larger room, two complimentary ironed pieces of clothing, free wifi, free breakfast, etc... Overall, we were very pleased with the room and we got great sleep while we were there. The hotel itself was great and had a nice hip vibe about it - and as others have stated - the rooftop pool/bar is great. Small negative - the breakfast included with the room was not very good. Overall, a really great stay and a great base to explore an awesome city from...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, great hotel and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: srchughtai
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, my third visit to Barcelona and my second time here, stylish and chic hotel, fantastic location, for the gothic and bonn districts, the beach, shopping, galleries and a 20 minute taxi ride to the airport. I would certainly recommend this place

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Sebi_11
Reviews.Content: Took my boyfriend to this hotel as a treat for his birthday for a mini-break weekend and we were both very impressed. The location on this hotel certainly says it in the title. Fantastically central, we walked everywhere. The room was spacious with a very large bed, electric blackout blinds, flat screen TV and the bathroom was equally as spacious. The roof top bar was a lovely way to start the evening and watch the sun go down over the city. We didn’t eat in the hotel or order breakfast as there are so many café’s and restaurants on your doorstep you are spoilt for choice. The front desk staff were wonderfully helpful. We asked them for directions and they drew the best way to walk in the pocket map provided by the hotel. When we arrived at the restaurant it was actually closed (some are on a Sunday all day) and we let the front desk know for future reference. They then very kindly sent up a bottle of bubbly as an apology which was a lovely touch. The pre-booked taxi did not arrive and the front desk hailed one and had them waiting to take us to the airport. The location, surrounding areas and service of this hotel is 5* and we will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: RICHARD H
Reviews.Content: We had a standard room which was much larger than you would expect in many hotels. Facilities were excellent - free soft drinks in minibar,bathrobes,flip flops, motorised blinds, DVD, flat screen tv.powerful hairdrier etc etc. Room was spotless and well appointed. Bed was huge and very comfortable.Large bathroom with vanity area separated from shower/bath area which is always useful as mirror doesnt get all steamed up. Staff were first class and extremely helpful. Security good as room pass required to operate lifts.Roof top terrace swimming pool and bar was an added bonus with infinity pool overlooking views of Barcelona. Here they played easy listening chill out music which made for a relaxing visit whilst sipping cocktails day or night. Location in Gothic quarter couldnt have been better - 3 mins from cathedral,5 mins Las Ramblas, 5 mins Picasso ,2 mins Metro and right in middle of everything really. We have stayed in many hotels all over the world and found the standard and ambience of this hotel to be first rate and up there with the best. Michelin star Avelon restaurant in basement which looks excellent although we didnt eat there as there are so many good restaurants in Barcelona. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Finally comfortable in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: TorontoMom_11
Reviews.Content: This cool modern hotel is centrally located and the English-speaking front desk was very welcome and appreciated. We don't speak Catalan and had struggled in a few situations over the week prior in Spain. Staying here felt so easy - they quickly helped us with our bags and arranged dinner reservations in their excellent restaurant called Avalon. The buffet breakfast in the restaurant made this first meal of the day so much easier given we have two children - normal food! And they helped us arrange our transportation to the airport when we left. The rooms were quiet and the beds were comfortable. The rooftop pool and bar were populated with young hipsters (we used to look like that 20 years ago, really!). We enjoyed our refreshing swim with the kids even though I felt a bit older than the crowd. My only complaints are that there was limited seating since the rooftop space is small and they were not serving items on their All Day Menu. The hotel front doors are right on the street so you need to hold up traffic while you unload your suitcases, but the porter was right there in a flash. When we said we were departing early in the morning, before they started serving breakfast, they packed us a breakfast to go which we ate in the airport. If you like a cool vibe, no matter what stage of life you are at, this is a great choice when touring the Gothic District and waterfront of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “First class!”
Reviews.Author: ijdwright
Reviews.Content: I cannot praise this hotel highly enough. I booked a surprise trip to Barcelona to propose to my girlfriend and the hotel were so helpful before the trip, arranging champagne to be delivered at a certain time and had upgraded our room to a suite without asking as they knew why we were there. The junior suite managed to be minimalist in design whilst remaining 'cosy'. The staff were terrific and the location is excellent, allowing you to explore the tourist sites on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Jason T
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading a host of reviews on this website, both good and bad. After staying here I felt compelled to share my experience. I leisure travel relatively frequently and have stayed at a variety of places ranging from little hotels to bed and breakfasts. I have to say that I really enjoyed my stay at the Grand Hotel Central. The complaints I reviewed online here were very trivial once I observed what the review was pointing out in reality. The hotel is very modern in design. The rooms are realitively spacious with digital televisions and a VERY comfortable bed. Things are designed with style in mind and things like dim lighting, IPOD docks and sleek bathroom doors set a really relaxing and contemporary vibe. We stayed on the third floor....noise was not an issue at all like I had read about from some of the reviews, although I can only speak about the third floor. The rooftop pool was never truly crowded either. The sunrise and sunset are worth getting up on the roof for and relaxing with a drink poolside overlooking Barcelona is worth the price by itself. The fitness facility is just that...a place where you can catch a light, maintainance workout while you're on travel...it's not a gym...nor does it need to be. It's efficient. Internet they charge for in your room, however downstairs exist two computers with FREE internet access that no one ever uses. They also have a little library, which is a nice touch. Breakfast is a rip off BUT they offer you a much better breakfast rate when you arrive which isn't as unreasonable. You do not have to buy breakfast if you don't want. What makes this hotel worth it is the design the pool and the FRONT STAFF. It was one of the best staffs I've experienced ever. They were helpful, hospitable and literally assisted me on SEVERAL occassions (this was three to four DIFFERENT employees) with getting around the city and pointing out things to do on a map. It took them 15 minutes out of their day each time and they were fantastic! I cannot express enough how great they were. I wish I could remember each staff member's name, but it's immaterial because all of them were equally great. In addition, the hotel is ideally located on Via Laietana, which is at the heart of the city....great location to start your day. Would definately recommend to a friend...price is decent, not spectacular, but the staff is amazing, the pool is great, location is ideal and it's clean and shiekly designed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: AGFrench
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our 4 night city break. It is in a perfect location for exploring the sights of Barcelona and has the added advantage of the roof top pool. The rooms are spacious, clean and very well maintained and the staff are all extremely helpful. Free soft drinks in the room and good quality bathrobes are an added bonus. We did not eat in the restaurant as there are so many wonderful places close by. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, great location, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: shiraz14
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely. The rooftop pool is amazing! It really is a great plus, overlooking the city in a clean, beautiful pool, only an elevator ride away. I also ate near the pool, the food was fantastic, up to the standard I would expect from such a great hotel. The rooms are big. It almost seems like three separate quarters by the way of the design. The shower was great, beds were comfy. I have no complaints whatsoever about this hotel and will recommend it to my friends and business colleagues without a doubt. I stayed at H10 down the street for the first half of my vacation and it was horrible compared to the Grand Central Hotel. Thank you Grand Central.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Ben_IoM
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from a 6 day trip to Barcelona and stayed at the Grand Hotel Central. Firstly, I have to say it was my first time visiting Barcelona and I loved the city, it has real character with so much to see, do and most importantly taste! The hotel was brilliant, it was like an oasis in the hot city and was an incredibly welcoming place to come back to after a day of sightseeing. The staff were really helpful and they gave us excellent local advice about anything and everything we asked about, so if you're not sure about anything just ask them and I'm sure they'll be more than happy to help. The rooms were really nice, well laid out and very comfortable. The rooftop pool is just incredible and has to be one of the coolest places in Barcelona, during the day its a great place to cool down with amazing views over the cities rooftops, by night its a classy bar where you can have a drink looking out over the lit up infinity pool at the city lights of Barcelona. If you want a seat in the day though make sure you get there early as seats are limited and it was quite busy in what I guess would be peak time. Overall a fantastic hotel in a brilliant city, for anyone considering it, I would thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, friendly and helpful employee. My Nr.1 recommendation for Barcelona!!!”
Reviews.Author: 474Michael
Reviews.Content: Easy to reach per train from airport and 2 stops with the metro. Or ~30euros per taxi. Supermarket ~30m, cash machine ~ 20m, Pool with the best view you can have. safe, cable tv, air condition, radio with ipod connection,... reception 24h, very friendly and helpful. we had a nice stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, courteous staff.”
Reviews.Author: Suydam
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay. The staff were helpful, the rooftop bar was enjoyable (but very crowded) and the rooms were pristine. We would stay again in a heartbeat. This is Europe, so the rooms were small for the price compared to American standards, but compared to other places we've stayed in Europe, they were in line. We didn't try the restaurant and breakfast seemed very expensive. A tip: Just walk around the corner from the hotel to the Santa Caterina market for breakfast under 5 euros. My only knock was the pool. It's beautiful, but small and crowded. It was hard to get a chair or a seat, and half the people on the deck were just there in full dress reading a book and having a beer which made swimming feel a little weird.

Reviews.Title: “"Amazing rooftop, great service and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: vanessa p
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i loved this place and would happily stay again.Location was perfect, quite central, only less than 10min walk from El Born and close to Passeig de Gracia for some awesome shopping. The rooftop pool and bar is incredible, we stayed there for a little during the day, looks even better at night. The staff were very efficient, polite and happy to help. This hotel is a must for any travelling to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Phoebels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Grand Hotel Barcelona for 5 days prior to our cruise holiday. We had a family suite for our family of four. The room was very luxurious and modern. The location of the hotel is perfect, near many of the main tourist spots and very close to the subway and tourist bus stop. The service was great and we just loved the rooftop pool. The restaurant is top class and serves excellent tapas. We initially thought it was quite expensive but once we visited a few other restaurants we realised it was actually quite reasonably priced. Breakfast was included in our rate and it was excellent. If i have to be critical, i would list the fact that i had to pay 5 euro a day for wifi internet and most disappointingly, the service at the pool bar was consistently poor. Hotel staff in general very friendly and helpful. Even allowed us to store our luggage with them a week later when we returned from our cruise. I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone that wants something a little special, not just your normal hotel. Hope to be back one day.

Reviews.Title: “really good”
Reviews.Author: yasmina_dekkiche
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our journey during a week in this hotel. The staff is very nice, they do all what they can to make you feel happy and confortable. The restaurant is very good and cheap. Eating outside is expensive and sometimes not good and dirty. The rooms are silent if you are not on the via Laeitana. The mini bar is free so you always have cold bottles of water. The rooms are large but it is gloomy inside. The fitness is good. The swimming pool is incredible but if you want to seat, arrive early in the morning. For sure I would come back to this hotel if I went again to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but don't come for the gym”
Reviews.Author: JoannaTUk
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for a week and overall we had a fantastic time, however there were both good and bad things about the hotel: Good things: The staff were very friendly, helpful and attentive, the room was great - lots of space, very clean with some great extra touches like the ipod docking station and the free soft drinks in the mini bar, the breakfast (best scrambled eggs i have ever had and really nice spanish omlette), the location - ideal, we could walk everywhere we wanted to from here - it was also quiet and we got a good night's sleep which I know isn't always the case in central city hotels Bad things: The most disappointing part of this hotel is the fitness center. The photo on the website makes it look much bigger than it actually is but the main problem was the lack of any functional air conditioning - almost every day it wasn't working and even when it was working you could barely tell it was on - there also was no access to water in the gym - the combination of no air conditioning and no water makes for a very unpleasant workout and one which could actually be quite dangerous if someone overheats.
