There was not enough cardio equipment to cater for all the people who want to use the gym, especially early morning and early evening and there were no free weights. One of the bikes was broken in a way that was dangerous (the seat wouldn't stay in the position it was adjusted to so it would just randomly collapse when you were using it). We complained many times about the gym during our stay - the staff were sympathetic but nothing was done to improve it - however they did give us a reduction of our bill when we explained the situation at the end. Other things which could be better include the TV in the room which only has one English channel (the BBC news) and the restaurant which lacks in vegetarian options.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and therefore we came back”
Reviews.Author: 2052781Diane
Reviews.Content: The hotel smells lovely. The food is delicious. The service on the top roof is marvelous, so we enjoyed very much our stay. Again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: WRR_Bris
Reviews.Content: This hotel made our first stay in Barcelona very enjoyable. First up. the location between the Gothic Quarter and El Born is perfect. Both areas have lots of restaurants and attractions. The metro service is very close to the hotel as well. The roof top pool and bar are lovely and provide a scenic view over the rooftops of El Born. Our room (no 604, a superior king) was well appointed and we certainly could not complain. As with any hotel there are probably rooms that aren't so ideal, but level 6 seemed ok to us. I would probably recommend not to stay on level 7 near the gym or restroom as this could get a little noisy. The staff are very friendly and helped us when our spanish faulted. Special mention to Raul on the front desk who gave us some great advice when we first arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but with some problems!”
Reviews.Author: julesrules9969
Reviews.Content: My family and i stayed here across three rooms(2 per room), and for the most part had no problems. My room, on the other hand, was problematic from the start. The first time i walked in there was a pungent smell of smoke. This was manageable though, because within 5 minutes i was used to the smell and it no longer bothered me. The real problem started when it rained heavily on july 30. The windows had been open on arrival, probably to air out the smokey smell, but i closed them and thought they were actually shut. In reality they were actually unlocked and still easily pushed open. Long story short, everything got wet. At least they moved me out quick.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: AnnaG65
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms were nice and clean. Breakfast was good. Very centrally located. Walking distance to La Rambla, shopping, tour bus stop,restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: carolinedaly
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location. The rooms are small and very modern. The sound proofing of the rooms is not very good. THe pool area is lovely and relaxing, view is better at night than in the day. Drinks are expensive 10 euro for a vodka and tonic. Staff were very friendly, I only had bar food which was good. my friends lost a watch, bracelet and phone at different times and all were handed in. There are pc's and printers available behind reception. Towels are provided for the pool, haid dryer in rooms. Rooms are very dark so it is easy to sleep in (if you don't mind the noise of banging doors). We are already planning a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Special touches make it worthwhile”
Reviews.Author: MissSydney
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here two nights, very special touches that make this hotel a cool place to stay. it's very slick, and is a serious looking hotel, so I felt a bit disconnected to being across from the Catedral, and just up from El Born, but no matter...enjoyed it nonetheless. The roof top bar and pool view is a jumble of new and old architecture which you could look at for hours. The bed is super comfortable, we had an executive room which was huge, and had some lovely muffins and cava free of charge, so pretty special. There is also a cool trinket in your room safe...this made me smile. Also pleasantly suprised with the laundry charges. The hotel also supplies you with things to do in Barcelona in a small, easy to carry book...bonus Breakfast is included, and I am sad to say I missed it both days :(, but my friends say it was fantastic A little bit pricey, and no free WIFI, but well done GHC

Reviews.Title: “The rooftop pool/lounge is my favorite perch EVER”
Reviews.Author: reneelsb
Reviews.Content: Excellent! If we get back to Barcelona I will book here again without looking at another hotel. The staff was excellent - very helpful with tracking baggage the airline had lost, with restaurant recommendations, help with our 15 month old. The hotel is sleek and modern, you wouldn't think "baby" when you arrive but the staff all seemed to love our little guy. There were always staff in the lobby to help. The location is excellent - close to shopping, restaurants, metro. Again with the baby, the hotel is located next door to an organic grocery for baby food, milk, etc. We walked to Eixample, Barceloneta, and the Metro is very near for further beyond. Location is so perfect to wander through the Born area in the evenings. And the rooftop lounge/pool tops it ALL!

Reviews.Title: “WARM DRINKS, COLD FOOD AND SLOW, MOODY STAFF - WILL MOST CERTAINLY NOT BE BACK!”
Reviews.Author: patsy2plc
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel - 4 adults and 2 teenage children, based on its inviting brochure showing a beautiful pool, cocktail bar and great location. Well, location was very central with everything easily accessible and when we checked in, the reception area and reception staff did not disappoint. On entering the corridors / rooms, the lighting was very poor ( my sister walked into the door handle as it was practically invisible to the naked eye!!) but the beds and bathroom seemed clean and comfortable, if somewhat spartan. However, unbeknownst to us, these were to be the only plus points of our stay.......... The pool and "cocktail bar" are nice to look at but with nowhere near enough space for the hotel guests to sunbathe or even enjoy a glass of cava - which if you ordered, would be 10 minutes in the making, by an abrupt and unhelpful waitress, and be served at room temperature, without fizz. Same for any soft drinks - they were stacked ON TOP of the fridge, nicely warming in the sun - and when they ran out of stock, they didnt bother to replace it - even every day things such as coke light and sparkling water! (which they could have brought up from the bar on the ground floor, but obviously couldnt be bothered doing). Other drinks mishaps include ordering 2 panaches - they only had enough beer for 1; ordering a premium vodka -to be told they had run out and only had an obscure cheap brand (unless we went downstairs) and finally, on deciding to try some of the bar snacks, noticing that the whole bar top and preparation area were crawling with ants!! Needless to say, we steered clear of the pool bar after that!! Breakfast was another disgrace, again attended by unsmiling abrupt staff - an offering of cold eggs, greasy bacon and grey sausages, along with warm orange juice and water. There was a decent selection of cereals and fruit, but these were cleared away by around 10.50 a.m., even though reception state breakfast is served from 7 til 11. To top it off, the exit from the elevator into the restaurant was blocked by a maintenance worker painting the surrounding wall - at 9.30 in the morning, right in the middle of service. In summary, dont waste your hard earned cash on this hotel - its all show and no substance.

Reviews.Title: “Not so "grand", very "central" & be aware of Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: MartiniWarsaw
Reviews.Content: We (I & my husband + my mother) stayed at Grand Central for 5 nights (29.06.-04.07.2011). We wanted celebrate our 9th wedding anniversary in Barcelona. Having read a number of Tripadvisor members` reviews, we had chosen Grand Central. The location. Very Central! Very close to the underground and so many Barcelona sightseeing attractions. The reception. When you enter the hotel, you get a good impression. Modern, spacious but cosy. Nice and helpful staff. Very needed, especially when you have to get off a taxi straight from the bus/taxi lane. The rooms. Not very bright, as many other reviewers had written. It didn`t bother us much. You do have neighbours when you live in the centre. The rooms were equipped with everything you needed (we don`t really use hotel toiletries; just afraid of allergies). As long as the room is clean (it was), the towels are snow-white (they were), the soap to wash your hands is provided(once we started using the first bar of soap, the next one was given on the fourth day...), a bathrobe (you have to ask for it), a pair of slippers (were provided) and maybe some other extras (like cotton buds, cotton pads or mouth wash), we are happy. The extras weren`t provided (the hotel is a 4-star). A pair of flip-flops were supposed to do the job of ordinary slippers. I hate all the flip-flops in the world but the hotel didn`t know that... I have to admit that the flip-flops were very useful when we wanted to use the hotel swimming-pool on the roof. We stayed on the second floor we could hear the underground trains. But that didn`t bother us. One more thing. Because the bathroom is almost an integral part of the room, it`s almost impossible to use the bathroom at night and not to wake up the other person. The roof. Great view! No matter what time it was, always fantastic! But the roof it self is far too small for such a hotel. If you really want to enjoy the roof, you have to start doing it just after breakfast. But if want to relax on the roof after sightseeing Barcelona some time in the late afternoon or after dinner at night, you must be really lucky. There were also people who weren`t staying at the hotel coming for a drink up to the roof bar. How did they get there, if one has use their hotel card in the lift (?). The people we saw didn`t walk up the stairs, for sure! I don`t mind other people using the hotel facilities under one condition: the hotel guests are the priority. Everything would be ok, if the hotel had a lobby bar. But unfortunately, it didn`t. And the mini bar in your room doesn`t provide any alcoholic drinks (but what`s the fun having a drink in your room?!). The breakfast. It was just fine. Nothing very special but also nothing to complain about. Good choice of food, everything fresh and tasty. We just had breakfasts in the hotel restaurant. There are really lots of nice places to eat out in Barcelona. The last thing about the city, not the hotel. Be aware of thieves! There is no place in Barcelona you can feel safe. We`ve never been to a place like that. We travel quite a lot to very different places. There were times I felt uncomfortable, but never unsafe. Until I visited Barcelona! Such a great place to see, amazing architecture, really good food and wine. But the feeling of constant threat is able to spoil everything. You can get robbed or even mugged while walking in the street. You don`t have to be careless to experience the bad things Barcelona has to offer. We were walking after an early dinner (it was around 9p.m.) back to the hotel. Two guys on bikes just grabbed my mother`s handbag and that was it! Because there was just some money in the handbag, we didn`t bother to inform the police (they didn`t want to come to the hotel and the nearest police station was really far). Of course, it wasn`t the hotel`s fault that my mother got robbed but nobody asked a single question how we were the next day. We were their guests. What you expect from your host? A liitle sympathy. I guess. Anyway. I can say that what happened to us can be called "a complete Barcelona experience".

Reviews.Title: “Very 'Grand' but also rather expensive”
Reviews.Author: Arlene945
Reviews.Content: We had a good experience at the 'Grand Central' Hotel. We found the roof-top pool and view of Barcelona stunning. The rooms were clean, quiet and modern but the passages were too dark for my liking. The service was polite, helpful and efficient. The renowned on site restaurant despite its acclaim to fame was nothing out of the ordinary and the service was patchy - not worth the service charge levied. Grand Central is very central. It is opposite the beautiful Barcelona Cathedral, close to the open-top city bus tour bus-stop (this is most worthwhile and highly recommended as well as making financial sense) and to Picasso's magnificent museum as well as some eateries and the metro station. ( Please note that Frommer's' guide has the wrong station listed - it's the next stop further on). We found it quite difficult to locate as it is in more of a business district and signage is minimal (discreet). I would recommend the Grand Central Hotel but it's not for the budget conscious traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, great service and close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: AmyMarie043
Reviews.Content: My friends and I LOVED this hotel. They were so helpful in telling us the tourist sites, bus tours, recommended amazing places to eat and were genuinely nice. You get a free drink on arrival to redeem at the pool bar (yes even a cocktail!) and another bonus was the two free computers in the Lobby which we used everyday - you can pay approx. 5 euro a day for wi-fi on your phone or laptop (our phone wi-fi didn't work in our room, only the Lobby). The hotel is very clean and so close to everything you need to see. The rooms have a shutter that blocks the sunlight and the beds literally cuddled us to sleep!!

Reviews.Title: “Great in every way”
Reviews.Author: Scubatoo
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about the hotel; breakfast, service, rooftop pool, location, location, location. Had dinner at hotel's restaurant, Avalon, which was good too (will write separate review). Only minus (and I really hate this!!) is that you'd have to pay a few euros to get online apart from two nice IMacs in the business centre. I can't believe why they do that. We paid 400 euro/night for a family room but had to pay 5 extra for the Internet. I'd much rather pay 405 for the room, then. Is there a Facebook-group for (hassle-)free Internet at all hotels of the world?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxing hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: dibrickell
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, very centrally located for the old part of the city, the marina, La Rambla etc. The atmosphere is very calm and tranquil, the rooms and all communal areas were very clean and facilities were excellent. The staff were very professional and helpful. If returning to Barcelona we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend - will be back soon.”
Reviews.Author: lucylou06
Reviews.Content: I cant praise this place enough.. the rooms were well designed, clean and fully equiped. The beds were super comfy, and the lighting, ipod alarm and electric blind were a nice touch. The sky bar is a definite must in the evening - super chilled sounds, with ambient lighting to really set the lux style of this hotel. But my favourite thing has got to be the smell of this place - noticeable as soon as you walk past the front doors - like cool fresh linen. AMAZING. And if it wasnt enough, its situated in the perfect place. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Chris56693
Reviews.Content: Love the modern yet comfortable decor, the staff is extremely helpful & friendly. Easy walk to many great sites. Rooftop terrace/pool area is exceptional!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Barcelona, incredible pool”
Reviews.Author: renusp
Reviews.Content: This is the best location in Barcelona. 3 blocks from Cal Pep, Born and very short distance to Picasso Museum and the Ramblas. Very nice staff, large rooms, we had a blast! The hotel pool is amazing, eventhough it was closed to hotel guests for two nights due to a couple of events the hotel was hosting ( a it of a bummer...) Also the subway goes right under the hotel and you can feel the vibration from time to time...

Reviews.Title: “We lucked into the perfect spot...”
Reviews.Author: gbnixon
Reviews.Content: Imagine flying 13 hours only to find your reservation fell through. Long story but an apartment rental agency didn't hold up their end of the bargain and we were stuck. We found the Grand Hotel Central while surfing the net IN Barcelona. Not quite the best way to do things. But to us it meant the courtesy of the staff, the comfortable, clean modern rooms and the beautiful rooftop pool were all the more appreciated. They've done an elegant modernization of a beautiful old structure. We found it to be a great jumping off location to explore the city. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good but could be better”
Reviews.Author: JG_Mitchell
Reviews.Content: Nice pleasant hotel in an excellent location, and I would stay again, but my experience could have been made substantially better in two main respects: Firstly, having booked my stay with the hotel directly, and not through a third party website (which would have been a slightly cheaper way of doing things), I was surprised to find that I was put in a basic room with a good view of a brick wall. What I had actually booked was a "free upgrade to a superior room", which I read on the website had excellent views of the city. This was an offer promoted on the Grand Hotel Central website, which I took advantage of and which the hotel failed to deliver. Upon complaining, the rather disappointing extent of the offered remedial action was free wi-fi for the first two days of our stay. We were told the hotel was fully booked and there was nothing else that could be done. Breakfast was my other disappointment. Considering breakfast for two cost the best part 50€, I found the staff rather uninterested in my dining experience. It wasn't that the service was bad - there simply wasn't any. Everywhere else I dined in Barcelona I received friendly, courteous and, above all else, interested service. If it had not been for these two disappointments I would have given the hotel 5 stars. Everything else about my stay was fine or excellent including the cleanliness of the room, the hotel's general appearance and ambiance, the facilities available and the excellent roof top bar (I'd hesitate before calling it a cocktail bar) and swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with excellent service and good location”
Reviews.Author: checkinoutplaces
Reviews.Content: My son and I enjoyed a great three night stay at the Grand Hotel Central. The hotel is very modern and chic. The rooms are spacious and comfortable and the pool and Sky bar are great amenities to relax and unwind after a day of sightseeing. The gym is area is a bit small but it has all of the machines you would expect. The staff at the hotel were very helpful. Check in and check out was quick and efficient. They also were very helpful with directions, restaurant recommendations, and sightseeing options. We will definitely go back here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and comfortable but roof terrace needs to be bigger.”
Reviews.Author: kate78London
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our anniversary and only stayed for one night before going on somewhere else. The hotel is in a fantastic location and boasts a great roof top infinity pool with city views. The pool however is pretty tiny and you have to get their early in the day to bagsy a space by the pool, otherwise you'll be hard pressed to find anywhere to lie or relax. The pool bar is really limited drinkswise and we looked for another bar in the hotel but were unsuccessful - we didnt ask though, so perhaps we missed it. The room was nice and very stylish but pretty spartan, certainly could have done with a few more frills. Beds were super comfy, staff were friendly, helpful and happy to suggest local restaurants and bars and there is loads going on in the immediate vicinity. All in all a nice hotel, probably wouldn't stay there again - the roof terrace with pool and bar was a selling point for us but in reality it is just too small with not enough space to relax unless you get there early enough. Nice and quiet at night though.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Roof Pool, Great Location, Stylish Comfortable Room, Improvement Needed on Internet, Newspapers, Breakfast/Coffee”
Reviews.Author: ellen49690
Reviews.Content: When I think of this hotel, I think of the lovely rooftop pool and the relaxed Spanish music, and sipping a sangria from the rooftop bar. The rooms are also very stylish and comfortable and the overall hotel ambiance is beautiful. The location cannot be beat- slightly away from the crowds of La Rambla yet very accessible to all of the best parts of downtown Barcelona from the waterfront to the Picasso museum to the Gothic center and La Rambla. A nice touch is the little refrigerator in the room with complimentary soda pop, juice, and water. I would definitely stay here again. My only disappointment was with some of the business amenities. There was only one copy of the Herald Tribune in the lobby and someone took it every day so no other guest could read it unless they bought one. A good hotel should have at least a few copies of each paper and many give a paper to each guest who wants it one. I also was disappointed by the internet fee being charged by computer and not room. I was traveling on business but had brought one other family member with me who had a computer as well. Even though we were paying an extra 50 euro for a roll away in the room and the 5 euro a day extra computer fee, being able to have two laptops connect to the internet from the same room cost double. In many hotels the internet is free, so after paying a daily rate of 5 euros that should suffice for a room as many people travel today with 2 lap tops. I also was disappointed that there was no coffee or tea available in the lobby or room for breakfast and that the hotel restaurant did not have an affordable continental breakfast menu. All of these make for a good business hotel to mix with the vacationing crowd. One felt that the hotel was trying to make a lot of money off of extras at an already pricey hotel. Nevertheless, I would definitely stay here again especially if on vacation. It was a lovely setting, location, and the beds and linens were top notch. I also appreciated the high quality room darkening motorized shades which helps with a wonderful sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service, Quality and Location”
Reviews.Author: sogle1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for the two nights prior to a cruise leaving from Barcelona. It was a wonderful hotel and the customer service was top notch. The room ws very nice and the roof top swimming pool, bar, and view provided a wonderful setting to deal with a little jet lag. The location was central with many resturant choices and the sightseeing was just steps away. The breakfast was very good. I would definitely book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: solflower_80
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over a short weekend trip with the girls. The hotel is very centrally located with an amazing roof top pool. We will definitely stay here again, although there didn't seem to be any a/c - the rooms got very hot and this was in March. We didn't stay in hotel much so didn't bother us too much. Staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fabulous....would certainly stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Genevieve23
Reviews.Content: Our experience at Grand Hotel Central was just marvelous! The staff, rooms, location and roof top pool exceeded our expectations. Centrally located to many of the intriguing sites of Barcelona...walking distance to amazing restaurants and museums.

Reviews.Title: “Sky bar is the perfect way to wind down after sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: sandy710
Reviews.Content: Great place. Great value. Bathroom is large but has opaque glass wall into room. If you turn on the light at night, the bedroom lights up. A bit weird. Otherwise great

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel in a great location, but on the noisy end”
Reviews.Author: Sonnenblume2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Grand Hotel Central with my 3 girlfriends in June. We had booked two double-rooms and ended up on the 4th floor. The design of the hotel is beautiful and the location in Old Town Barcelona couldn't be better. The rooftop bar is breathtaking and the beds are very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The only downside - and this probably isn't of importance to the party people out there - was that the walls are extremely thin. Starting 6 am my friend could hear the guy in the room next to her snore as if he was in the same bed and to me it seemed the vaccuum cleaner of the maid in the hallway was right in the middle of my room. Aside from the many "early" bird tourists who started getting up, taking showers and having (very interesting!) chats in the hallways. If you are up for a party weekend and don't mind the noise, you should be fine. If you are looking to get some rest / a combination of the two - you may want to either ask for a different floor (?) or stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, I'm sure I'll be coming back!”
Reviews.Author: sydfromsyd101
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in a central location with a great rooftop pool/bar area with amazing views over Barcelona rooftops. A few of the front desk staff could be more helpful but the rest of the staff are great. Tea/coffee facilities would be nice in the rooms, although the non-alcholic drinks are free, which is great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Room was a bit spartan.”
Reviews.Author: ruperthebear
Reviews.Content: The public areas of the hotel are beautiful I though the bar was great. I ate here for breakfast dinner and lunch (I was attending meetings in the hotel) and was extremely impressed with the quality of the food which was served in a pleasant room. My only quibble would be with my guest rooms. it was a good size but (although the hotel may claim it is striving for minimalist chic) I found rather spartan. I could imagine itgetting a bit depressing had I stayed there for any length of time. It was also not expeially well sound insulated from the corridor although the design of the hotel means that the corridors did not seem busy. Overall, however, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Eva9160
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Breakfast was a bit limited but very friendly staff and nice and clean rooms! highly recommandable!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Ateale162
Reviews.Content: Very modern, clean, spacious room and very comfortable bed. Staff were friendly and helpful without being fawning. Excellent location, close to airport bus and the bars and restaurants in lane ways. Didn't get chance to try rooftop pool as it was raining but it looked fantastic. Only downside was they do not provide kettle and tea/coffee in the room but they do provide free minibar including cava.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: LesleyandSteve186414
Reviews.Content: Great location - heart of city, with many areas of interest within walking distance; two metro stops close by. Superb staff - very friendly and helpful. Roof-top bar and pool is a great escape and place to relax. Rooms very clean and comfortable. Very hard to fault; would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Living the high life in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: CaroFace
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a surprise for a city break with my boyfriend after reading about the place years ago in a Conde Naste Traveller magazine. It is truly fabulous and highly recommended. The rooftop Skybar and swimming pool is the jewel in the crown at the Grand Hotel Central - forget sightseeing when you can relax and listen to chill out tunes and sip a bottle of chilled Cava! We had a superior king bedroom on the side street side of the third floor. There was no view, but had less road noise (as the hotel is on Via Laietana, one of the main roads in Barcelona centre). We could also here the metro trains a little bit too, but with the blackout blinds and mega comfortable bed, we still slept well! In fact, the beds are so big that if you want to move in for a romantic cuddle with your other half you practically need a GPS to find them! The hotel is also really well placed. A 10 min walk from the Aerobus stop in place Catalunya, right next to the metro, opposite the cathedral and round the corner from the Picasso museum. We preferred the intriguing Bron area and the park Citadella behind the hotel to the tourist traps of the Rambla and the Port areas. We would love to come back to this hotel in the future - we saw lots, but there's still so much to see and do in Barcelona and, of course, there's that rooftop view....ah such good memories!

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel and hope to go back...soon!”
Reviews.Author: bay_mel
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a city break (no kids!). The hotel is in a great location for all attractions. The rooms are minimalist and pretty spacious for what you need.. They have THE MOST comfortable beds ever and black out blinds - fantastic!! !! The staff are extremely friendly and helpful and make you feel very welcome. The rooftop pool and bar are just amazing and is a top spot to chill out in the evening with cool music and a nice drink!! The views are stunning! Whilst breakfast is a little expensive there are coffee shops and pattiseries on your doorstep for a cheaper option. Well worth the money and would return!

Reviews.Title: “Love the roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: LondonFDP
Reviews.Content: Had a very good time at this hotel. You can spend the whole day on the roof terrace relaxing by the (small) pool and getting drinks from the skybar, which is really the highlight of this hotel. The rooms were fine, but don't expect to sleep much in the morning as you are likely to be woken up by the noise of the cleaning staff in the corridor and doors slammed shut. But then again you can finish your night on a lounger on the roof, so you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Hotelfan69
Reviews.Content: My wife & I spent 2 nights here in March together with our best friends, we picked this hotel due to its location, which is indeed great, within walking distance of all major sights, the harbour and the shopping areas. Rooms are nicely decorated, breakfast wonderful, future guests do need to jump into their rooftop pool, I wanted to, but March still did not bring such suitable temperatures.......if we visit Barcelona again than we stay definitely here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: LadySPZ
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel; service was fabulous; room was beautiful, lovely sheets and linens, great decoration; very new, very clean and quite upscale; well worth the money. The restaurant in the hotel was also wonderful. The location is also wonderful; a very short walk to great neighborhoods like Bari Gotic and Born; La Rambla was only 5 mins away and the Metro was very close as well. Terrific place!!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch staff, clean, modern accomodations in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Quarry42
Reviews.Content: Staff were very welcoming and extremely helpful offering many good restaurant and touring suggestions. Would stay here next trip. Barcelona is a loud, bustling city and this hotel was our oasis. The rooftop pool and deck were an excellent place to recharge our batteries after a busy day of walking through Barcelona's many beautiful sites.

Reviews.Title: “Gotham City in centre of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: garyfollows
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hotel Central for a week of sight seeing and shopping with a friend of ours. Rooms are very minimal and bespoke with the vanity area of the sink central to the room (we actually liked this). As we were there in the height of Summer we were thankful that the air conditioning was a good as the decor. During our week there we were 'reassured' that the look and feel of the design, service and furniture was on par with what we'd provide ourselves at our home apartment. The public areas are very spacious and roomy, the staff know Barcelona. Even making recommendations. (one of which was a restaurant called 'The Big Fish' simply amazing we eat there twice in a week, even cancelling reservations elsewhere to return) Worth pointing out that whilst we stayed there one of the two lifts was out (OK this could happen anytime) and the roof top infinity pool is amazing and stunning BUT BE WARNED it is very small and not big enough to accommodate all of the guests wanting to swim, tan and chill out to the Cafe Del Mar piped music. Some guests even went as far as to leave their towels on sun loungers before breakfast to guarantee a space (not good) also as its a City centre hotel the small pool was full of children splashing and screaming and this spoilt the luxe atmosphere of chill for us on this supposedly 'roof top oasis'. That said when we next return to Barcelona we would always list this hotel as a possibility.

Reviews.Title: “Will comme back.”
Reviews.Author: MaxB_11
Reviews.Content: Nice room very nice service. All was perfect. You have a beautyful view of Barcelona at the swimming pool

Reviews.Title: “Spanish Grand Prix - 2011”
Reviews.Author: Puddywat
Reviews.Content: I had the Grand Hotel Central recommended by a colleague in Barcelona and he did us proud. An excellent friendly hotel that is in the heart of the city just steps from the cathedral and only a short walk down to the harbour or Las Ramblas. I had read other comments about how dark the hotel is, and it is, but not in an intimidating way. Rooms are fine for Europe and the rooftop bar & pool offer an excellent view over the city. We were there for the Formula 1 - Grand Prix and the hotel allowed us to access public transportation easily as well as acting as a great base for walking around the city. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay Again -- Had to Write Another Review”
Reviews.Author: barca212
Reviews.Content: I just returned from an amazing stay at Grand Hotel Central for the second time. I have returned to many of my favorite hotels over the years, but this is the first time I am writing a second review for the same hotel. This place deserves it. During my visit, I was reminded again as to why I love this hotel so much. My room was fantastic (great view, spacious, extremely comfortable bed, wonderful bathroom and shower -- just a haven) and the rooftop bar and pool were a delight to spend time at any time of the day (with excellent food as well). BUT, it is the staff here that are simply the best. The entire team at the reception (Sandrine, Raul, Albert, Eva and Eva Lopez) were just outstanding. I know the city well, having visited several times. So it was not so much for recommendations, but more that the team always took the time to find out about my day, ask if I needed anything, help me when I wanted a reservation at restaurants I like and the list goes on. Extremely warm and always committed to making the guest feel at home. If one wanted recommendations for food or visiting sites/doing things in the city, they are very knowledgeable. I heard them help so many guests during my visit with an amazing array of options. My last night in Barcelona, I decided to eat dinner at the hotel's restaurant (Avalon). Highly recommend a meal here. It is by Ramon Freixa, a Michelin starred chef, and lives up to the expectation. Last, the location of this place cannot be beat. Just a great base for getting to any place in the City -- Eixample, Gothic Quarter, Barceloneta... I cannot imagine staying at another hotel in Barcelona. I know I will be back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel right in the middle of Barcelona, better than many 5 star hotels!”
Reviews.Author: AJRWATFORD
Reviews.Content: From the moment my wife and I arrived, we could not fault one aspect of the service. Front desk staff are the most attentive I have ever met. We stayed in a loft suite, which is basically a very large room with a huge super kingsize bed, and includes complimentary mini bar consisting of juice, soft drinks, water and Cava replenished daily. The most amazing feature of the hotel is undoubtedly the Sky Bar and pool on the rooftop. A great facility to soak up the sun and also unwind at the end of a day of sightseeing, or for a night cap after an evening out. Great during the day and really chilled at night. This is absolutely the only hotel I would ever consider staying at again in Barcelona. Absolutely stunning in every aspect. Would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, great staff, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: KSteg
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exceptional! The rooms were immaculate as were the bathrooms. There is an electronic blackout shade that makes sleeping even better than the comfy bed. The rooftop pool and bar offer a great view of the city and a nice place to relax. It is pefectly located for walking around the city. The staff were young and readily gave great advice for restaurants and night hot spots. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Super cool hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: denyse86
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel whilst attending the F1 Grand Prix. Here is our run down: The positives 1. The staff are great, Eva was very helpful and made our restaurant reservations for us prior to arrival. She also suggested some great places and marked them on a map for us when we arrived. 2. The hotel is clean and very stylish. I agree with what the other posters have said about the hotel being dark, however I think this adds to the atmosphere of the hotel. 3. We stayed in a superior room which was great with fantastic bathroom. 4. OUR FAVOURITE place to enjoy an early evening drink was the sky bar, its fantastic with the most amazing views across the city. 5. The location is amazing and within walking distance of most of the sites. Contrary to many posts on here regarding safety, we felt very safe in the area for which the hotel was situated. Negatives: 1. The Avalon restaurant was a huge disappointment. The staff are simply not up to it! We were left for a long time before we were even given a menu. The food was not good and there are plenty of other fantastic places to eat in Barcelona, I would give this a miss! 2. Whilst we loved the sky bar, it has to be said that cleanliness and organisation was not their strong point up there! All in all we had an absolutely fantastic trip and will certainly pick this hotel for our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Stines_Su
Reviews.Content: We visited BCN in May for three days and loved the hotel. The perfect location has been mentioned here very often - and it is really perfect. We were able to explore everything by foot and you really are in the middle of this fascinating city. The rooftop pool is awesome! We spent our lunch break there everyday and had something to eat from the menu - delicious food at a small price - couldn' t be better! We didn't have breakfast at the hotel so I can't say anything about that but if you want to explore the city there are plentys of cafes around where one can have delicious breakfast at a small price. The rooms are a bit dark as some already mentioned here but that is due to the hotels design and we weren't bothered by it. Beds are wonderful! The staff was very helpful and nice, I lost my earrings there and they really tried to find them and send them home to me. I was very happy about the effort they made. We were staying at the hotel from wednesday until saturday. On friday it got very crowded and on saturday they were fully booked as they told us - when we were at the rooftop bar on friday it was to be noticed that there were a lot of people in the hotel: there wasn't even any empty chair left. So if you are going on a leisure trip and want a relaxed atmosphere up there I would recommend to enjoy the rooftop on weekdays! Overall I would recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect mini break”
Reviews.Author: NinaSimone14
Reviews.Content: Thank You Grand Hotel Central for helping me and my husband to spend beautiful wedding anniversary !! We had great time and I definitely will come back to stay again ! And I want to recommend Grand Hotel Central to every one who is looking for nice relaxing time ( see Skybar )

Reviews.Title: “Gets the details right”
Reviews.Author: ATA01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Barcelona for a 3 day weekend in May and were thrilled with our hotel. The location in the middle of the old city was perfect for all of our plans - kept us close to the attractions, but we weren't surrounded by mobs of other tourists on the Ramblas. We were able to explore the center city on foot in all directions. Plus, it's within 2 minutes to a Metro stop which will take you anywhere Even better than the location, the hotel stands out in its attention to detail. A complimentary mini-bar, pocket map&guide, candles in the rooms, etc. The atmosphere is chic and relaxed at the same time, and the staff were friendly and knowledgeable. The hotel is pretty contemporary, so beware of lowly lit rooms, etc.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful Hotel in good location, Roof bar/pool fabulous”
Reviews.Author: oldertravelers2011
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Free Mini-bar, Free Wireless, Great location, across from the Catherdal. The Pool/bar on the roof overlooking the city is worth the price of the room, relaxed atmosphere. The room was lovely and the beds were great. We would go back in a minute. Staff was exceptionally nice

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: slb1891
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in central location. Easy to walk to beach, port, shops, Ramblas and all central attractions. Hotel very relaxing and staff were helpful whenever we had any queries. Loved the roof top bar and pool. Room was a double, not a lot of extra space but very comfortable room with everything as described. Breakfast was excellent . Had dinner in the restaurant one evening - lovely food but atmosphere was a bit too quiet for our liking and you are seated very close to next table, but still an enjoyable evening.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, friendly service, superb price/quality”
Reviews.Author: Danny_Nousch
Reviews.Content: Location very good, everything is in walking distance. Frontside is on a busy road, we had a room at the back wich was very silent. Good breakfeast. The restaurant Avalon is also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but oh so dark”
Reviews.Author: carrie63
Reviews.Content: Generally lovely hotel in excellent location. Small gripes: no wifi in rooms, rip-off breakfast, iffy service in hotel cafe bar. Big gripe: the tomb-like darkness of the rooms. I found it ok at first but by day three I was desperate for some light!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Room, Pool, Views but ... Awful Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Wizzywonder
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the hotel was very inviting, the reception staff were fantastic and very accomodating (we had a bottle of red wine in the room which they changed for white). The room was lovely, huge bed, very clean and fantastic views and then we went to the restaurant for breakfast the first of a 2 night stay ... it was terrible. what little 'hot' food was there, sausage, fatty bacon and dried fried eggs, were all cold with no facility to keep them warm or be replenished. the pastries were few and far between, the staff didnt speak english, the coffee was cold and this was only at 9am in the morning, not that busy in the restaurant so no excuse really ... if we had to pay separately then €22 for full breakfast would have been a complete rip off. Exactly the same the 2nd day so we didnt stay to eat, even less available to choose from and very unhelpful staff ... if you didn't want a cold fried egg then you couldnt get any other sort! very disappointing. The hotel overall was lovely but there was no-one on the roof terrace to get soft drinks or refreshments if you wanted something. Towels for use at the pool were few and far between but ... the breathtaking views and the cleanliness of the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Could not ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: LittleMissCaz
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as a surprise 30th trip for my boyfriend and was not disappointed! Upgraded to a deluxe room for free, so good value for money, complimentary cava on his birthday, staff ever so friendly, and an amazing view from our window! Brilliant location too. Will definitely go back, although probably wouldn't pay for a deluxe room! Exceeded expectations. Just a shame it wasn't warm enough to use the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: LancashireBells21
Reviews.Content: I echo everyone’s main sentiment – what an excellent location! Right opposite the gothic quarter and easy walking distance to most points of interest and/or the tourist bus. We arrived early but got a room straight away. It was a nice room but, if I was being picky, it was lacking that certain ‘wow’ factor. It was however always clean and the free mini bar was nice touch. Being open plan, loft style, you do need to go with your nearest and dearest as the glass panel doors (opaque) to the loo leave nothing to the imagination. The roof top gave splendid views although the roof top bar was never open. Also, the pool, whilst pleasing to the eye, was more of a plunge pool but what do you expect in a building of that age. We paid out for the hotel breakfast on the first day. Nice enough but we can’t eat 20 Euros worth of food. We saved our money and ate elsewhere during the rest of our stay. Have we stayed in four star hotels of better quality? Yes! So, would we stay there again? Definitely! Location! Location! Location!Oh! If you’re a restless sleeper, ear plugs could be in order as it is a proper city centre hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: missemar
Reviews.Content: This hotel was super! Unassuming from the outside, but modern and stylish inside. Room was clean and with all mod cons. Lights / air con took a bit of working out and I didn't like the fact you couldn't open the window but can see why as the noise from the Via Leitana would have been toooo much if the rooms hadn't been sealed! Pool was gorgeous although it was a bit chilly for a dip. Location was excellent - so central to everything! Breakfast also top quality but quite expensive; there are loads of places within a minutes walk that are half the price. Staff all extremely polite and helpful. Would go back. Oh! and excellent supply of free mints ....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location near the Busy La Rambla”
Reviews.Author: Charsue_bun
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only 2 nights, but it was a perfect location for our whirlwind trip around Barcelona. We was absolutley pleased with our choice of hotel and enjoyed our stay. The hotel is a 30 Euro cab ride from the Airport, handy if there are a few of you travelling, however there is a metro a stones throw from the hotel. Located in Vie Laietana, it is far from the busy hustle in La Rambla but close enough to walk to. It takes no more than 5-10 minutes to walk to La Rambla through little cobble stone streets and squares. We found a perfect square called Plaza Real right by La Rambla. It had a few restaurant choices and a fountain in the middle. Great for people watching. We had a triple room, which had an oddly placed bed right by the room entrance. Other than that the room was gorgeous and clean. The toilet and shower has a tainted glass sliding door separating from the room. One little problem, the room can get quite hot, woke up sweaty and hot and we had the temperature fan setting to the coldest it would go. I can only imagine how hot it gets in the Summer. I do really suggest you take the sightseeing bus which starts right by the hotel. You can get a discount at the concierge desk at the hotel. You can also walk 15 minutes from the hotel and head to the marina and to the beach. This hotel is in a great location and has excellent service. The staff were helpful and friendly and they have an amazing rooftop pool that over looks the city!! I would return to Grand Hotel Central.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hikemom
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a wonderful hotel in Barcelona with friendly, helpful staff, then this is the place for you. The hotel is very chic and modern and reminded me of some of the cool properties in South Beach, Miami. The roof top infinity pool is a special treat as is the amazing city view. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. A+

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel Central is the perfect fall out basis for a city trip.”
Reviews.Author: Witte_11
Reviews.Content: Luxurious, central location and service oriented. Grand Hotel Central is the perfect fall out basis for a city trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city break hotel in the best location for all sights and tourist spots”
Reviews.Author: LondonTomS
Reviews.Content: A fantastic view over the city skyline allows a strong g&t after a long day on the sightseeing busses following Gaudí's marvels from the rooftop hotel bar / swimming pool. Although the bar was closed in mar/apr staff drinks were available to take from the lower level bar. The hotel is situated in the heart of the gothic region, ideal fir every type of adventure. The best restaurants are 10 min walk, the liveliest bars are 10 min walk, the tour bus pickup is 5 mins, the beach is 10 mins, the cathedral is opposite...what more could you ask for If you are considering a city break this is ideal for couples or singletons no one it appears in Mr and Mrs Smith and has numerous awards to it's names...

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: simbratoo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely fabulous. We arrived earlier that our alloted check in time but were shown to our room immediately. We then checked out the facilities, good gym and to die for roof terrace with infinitely pool and amazing views of the city. Easily the best hotel we have stopped in on a city break and it didn't break the bank. We will be going back to Barcelona hopefully later this year and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “luxury and style .. well located...”
Reviews.Author: Lawyers-from-Leeds
Reviews.Content: Very smart hotel in a very good location. Expensive but worthit. Attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “fine for a pre cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: dreamvacation1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a little dissapointing to me, the pictures were a bit misleading but it was fine for one night pre cruise. The location was good within walking distance of many Tapas bars and the Gothic district but it just didn't blow me away. The price was right and it served its purpose, the staff was a bit standoffish which disturbed me. I would stay again pre cruise though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Moose97
Reviews.Content: A wonderful place in an excellent location. We had a triple room which was large enough for ourselves and 12 year old daughter. The criticism that I have was that the rooms were very warm. We had turned off our room heating but as the building was still centrally heated we were hot, we asked to open the window which they kindly did the down side of this was that the traffic noise and church bells were very lound resulting in not a great nights sleep! The rooms were also very poorly lit. The staff however were excellent, very helpful and knowledgeable and the breakfast was great. All in all a great place to stay, close to some lovely monuments and shopa and near a metro station.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant experience in hotel convenient for most attractions”
Reviews.Author: Pukeko54
Reviews.Content: Reception staff very pleasant and knowledgable. Rooms reasonable size and very modern. Hotel located near to Cathedral in Barri Gothic, 5 minutes from Placa de Catalunya, 1 minute from metro station, yet within walking distance of Barceloneta. Fortunately far enough from Rambla not to be disturbed. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Special hotel, albeit a bit dark…”
Reviews.Author: nafmo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not like all the others, it does have a special look and feel to it. We found the interior to be a bit on the dark side, though. It is definitely worth a visit, even if it is a bit on the expensive side. We were recommended by friends, and would gladly recommend it to ours.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff...a cool place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sjgildea
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat...the staff are very helpful, polite and have excellent customer service standards. The rooms aren't as sound proof as the website might lead one to believe. We asked to change rooms due to very loud street noise a few floors below on Via Laietana. The manager and staff couldn't have been more accommodating and professional. They changed our room immediately when we asked for a room away from the busy street noise. You do hear the metro running underground in the room, but you get used to it. The furnishings, decor and bathroom are very tastefully done. This was a tub made for relaxing and lounging for an hour or so! The bed was extremely comfortable. It's only a block or two away from the Jaume metro/train station and very walkable distance to La Rambla. It's around the corner from the Picasso Museum and a great location for getting lost in the tiny streets and wandering aimlessly. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great central hotel with pool”
Reviews.Author: KirstScotland
Reviews.Content: first impression was that the staff were rude - the reception staff appeared as if they were foing you a favour. The hotel is just across from the main square behind the cathedral so location was great. Rooms were small but functional. We didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment. There's a rooftop bar and small pool. Great for a city location. quite a chilled feel but noisy if there happens to be a group on holiday! The bar is lovely in the evening and very chilled and quiet with great views. Nice places to eat in the square and surrounding streets although we didn't feel particularly safe walking through the narrow dark streets. The harbour area is lovely with some upmarket restaurants - great food, a little pricey but it is Barcelona after all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern, clean hotel, service was excellent and helpful”
Reviews.Author: achatter53
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay, friendly welcome from the outset. Room was smallish but very clean and modern. Complimentary water and juice in fridge which was a nice touch. Free WiFi. Great location, very close to Cathedral but not too close to Ramblas - which was a bonus. Did not go for breakfast at the hotel as it was a bit pricey (around 20 Euro) but did have a coffee there which they did not charge us for (even though we asked to pay).. Rented the hotel bikes, heavy monsters due to the fact that they have a battery pack and are semi-motorised. Not for the proper cyclists but convenient. I think I would rent from Born Cycles next time.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel Central provides a perfect location and rooftop deck to enjoy Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: bethanyjb
Reviews.Content: Grand Hotel Central is perfectly located in walking distance to the harbor and the sea, lots of shopping and dining, picturesque markets and alleys, and just a few minutes walk from where the Aerobus drops off passengers from the airport. The hotel itself is clean, attractive, and well-staffed. While I appreciated the strong design of the hotel, I found it to be a bit too dark and dreary, especially considering that coming from London we were really looking to have a bright and sunny holiday. The hallways are quite dark and the room we had was as well. However, the beds were very comfortable, the shower was luxurious, the amenities were perfect and the two best things were 1) the beautiful rooftop deck with infinity pool and 2) the coffee in Avalon, the hotel's restaurant. I would stay here again, but would prefer if the hotel had a lighter, brighter feel to it.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service in a very relaxed environment”
Reviews.Author: CMG69
Reviews.Content: A fantastic location for exploring Barcelona and the hotel is wonderful and comfortable. Our children (teenagers) loved it and the staff were fantastic and helpful with all of us. The lifts are a bit of a pain - please can you get the stairs open. Otherwise a fabulous stay that was all made so easy.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eurokaz
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and modern and big for Europe. Only thing missing was a coffee maker to go with our free muffins each night (yes, left in your room with chocolates and the free Cava in the minibar!). The staff were helpful and friendly. Make sure you visit the pool even if it's not swimming weather - very cool! The location was great, and the tourist bus sto is opposite.

Reviews.Title: “Great long weekend”
Reviews.Author: AandB1950
Reviews.Content: Not a hotel for people who like to see magnolia everywhere, This is a modern design in a historical building which may not suit everyones taste but we found it peaceful and a relaxing atmosphere and enjoyed the design features of the hotel. The library the hotel has on architecture would leave some libraries miles behind. The guys on reception couldn't do enough for us with a brilliant attitude. The hotel was spotless and although I have stayed in bigger rooms all the space was used in the best way and was great and we were only there to sleep. Its the little extra touches that the hotel provides that help to make this hotel stand out from others. Although not open when we were there the roof top bar would be a great addition to the holiday. There is a small vibration from the metro which didn't bother us and to be honest most building we were in experienced this vibration as the metro branches out in all directions. We would recommend this to anyone who enjoys modern decor and needs a central location to explore the city as the metro is just 100 metres and buses and taxis pass the door. We certainly will return to the hotel when we come to Barcelona in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected......”
Reviews.Author: Clara025
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to a cocktail at the hotel's Skybar on arrival, but it was closed when we arrived although it didn't mention this on the hotel's website. The hotel looks nice but its much narrower than you'd expect and the sound proofing is terrible. We were woken at 5.20am on our first morning by the rudest, loudest inconsiderate bunch of people ever, who were slamming the doors non-stop, shouting and banging - so much so it was quite scary as to what was going on, and we had to call reception - thankfully they came up to our floor and sorted it out, but it wasn't a very pleasant start to our stay. The restaurant was closed during our stay, but breakfast was just ok - the amount of food choice was small and the buffet area a tight squeeze when all guests were trying to get breakfast. There's not much to obviously criticise about the hotel, other than to say it seemed to lack facilities, and the gym (although not used) was rubbish. The staff were realyl nice though.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful of your personal belongings!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tina1064230
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location, reception & foyer & roof top area very nice, but hallways very dark & scarey more suited to a prison.. Rooms quite small, we booked a room for 3 adults & we got a twin with an extra bed stuck in entrance passageway. We sayed on 6th floor & the noise from the underground metro very annoying also noise from wellness centre above us. The real problem my 2 friends experienced was personal items went missing from our room ( ie, expensive cosmetics), Althought after reporting it to management & a meeting with the head of cleaning they were reimbursed the cost. But the whole experience left us feeling very upset. The customer care from management on checking out was non existent. You are told to place your valuables in the safe but nobody would expect to have to put your cosmetics in there!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but a shame about basic design errors”
Reviews.Author: SaraBrussels
Reviews.Content: Hello, Here are the positive points about the hotel: - great location - really central! - good service - very nice top floor terrace - good breakfast (not too elaborated but ok) - cosy trendy place The negative points: - overall light problem (corridors, rooms, dining room) - the standard rooms are very small (you cannot move your chair while sitting behind the desk) - the biggest issue here is the design of the bathroom; no door or sliding door between room and bathroom; so no privacy at all (the toilet and shower are separate but still....) I think you need a minimum of separation. Annoying in the morning when you need to get up early - impossible not to wake up your partner! Or you need to get ready in the dark.... Hmmm... we did not like it! This is for sure not a business hotel. I would recommend a more functional hotel for this kind of purpose. I also would recommend you take the larger rooms. Don't hesitate to contact me if you have more questions! Cheers, Sara

Reviews.Title: “Dark and gloomy”
Reviews.Author: pinewood2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in Barcelona for 5 nights this past September. The hotel is excellently located for sightseeing and getting around Barcelona. It was very clean and the hotel staff was friendly and helpful enough. BUT the entire hotel is dark and gloomy...the walls are all painted a dark gray and the lighting is minimal. This may sound like it shouldn't be a big problem, but it is! The hallways are dark and creepy and you literally can not see anything in your room without a flashlight! We honestly spent more time trying to "find" things in our room than almost anything else we did there! It was just weird and annoying. The hotel management is aware of the darkness/ lighting problem and they said they are" working on it." My suggestion to them? Repaint the place and put in adequate lighting!

Reviews.Title: “Super cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: chris2222
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful experience with this hotel. The entire hotel is extremely cool, stylish and tasteful. Rooms are spacious and very clean. The hotel has a gorgeous lobby and library area and is located very centrally. This is surely my choice for all future stays in Barcelona. Service in the hotel is outstanding and I can warmly recommned this hotel to anyone staying in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent base for a visit to Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: TeamTW
Reviews.Content: Our four night stay - two adults and two children aged 2 and 11 - at the Grand Central was a great experience. The overall experience started well when we arrived and were taken through our family package details that included free entry to the acquarium, a guidebook setting out walking tours from the hotel and complimentary taxi transfer to the airport on our return journey. Oh yes, and the minibar contents - including juice, coke and cava - were on the house. The positive experience continued throughout the stay: the staff were friendly at all times and attentive when asked; the breakfasts were excellent - great choice and very fresh; the room was very quiet even though the hotel is on a main road; and overall cleanliness was faultless. The gym, while small, was well stocked, with plenty of towels and (free) water available. Another great part of the hotel was the library where you could have an espresso (free), read one of the many design books, or sit at the huge desk and work on your laptop - as many people did. The location of the hotel was really good - most of the city is walkable, even with children. We walked back from Montjuic one day - a long walk but one that meant we saw parts of the city off the tourist trail - and down to the waterfront another. There were some things that could have been improved: the pool is unheated so not a viable option in winter; the air con was too weak - the room was a little stuffy; and the room service we had one night was limited and portions were small - we went for the chicken, for example, and got just that - a big leg of roast chicken with nothing else at all! Oh yes, and the room we stayed in (a very comfortable suite on the top floor) had just one window, so natural light was very limited and, as in many hotels, electric lighting was more form over substance...oh yes, you have to pay for WIFI (though considering all the other free things on offer this is not a big deal) Overall, though, our stay was great - the hotel was very comfortable and the staff welcoming. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a super city”
Reviews.Author: engraver124
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated 6-7 minutes from the top of La Rambla and Catalunya Square. Our room was just like you can see on the hotel website with intersting lighting set ups and electric window blind switches complementing the modern theme of decor. The rooftop pool and terrace area was ideal to watch the sun go down and the city light up before going to find a place to eat. It was a pity that at this time of year they understandable have no bar operating, but we chose to ignore the signs about taking up our own beverages and enjoyed supping our Starbuck's coffee from the corner outlet down the street. The hotel restaurant was good for the price, but only for one of the three nights we stayed. Breakfast there was ridiculously pricey and after eating so late as they do in Spain we were happy to find a light breakfast in one of the many "hole in the wall" cafe's in the local side streets. The only problem encountered was the a/c control which for our room seemed to be stuck on 28c, so we just turned it off.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced and unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: stephgr
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location but service and quality are inferior. The rooms are dark, spartan and gllomy. There is a pool but only 10 deckchairs so unless you get up very very early, you won't be lying by the pool. Very disappointing indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Location”
Reviews.Author: dannyz_babe
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my Mum for 4 nights in December 2010. The hotel is in a fantastic location. The open top tour bus stops right outside the hotel, and is a fantastic for seeing the city. The hotel is also walking distance to Las Ramblas, The Aquarium, The Zoo and many other shopping districts. Also being December there was a Christmas market just round the corner. The breakfast served in the restaurant has a good variety. From cooked english to continental. The staff are also very lovely. The hotel rooms are very spacious and clean. The best hotel ive stayed in by far. The only complaint i had was the lack of English channels on the TV. 24 hour news channels are all thats available. Although they did have a DVD player. There is a good irish pub down the road from the hotel serving lovely meals. If you come out the hotel and turn left, the pub is just on your right. I loved Barcelona and would love to go back. I will definetly stay at this hotel again and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, would love to go back!”
Reviews.Author: slfh0927
Reviews.Content: Grand Hotel Central was situated perfectly - close to the train station and Metro stops as well as convenient to all the sights to see in Barcelona. The hotel was modern and cool and rooms comfortable and clean. We loved the use of the Ipod docking station when we were getting ready for the morning/evening and views from the rooftop terrace are incredible. Great westernized breakfast (eggs/bacon) as well as yogurt/granola and all the coffee and sweets you could imagine. Yum! Only negative we experienced was at checkout we inquired at the front desk if the Train Station had a place where we could store our luggage while we continued to sight see before our overnight train and they confirmed the train station did have lockers. We got on the Metro to head to the train station (incidently had our cell phone stolen out of a jacket pocket) and found that the train station did NOT have lockers. So we lugged the bags back to the hotel - a bit of an inconvenience but not the end of the world. Wished the front desk had told us correct information however, they did let us to store our luggage with them for a few more hours and to use their Internet connection to file a claim for the stolen phone.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious Staff”
Reviews.Author: Sandala91364_10
Reviews.Content: We returned to this hotel one year later and found that Luis still remembered us from 2009. He was so gracious and kind and what more can you ask for. The rest of his staff was as gracious and helpful. We would recommend this hotel to anyone who stays in Barcelona. The area is so convenient and the rooms are very nice. Thanks again to the staff for their hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Price/Quality ratio”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlyerPro
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks very good from the inside as well as from the inside. Rooms are clean and modern. The rate is very satisfactory considering the convenient location of the hotel as well as the level of comfort. However, some little details made me angry like the 14€ cable internet in the room. In the overall, a very good stay, with competent staff, who masters English and French perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: curley6710
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in November 2010. The location is wonderful...within easy walking distance to the Ramblas, the Barri Gotic and other cool areas. It is also 1/2 block from the nearest Metro station, so other areas of the city are easily accessible. The rooftop pool is beautiful and unique, although it is not heated and therefore unusable in cool weather. I found the service to be understated but outstanding. We received several good tips and recommendations. When we needed more soap, it was delivered to the room within minutes. Rooms also have electric blinds, which can be lowered with the push of a button. Our room faced the main street and, while there was some street noise, it was not loud enough to prevent us from sleeping. I would highly recommend this place and will definitely stay here again if I get back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD but could be better”
Reviews.Author: pmetka
Reviews.Content: Hotel is design and very well located , the roof top swimming pool makes it unique ! but there is few armchairs and you have to be the first to be able to enjoy it rooms are spacious and quiet , view is ok , breakfast is really good . the down side is the service , very low key and if you ask any toiletries it takes ages to be delivered . if they are .....

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, Excellent location, Needed instructions on shower”
Reviews.Author: demimoore66
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and room excellent. Had difficulty figuring how to work the shower in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location...& Infinity Pool!”
Reviews.Author: WinedDined
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Barcelona for my 35th birthday. We came over on a red eye from NYC and arrived at the hotel at about 9am local time. They already had our room ready for us and had upgraded us to a Jr Suite. We loved the room. Automatic blinds, amazing water pressure in shower, plasma tv, complimentary-stocked mini-fridge and more. The location doesn't get any better for a Barcelona stay...you are right between the 2 markets (Boqueria & Santa Caterina) and the two best walking areas of the city -- El Born & Barra Gottic. The concierge and front desk were always helpful, friendly and provided us with solid recommendations. The hotel has a hip feel to it w/ comfortable accomodations. We would recommend Grand Hotel Central to anyone traveling to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, Central location”
Reviews.Author: BiznPleasure
Reviews.Content: The lasting memory is of a very well-chosen group of staff on the front desk and in the Avalon restaurant who remained helpful and very pleasant for our 3 day stay. The room was "cosy" with three adults but adequate. The theme of the hotel is modern, lots of downlights but overall it is dark and a bit disorientating - this is how it is advertised. The roof top view is special with a very nice infinity pool however it is not staffed in the cooler months This was disappointing as a number of guests obviously chose to sit up there - in the cool - and enjoy the outlook which includes snippets on the Med and a view of some of Barcelona's spectacular architecture. We were able to order some wine from the restaurant which came to the roof top area with plastic glasses but we had to take the remainder of the bottle to our room - no glass allowed. It is sensible but not what we were expecting. In the warmer months it would be a hit. We had a issue with the air-con which was fixed quickly. There were black-out window shutters in our room. Traffic noise is still noticeable but - on the 6th floor - not a big deal Overall we enjoyed our stay very much and if this is not the most charming group of staff around they must go very close.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Robyn1950
Reviews.Content: The grand hotel Barcelona is more than a hotel it is more like staying with close friends. the staff are very warm welcoming and helpful. The rooms very comfortable but could do with more lighting. The view from the rooftop breathtaking. Barcelona is a beautiful city and staying at the Grand hotel only enhances the whole experience .

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Kjetilc
Reviews.Content: Nice and comfortable hotel close to shopping, restaurants, many attraction and metro station. Rooms are quite small, but have a good layout. Rooftop swimmingpool and lounge area is very nice, and have a great view. Unfortunately no staff in the rooftop bar. I will consider this hotel for my next stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing predominantly wrong with the place but it just didn't quite hit the mark.”
Reviews.Author: Danrichoz
Reviews.Content: We were there for 6 nights in October and had a city room. The room was fine, they have gone for the minimal look but to the extent that the place feels sparse. It could really do with something to make it feel 'comfortable' rather than just functional. The room and bathroom was a bit 'tired' looking, grouting around the tiles was dodgy, exposed flex on the hairdryer, a bath that didn't drain, towels a bit threadbare and general knocks and dents. The lack of wifi in the rooms was disappointing. We ended up going down the road to Starbucks to use theirs. The room had no tea/coffee making facilities, however it did have a small fridge that was restocked for each day (2 small bottles of sparkling wine, and 4 small bottles of coke/juice etc..). As we were there for 6 nights we did spend some time in the room, it became a bit of a running joke that their were only 1 or 2 English language TV channels - 24 hour news. I did find the staff a bit stand offish, the majority of the time that we passed reception they were busy talking amongst themselves and ignored us, a good morning or some acknowledgement wouldn't have gone a miss. Having said all that the hotels location is ideal - perfectly situated for exploring. A metro station down the road, and the Barri Gothic on your doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, great service and attention :)”
Reviews.Author: TomG55
Reviews.Content: I made a mistake in my booking and the GM saved my weekend with friends (who booked 4 other rooms)! I was given a room although the hotel was fully booked at no extra cost. The rooms were sober but so quiet for a central location, with all amenities, great breakfasts, great pool with skybar, and great massage at the spa. Overall this is a great place, with a library room next to the reception which I recommend for looking up Barcelona's best on the extensive selection of guidebook they have. Only 2 small things I am sure the hotel is already working on: enable wifi in bedrooms and make the spa room a bit more quiet as u can hear people walking upstairs during your treatment which is not ideal. Otherwise it does deserve 4 stars as an experience, I travel quite a lot and quite strict on comments so go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Superbly placed for tourist activities; shame about plumbing noises”
Reviews.Author: mottyandfluff
Reviews.Content: fairly recently renovted in pretty minimalistic design using darl colours; open welcoming reception; big spacious rooms marred only by the down pipe running through them disturbing sleep at regular intervals. The roof top pool was lovely although I did not have achnance to enjoy it because of the rain. A good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THIS PLACE !!!”
Reviews.Author: Savannah78
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad we found this place ! - Because this hotel, made our Barcelona stay, absolutely perfect ! We booked a Master Suite. And the room was very clean, and big enough for the 4 of us. The location was great. Close to everything . The pool on the top was great ! The best with the whole stay. My kids could have been there forever ... I know we have to return to this place .. one day

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a little too dark.”
Reviews.Author: crobinson_austin
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure who their target demographic is, but I would have preferred something warmer and better lit. It was clean and the staff was nice enough. I just didn't like the hotel in general. I also didn't appreciate the wireless Internet only being available in the lobby. Was a good location for sight seeing with plenty of shops and food nearby. I will probably stay closer to the water next time.

Reviews.Title: “High standards are maintained”
Reviews.Author: SLP57
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at this hotel. It's a beautifully maintained boutique hotel with a professional and approachable staff. Well positioned in the Gothic quarter, just round the corner from the old cathedral, it was also a short walk to the nearest metro station on the right line for the conference centre on the coast. I've stayed there both for business and for a weekend break and I would recommend it for both. Internet access was available, wired in the rooms and wireless in the comfortable lobby. We expected to pay for this and were pleasantly surprised when this charge was waived on checking out. I seem to remember the reception desk staff being a little distant on previous occasions but this was not the case this month. Check in was rapid, an issue with the bedroom window was swiftly resolved without fuss and nothing seemed to be too much trouble.I was very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Vcline
