Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect. I choose this hotel after reading comments in Tripadvisor and I do not regret my choice. I strongly recommand this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dark, loud, and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: mpsf73
Reviews.Content: Yet another overly modern hotel in which it's impossible to find a light switch. While some may enjoy the Hotel Grand Central's location in the Gothic Quarter, rooms with a "view" were very loud and the hotel's environs were crowded. Our room when we checked in was dirty (there was a real, live hairball next to the bed) and stayed so throughout our 3 days. The hotel also nickles and dimes you for everything - internet charges, charges for the map they put in your room for your "use," and charges for the flip-flops in your dark, cavernous bathroom. Save your pennies for somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Minimalism done too well...”
Reviews.Author: mfg1
Reviews.Content: This hotel may be a bit too minimalist for many peoples' tastes -- the lobby is dark, the hallways are darker, and the rooms are a bit austere. However, if you like that sort of thing -- and we do -- this is a lovely hotel in a fantastic location. And it's got some really great things going for it. First of all, while it may be situated on a busy and sometimes noisy street (fortunately, they have decent sound-proofing), it's incredibly close to things you'll want to see: the Cathedral, the Picasso Museum, Las Ramblas, Placa Cataluyna, and both the El Born and Barri Gotic areas. And second -- it has an amazing rooftop pool/lounge area which is the perfect spot to relax over drinks and gaze across Barcelona skyline at the end of your busy day. Just a couple of minor issues -- there was an odd smell that wafted through the hotel hallways from time to time. We had no idea where it came from, or why it would just suddenly appear and then disappear -- but it was definitely noticeable. Second, I appreciate a minimalist decorating style -- clean lines, neutral palettes...it's all good. But there's a fine line between minimalism and spartan -- for instance, a soap dish would have been nice. Or maybe a washcloth. And a towel bar to hang said washcloth. However, the location, the fantastic staff and the rooftop terrace make this the perfect place to stay in the old city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic holiday”
Reviews.Author: danpam
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location, consistent with marketing, very short walk to cathedral and Las Ramblas. Hotel very clean with beautiful roof top pool and terrace. Very friendly and helpful staff. Minor ciriticism - gym not very well equipped relative to size of hotel. Cant wait to go again.

Reviews.Title: “They made our weekend escape to Barcelona so unforgettable!”
Reviews.Author: Jacob0577
Reviews.Content: We felt we were staying at a five star hotel. Receptionists were really friendly. Rooms are spacious enough...complete with all the things you need to have a good sleep after a very tiring day. The pool atop the hotel is just perfect! We rented the electric bicycles and they did not charge us. How cool is that?! The location is awesome, practically near the metro and placa catalunya.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, convenient, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: JacquieSaltLakeCity
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, comfortable, and modern, the staff are friendly and helpful, and the location is convenient. I didn't like the double bed set-up, though.

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful hotel in an ideal location for leisure travelers.”
Reviews.Author: Bill60903
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel Central is ideally located near the Cathedral de Barcelona and within walking distance of many other tourist areas such as Las Ramblas and the Picasso Museum. We received an upgraded room, so that likely added to our experience. The staff was very helpful with our requests and provided excellent restaurant recommendations, and appeared to be fluent in a number of languages. The room was top notch and very clean. The most outstanding feature is the roof top pool and lounge. A drink while overlooking the city was the perfect way to end the day.

Reviews.Title: “Good/Average”
Reviews.Author: DanOliver
Reviews.Content: Good things: - well located - pool/bar on roof - friendly staff Not so great things: - lacked charachter - very dark corridors and rooms - slighlty strange smell Our experience was fine, not amazing not awful.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise, how unexpected beautiful and excellent all it was!”
Reviews.Author: nikolaus_novotny
Reviews.Content: As I have been travelling with my spouse, I shall continue with the royal "We". As my wife selected the hotel due to a recomendation in an Austrian monthly wellness magazine, we both have been highly surprised to find a neat and noble accomodation nearby old Barcelona which depassed the description in said publication. The reception, and the check-in has been friendly, and convenant, and correct. The room we occupied has been proper, modern and practically equipped, enjoying clear and sobre design which pleased us very much. We also pleasantly enjoyed the restaurant, and the meals respectively the food served. Only the ambiance has been a little bit strange as at this evening a hughe TV-screen showed the final encounter of the Football World Championship between Germany and Spain. Most of the guests have been watching with fascination. The only thing we have regretted was that we could not enjoy the terrace on the top as it was closed because of an anniversary event the Director/ Owner celebrated that day. We only have had a chance for a glance. Check-out has been effective, and friendly as check-in has been. We are sure we shall return when the occasion arizes!

Reviews.Title: “Best feature is rooftop pool”
Reviews.Author: colibri85
Reviews.Content: It has a very masculine dark vibe if that is what you like. Biggest disappointment was super thick synthetic pillows that they would not replace with anything. (Even the Holiday Inn in the US gives you a bunch of pillow options) So I had a stiff neck for days and ended up sleeping on my travel pillow collar thingee...for this price? Also, for this price, no free WIFI. Get with the program folks. Last night I had no room booked and I was promised help finding something, nada. they called two places and sent me out on the streets. Ended up at the Barcelo Rival, a real treat and better alternative.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: jhmaduro
Reviews.Content: location! very charming well located perfect breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Grand Central”
Reviews.Author: kiwitraveller004
Reviews.Content: We just loved this hotel and would not hesitate to recommend to anyone. The roof and pool is magnificient, we didn't have any problems getting seats and many hours were spent up there. The location near the Born region was amazing too, with the great selection of shops and restaurants. I think people that complain about the hotel being too dark, obviously like whining, because it isn't all that dark. I think the shower doors could do with some frosting though! Probably the best hotel I have ever stayed in. Also, if you are worried about the noise - just email ahead to the hotel and they seem to accomodate - I had a lovely room on the 5th floor, and it was very very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “King of Darkness”
Reviews.Author: sferaverde
Reviews.Content: The biggest plus of this hotel is its location- within walking distance to many attractions and not far from the bus station where the Girona airport buses stop. The hotel has a definite design edge with a rather dark twist. I mean it literally. The hallways are painted total charcoal (ceilings too), which may feel depressing to some. Our room was rather cramped and facing another building window-to-window, so pulling down the blinds (black) was a necessity. I was a bit disappointed with the cleanliness of the room. It wasn't spotless for sure (maybe I'm a bit picky). One annoying thing about this hotel was an extremely slow elevator. The lobby of a hotel is quite pleasant, though. The staff accomodating and friendly. Breakfast buffet offering few vegetarian options, but otherwise quite pleasant. Great rooftop terrace with the infiniti pool. Overall, a good place to stay for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay for a short get away”
Reviews.Author: AlexanderMoore
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very well maintained, completely clean and everything stocked as a hotel should be. The receptionists and concierges were always eager to please and incredibly helpful. The roof terrace/infinity pool was nice, the bar not as well stocked as expected and the service of drinks didn't fit with the style of the hotel. Unfortunately, one of the two internal lifts broke, and the key card system required to use it was a bit of a faff, considering there was security in the lobby. Beyond that it was a great stay, the breakfast was incredible and in the evening the restaurant was extremely good. Along with the great location it was perfect to sightsee Barcelona during the day and then have a couple of drinks on the roof as the night closes in.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel! By far the best part...”
Reviews.Author: ChiSteph06
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! By far the best part is the pool and lounge on the roof. We could have sat up there all day. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. We also had a great view of a 15th century building from our room. The hotel is right in the gothic quarter of Barcelona and there is a ton to see and do within walking distance. It is also close to the Barcelonetta beach and the Metro stop. The room was modern and comfortable. Wifi service was not great. We only got a signal in the lobby and on the roof. I would stay here any time I came back to Barcelona. It is worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Very chic, helpful staff, affordable. Great location!”
Reviews.Author: hsbanana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hotel Central for one night in August, 2010. The staff was so kind and accommodating. They also speak perfect English. Our rate included a great breakfast. My 10 year old LOVED the cool pool on the roof and my teenager loved the Euro-chic vibe. The hotel was in a wonderful location that allowed us to walk to much of Barcelona. We heard a bit of a rumble from the metro but it didn't bother us at all. The décor of the hotel is very minimalist / chic. I personally liked the style of the hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The roof top pool at night is fantastic, what a view”
Reviews.Author: fordoak
Reviews.Content: We arived from Paris Aug 25 to the Grandcentral Hotel, great location close to subway and bus stops, there are roman ruins across the street under the church. The staff where fantastic they made dinner recomendations and also made the reservations for us, the Rambla is a short walk down a pedestrian only street full of great shops and tapas bars, english is spoken in most places. The staff realy made a great vacation even better with all the help they gave us, maps and directions, The breakfest buffet was very good ,lots of choices. We would go back to this hotel in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “A total package hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynMiro
Reviews.Content: The Grand was a fantastic hotel: it had it all. it was in a really central location. We were able to walk to most places. The staff were accommodating and were really helpful. Our room was spacious and comfortable (including ipod dock) The lounge and infinity pool was a great place to relax after an eventful day in the city. Also, the breakfast offered many local dishes as well standard breakfast fair.

Reviews.Title: “Luxoury hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Tove A
Reviews.Content: We like to live in the old part of town when in Barcelona, and this hotel is perfect in between Barri Gotic and Born. With a wiew of the cathedral from our window we loved it from the first moment. Nice wiev from the top floor, with a bar and a pool.Beautiful. Very nice modern rooms, good beds, bathroom clean and modern. Stylish all over, but expensive..

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel for a romantic short break....”
Reviews.Author: Matty425
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel........ chic, cool, in a great location, stunning roof top pool (does get busy), great room, attention to detail with a very useful map on arrival we will def be back.

Reviews.Title: “great independent hotel in a near-ideal location”
Reviews.Author: feroamaour
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights total in this gem. We really wanted a hotel with a pool so that narrowed the choices considerably, but I'm glad we ended up staying here. The rooms were spacious, super clean though showing a few signs of wear but nothing distracting from the comfort of the hotel. the bathrooms had good amenities and we appreciated the 100% opaque electric shades which came in handy to overcome jetlag. The hotel was quiet and our rooms facing side and back were quiet as well. the hotel itself is housed in an old house where they'v preserved just enough of the original building (staircase, entryway, etc) to keep some character. The included breakfast buffet was very good quality and offered varied fare so we never got bored with it. the pool deck on the top floor offered panoramic views of the city and the seamless pool, while small-ish, was just the right thing for our teenagers. The staff was friendly and effective. Overall, a really very pleasant and relaxing stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic roof with pool”
Reviews.Author: AnneG59
Reviews.Content: I will come back to this hotel. The staff was friendly. Breakfast was good - but expensive. The rooms were modern and well equipped. The best thing was to go to the roof, swim in the pool, watch the other city roofs and get a glass in the bar/lounge area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with amazing pool and views”
Reviews.Author: hep25
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an executive room which has everything you need, rooms are spotless and minimal without feeling too clinical. Good bathroom, featuring walk through sink/basin with storage. The location is perfect for exploring the gothic quarter, individual bars, restaurants and shops. Once you step outside you feel your really in the hustle and bustle whilst once inside the hotel its calm and quiet, nice to retreat to after a day/night out. The highlight is definitely the pool. The views are amazing and on a sunny day you can just chill with a drink on one of the many sunloungers whilst overlooking this beautiful city. Robes and towels were provided and replaced daily. The staff are quietly helpful and friendly, just the right balance. Breakfast is brilliant with a wide and good quality selection. Would without doubt recommend if your looking for a stylish hotel in a good location with a brilliant pool.

Reviews.Title: “Central yes !”
Reviews.Author: Fantomette_10
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel very much, the rooms are confortable and quiet, dark coloured, with a nice bathroom, the terrace and the pool offer a fantastic view, and its very well located, a few steps away from El Born and El Raval neighborhoods, where you can shop all day long, and not so far away from The Ramblas and The Paseo de Gracia, the Picasso Museum is nearby... My only regret is that when you stay for a few days and when you travel with a car the parking is very expensive, i think the hotel could offer free parking in packages and it is the same for internet, wifi should be free as in other spanish hotels such as paradores... when you want to use your laptop you have to pay or go ... to the nearest starbucks where its free... But the general impression is very good, its a nice place to stay !

Reviews.Title: “superb location in the centre, missing the details to be really great”
Reviews.Author: lhkb
Reviews.Content: To visit the old town, the harbour and the beach the location is ideal. Of course it was fun to have the pool on top on the roof and the possibility to have late a drink there. BUT for a "GRAND Hotel" it missed details. For example: - we went swiming twice a day, and could not hang up our wet swimm-suits - there weren any bathroabs for going to the pool or returning - the fridge didn't cool - it was almost impossible to make a siesta because of the noise in the hall (mainly the Hotel-Personal organiszing and cleaning, shaouting and loughing which is nice but distubing) and because our room was next to the door to the staircase leading to the pool. - the price for brakfast is amazing and just to much - the access to the internet should be free as wwell the post cards from the hotel, because they are best advertisment! But at the end: Yes we would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of cool in buzzing Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: CGALondon_England
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five days in a loft suite and thoroughly enjoyed it. Like many buildngs in Barcelona, the hotel is a mixture of ancient and modern, stylish and beautiful. As everyone says, the pool and pool deck are fabulous but therefore very busy with beautiful people who tend to frown at you if you make a splash! Best of all are the staff: Iberia lost some of our luggage (don't get me started on Iberia!) and everyone at reception was extremely helpful and kind - it's clearly not the first time they have dealt with the situation. The location could not be better and the blinds, double glazing and air conditioning kept us cocooned from the noise and the heat at night. So, highly recommended - but book though Late Rooms to get a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, smart hotel and nice rooftop pool”
Reviews.Author: Edinburgh83
Reviews.Content: The location is briliant - bang in the centre, and easy to nip bag to dump bags of shopping and siesta. The pool on the roof is nice, with a smart outdoor bar. The restaurant is closed in August but there are plenty of nice ones nearby. Our room was a twin, not a double, and has been smoked in in the past, but was spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Haven in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: mcf82
Reviews.Content: When traveling to a city as vibrant as Barcelona, I require three things of my hotel: attentive staff, an outlet for decompressing after wandering all day and a plush bed. Grand Hotel Central ensured all my needs were met seamlessly. When I arrived after a severely delayed flight, the concierge was a darling and recommended a tapas place up the street on the Cathedral Square for a late night dinner. Diving into the rooftop pool at the Sky Bar took the edge off a sweltering afternoon spent at La Sagrada Familia. And collapsing into bed at the end of the night left me revived the next day. It was perfection from beginning to end.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel but for the price they need to improve their service”
Reviews.Author: eurotraveller28
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in August 2010. The hotel is exactly as you would expect and is true to the website images etc. Design is Japanese inspired, quite masculine, darkly lit and self-consciously trendy. The pool is beautiful, although busy when sunny. For a Mr and Mrs Smith recommended hotel, however, it did not live up to expectations and in future I would book the ME or W rather than return. The price is comparable to Barcelona's 5 star hotels, but the service is way below par. The restaurant was closed for August (very dissapointing, and no warning on the website) however the desk staff seemed very put out that I asked for a recommendation of somewhere to eat one evening. On two occasions I had to request my room get cleaned that day; some days it would be cleaned at 10am, other days not before 5pm. The internet is expensive and there is no wireless in the rooms; nowadays when almost everyone is travelling with a laptop or iPhone I expect wifi to be included in an expensive room rate. Room service, which was the only food available int he hotel, was very poor. If you are staying on lower floors, you will hear the metro trains rumbling every few minutes at night, and soundproofing could be improved. Our room was an executive, and large enough for two but badly laid out with an oversized bathroom and undersized bedroom. Overall I had a nice stay, but felt this was poor value for money. If the staff had been more helpful and attentive, rather than disinterested to the point of rude, and the restaurant open, this would have dramatically improved things.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to see all of barcelona from”
Reviews.Author: snp12
Reviews.Content: When you first enter the hotel , one is struck by the modern clean lines of the decor and the professionalism of the staff. The staff is so very helpful with any type of arrangement or suggestion. From restaurants to activities to the best day or time to visit each museum. the beds were so comfortable and the black out shades we marvelous to have. I will go back for sure and so would my friends........last but not least, the rooftop pool and lounge is to die for!

Reviews.Title: “A good base for Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: EssexPomLondon
Reviews.Content: Overall a very cool hotel, centrally placed. Pros: Great rooftop bar and pool Modern clean rooms (with powerful showers) Very helpful staff Pretty quite for the middle of a city Cons: Not enough sun loungers on rooftop, you have to get there before 9am to get one, seriously! Corridors can be a little dark (I think its meant to be trendy) One of the elevators was not working which caused long waits. Use the stairs to burn off those calories. The only other downside is that a minority of the hotel residents were a bit up themselves, chill out people, you're on holiday! Barcelona really grew on me, its quite a nice city, explore everywhere, not just the tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: lizbobo
Reviews.Content: We were recommended to stay here by a friend and it certainly met our expectations. It is in a great location -ideal for visiting the cathedral and the ramblas as well as catching the Tourist bus which is a great way of seeing the sites ( get the Red line !) We ate in the restaurant and the menu of the day was good value but the service was too quick. We found the staff to be really welcoming and helpful and the hotel is very comfortable indeed. The building is really interesting and the conversion has been done really well. One or two comments- the rooftop pool is lovely but it was ruined by some really badly behaved children. One of the lifts was broken throughout our stay which was a bit annoying. We will definitely be back but not in school holidays!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hip vibe. . . showers need to be scrubbed”
Reviews.Author: letty318
Reviews.Content: This is a potentially great hotel. We loved the location, check in was a breeze, the staff was very friendly. Everything was great until we looked in the bathroom. There was mildew everywhere. For an elsewhere iimpeccably clean and well staffed hotel, this was a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “A lot of potential”
Reviews.Author: lunov
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a lot of great futures, but the information and help from the reception was a bit up and down, which made the impression going out and coming in to the hotel a bit mixed. For example, one time we asked how we could get one place with the underground, but then we were told that we would not be capable to go there by that, and should rather take a taxi. I think that is up to the guest to decide, because some wants to feel the "spirit" of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: bruindr
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel and staff. I had booked 2 rooms (travelling with my wife and 2 daughters ages 15 and 18) at rate of 199 euro/room/night +tax for a central room plus buffet breakfast included which I felt was a very fair deal. Before our arrival I had contacted the staff to request adjacent or adjoining rooms if possible. They were very prompt in their reply and stated they would do their best to accomodate my request. Well on arrival they went one better and offered an upgrade to a family suite that would accomodate all 4 of us at the same internet discount rate of 199 euro/night. It is very uncommon for any hotel to offer a supeior room at the same rate when I was booked for TWO rooms to begin with-meaning they would receive half the amount I was going to be paying them. Upon showing us the suite and comparing it to the regular rooms it was a no-brainer to upgrade to the suite. Very modern, spacious with King and pull out couch plus addt'l bed, free minibar in room restocked each day, very large bathroom with shower and separate bathtub. Very quiet. Awesome breakfast buffet way beyond typical european continental fare-more like usual american buffet that in itself would normally go for 15-20 euro per person at most hotels. Finally the terrace pool and bar area is a very special retreat with fantastic views of the city and a relaxing vibe. The staff were very eager to please. OVERALL ONE OF THE BEST HOTEL EXPERIENCES I HAVE HAD-exceeded my expectations in every category. I found the hotel on the Princess cruises website as one of their options to stay before the start of our cruise and after browsing the hotel website decided on it. Subsequently it has been written up as one of the hot new hotels in Barcelona- I wholeheartedly agree!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Fab Fab - just click book now”
Reviews.Author: mumof2Cork
Reviews.Content: Super hotel great location. Roof top pool a huge bonus after a long day in the city it was the ultimate pleasure to dive into the roof top pool and lounge in the sofas and recliners located in the rooftop bar. Equally so it was a lovely place to read a book sip a glass of wine and watch the sun go down. Free mini bar with juices and waters is great. Blackout blinds make for a very restful nights sleep - they are fantastic. Breakfast was gorgeous with fresh fruit, pastries, cereals, cheesed, cold meats and hot food. Staff were excellent. Rooms are small but very well laid out. Internet access great also. So all in all I highly recommend staying here- it is a super location for exploring and near to bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooftop pool but.....”
Reviews.Author: Pmggo
Reviews.Content: the hotel is new (2008?) the lighting throughout is poor including spot reading lights in rooms which were like something from a dentists surgery staff were slightly interested in providing customer service the charge of 14euro per day for internet (not wifi in rooms, you need a cable!) is excessive although common in Spanish hotels all of the above are mitigated by 1. a great rooftop pool to chill out after a day sightseeing or spend the day lounging there with drink and food service (chilled vibe was slightly ruined one evening by a group of minor celebs from Holland who were obnoxiously drunk) 2. a great restaurant, avalon, which has a michelin star and is very good value 3. a great location, walking distance everywhere give it a go but next time ill try the W Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Pure decadence”
Reviews.Author: MimigraceEssex_UK
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a luxury base for your weekend break to Barcelona, this is a good place to start. It is a beautiful hotel, very modern, the rooms were lovely with an ipod docking station, TV, air con. The main feature of the hotel is the pool on the roof. The views over Barcelona are just amazing, and together will chill out music playing gently in the background, fresh towels, a bar and modern decor (decking with huge silver vases with plants and flowers) you will instantly feel as if you have left your stresses behind and can indulge in a spot of luxurious relaxation. There is also a gym at the hotel. A must if you are visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and a cool pool in an fantastic city!”
Reviews.Author: Dorfer
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights at The Grand Hotel Central while sightseeing in Barcelona last fall. I selected the hotel based on reviews here and the hotels website, primarily because of the modern appearance, location, and a 5 nights for the price of 4 promo. Overall, we couldn’t have been happier with the hotel, location, and price. My only complaint is the hotel didn’t make me feel like I was in Spain, which I found common in the modern hotels we stayed at in Spain. We arrived early in the morning and the hotel stored our luggage while we started to explorer the city. The first day we used one of the hop-on-hop-off buses, which stop about half a block from the hotel, and saw most of the major sights. We then checked into our room later in the afternoon. Our room #204 (a central room) was located on the second floor and was very clean, modern, and comfortable. The whole room looked brand new and was one of the nicest designed hotel rooms I’ve seen considering the actual square footage of the room. It had plenty of storage (all built-in), very nice lighting, and great electronic blackout curtains. Unfortunately, the view was of an alleyway and a couple of offices. The room had an LCD television, DVD player, mini-bar with complimentary water and juice (replenished once a day), and a large desk. We didn’t use any of the hotel facilities other then the pool, which is located on the roof and although very small, it has an amazing view. There is a Starbucks a few doors down if you need your American coffee fix and a natural grocery store next-door, if you want to stock your mini-bar with groceries. We walked and used public transit most of our visit. The beach is about a 15-20 minute walk from the hotel, Port Vell (great seafood) is about a 10 minute walk, and La Rambla is less then 5 minutes through charming little streets with great restaurants and Tapa stops. Barcelona is a fantastic city with a great public transit system, clean beaches, and amazing food! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location (and pool), helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: andrewdevitt
Reviews.Content: The location is about as perfect as possible and the rooftop pool deck, while prone to overcrowding in summer, is a fantastic place to wind down. Our room was very spacious although quite poorly lit. We had an Executive Room that was large and had a neat design but I am consistently disappointed at hotels that put couples in a room with 2 King singles put together. If they insist on doing this, as the Grand Hotel Central Barcelona did, they need to ensure the bedding is capable of covering the edges of the 2 beds. For the duration of our stay, my fiance and I may as well have been sleeping in separate beds. Upon discussing with staff, we were treated with some indifference and told 'that is how it is', despite my specific requests at the time of booking. I am also stunned at the rates they attempted to charge us for internet access. Overall, it was a pleasant stay, despite the nuisances described above. The location and the pool were more than adequate to wash away any bad taste.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, almost excellent.”
Reviews.Author: RichSarahHolly
Reviews.Content: This is a top hotel located in an excellent location near the gothic quarter. My only critisisms are that the room has no kettle/ drink making facility and travelling with a baby meant we needed a kettle to prepare food. The hotel would not supply one so we spent the first few hours of our stay shopping for one. Secondly, the third floor is a smoking floor and the smell of cigarettes came through to our room on the fourth floor through the bathroom. We did complain but the only remedy offered was to unlock the windows which hotel staff had to come up and do.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: martyn23
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights and for the price I was very happy ith the stay. The decor is very chic and trendy. Our room was a tad on the sdmall side and had two twin beds. Our two tips would be 1 Don't have a room at the back of the hotel as it overlooks a courtyard where kids hang out till 1 in the morning 2 If you are going to use the pool get there early as it fill up by about 10am. . Overall though we had a great time and the staff were very friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm in bustling Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Opina27
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a lovely place to stay and for my money, it has the best location. It is steps from the Cathedral and Roman ruins on one side and the funky Born district on the other. As a guidebook noted, there is a boutique Hitchcock feel to the corridors but the rooms are very nice and the restaurant serves great food, much lighter than the usual Spanish fare and is bright and welcoming. The rooftop pool and bar is a great place to have a pre-dinner drink although don"t expect to be alone. This is Barcelona after all and life is lived and shared with strangers. The service is top notch. Whether you speak Spanish (as I do) or not (as my husband doesn't), everyone from the front desk to the resto to housekeeping do their utmost to meet your needs. We stayed here twice with our teenage boys and they enjoyed the hotel as well. The only caveat is that the plumbing makes an eerie Hitchcock-like noise in the rooms above, particularly noticeable in the mornings. We were on the second floor so don't know if it happens higher up. Ask not to have a room on the courtyard if you are staying over the weekend. The youth of Barcelona goes to bed sometime around 9 am on a Sunday and they like to be heard. On the other hand if you like to hit the ground running, you won't need an alarm clock. All in all though, the hotel's clean modern decor and friendly staff make it a great place to come back to after a day out in the Miami of Europe.

Reviews.Title: “worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: shazza55
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Barcelona, and i knew it was important to stay in a good quality hotel. I had been recommended this hotel by 2 separate friends, and i can honestly say it was worth every penny, a really fabulous hotel with they most amazing infinity room top swimming pool. The rooms were great with fantastic black out blinds, so you knew you were able to sleep in. When we arrived i couldnt belive the room had a alarm clock radio with ipod docking station, really good hairdryer and lovely hot power shower, with 2 heads so if you dont want to wash your hair you were ok. My only complaint is that there were no tea and coffee making facalities in the room but other than that a fabulous hotel with very pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Silveretta
Reviews.Content: Me and my two friends spent the last week of June 2010 in this beautiful establishment. There are not enough words to praise this hotel. The pool itself is enough to want to go back again...its perfect! The location is amazing. The rooms are clean, spacious and silent - ours was facing the main street and it had no impact whatsoever. The only minor critique is that the staff could be better. Do not get me wrong, they have the best intentions at heart, but once they made reservations at a restaurant for us, but gave us the wrong address...and our triple bedroom ALWAYS lacked 3 bathrobes and 3 pairs of flip flops, which after a week gets annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for a better experience”
Reviews.Author: lbannerot
Reviews.Content: This was one of the nicest hotels I have stayed at in Europe and it was a pleasure to stay there 6 nights in mid-March. The hotel is very modern inside (blacks, greys, mood lighting etc) and was kept spotless. The hotel staff was super helpful and fluent in English. The rooms were good sized and had nice lighting, hardwood floors and very comfortable beds. The room also had blackout shades that really worked so we slept in later than we thought several mornings. The bathrooms had a nice shower/tub and very good water pressure as well as lots of hot water.The hotel provided free water and a few beverages in a mini-fridge daily and a comfy robe and flip flops for relaxing in the room or heading up to the pool (in nice weather). It also had a great gym and a beautiful rooftop Infiniti pool, although it was too cool to swim when we were there. One of the nicest things about the hotel was, as it's name suggests, was its central location. It was just a short walk to restaurants and many sites and, for those farther away, the metro stop was just a few steps outside the hotel. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to other travelers in a heartbeat and, if I get back to Barcelona, it will be nice to return to the Grand Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and pool”
Reviews.Author: saratogasue
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic- within walking distance to the gothic, born sections, las ramblas, barcelonetta beach, placa catalyuna shopping. Metro station, and even la sagrada familia and casa Milan for the hearty walkers. We had a master suite which was huge but only a small window with no view. The pool is great but get there early to get a seat. Breakfast is good as well but tiresome since it is the same every day ( and we stayed there for a week). If I could change something it would be the elevators and having to use your room key to get to every floor. Much of the time the elevator wouldn't respond so you spent a lot of time getting to your floor. Also they need a bit more lighting and something on the room walls as they were too minimalist and dark for me. Our room and bath were other wise large and lovely. The free minibar items are good too. We'd definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: rhondateri
Reviews.Content: Spent the week at the Grand Hotel Central. Everyone and everything exceeded my expectations! The loft room was spacious for two people, the view was beautiful, the roof top pool was beyond relaxing, and I would return tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the best area of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: pmclauchlan
Reviews.Content: I arrived early in the morning from New York expecting to have to wait for a few hours for my room, but to my surprise the reception was able to get me a room right away. I told them I had a very early flight to catch from the Girona airport the next morning (which I didn't realize was 1hr and a half from Barcelona). The girl at the front desk sent to my room the bus schedule, arranged for a wake up call, AND had breakfast waiting for me at 3 am at the check-out desk. I was amazed! She definitely gave me the 5 star treatment. My brother and I returned from the Canary Islands 3 days later and stayed at the Grand Hotel another three nights. I only had breakfast once, since we were regularly taking advantage of the Barcelona nightlife, but it was very good. The rooms have amazing blackout curtains, which are controlled electronically from the beds...AND there are free water bottles in the mini bar to help cure your hangover. The pool deck was really great during the day...very fun, young, and attractive group of people sipping cocktails and having improv photo shoots proved for a great afternoon. I would highly recommend this hotel if you're young, or to anyone just wanting to have fun. We found some really great restaurants and bars in the neighborhood. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “great location, great hotel, roof top pool - amazing!”
Reviews.Author: ning_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is great. Rooms are beautiful and clean. Staff is very helpful, but what makes it a MUST is the roof top infinity pool - absolutely amazing. We very much enjoyed our stay and will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “The rooftop pool is unmatchable”
Reviews.Author: MariaBo
Reviews.Content: The design of the hotel is great, really modern and cool, but mixed with older elements of the building - very stylish! Everything was really clean and appealing. The beds were comfortable and the room very quiet in spite of being in a busy street. But the best of it all was the wonderful rooftop pool, with "lounge" style coctail bar and sunbeds, and views over the old town.

Reviews.Title: “Greta Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: barry51555
Reviews.Content: Great surprise. Great location right by Gothic Quarter and a short walk or bus ride to beach The hotel was obviously modernized and has all the new features and look. The staff is great. Just wish they had a buffet but the rates were also pretty good. The room was quiet even though it faced an alley. I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel, terrific location”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel19941953
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to its reputation in guidebooks and on TripAdvisor. It is a highly modernized hotel in the shell of an older building located on the Via Laietana. Laietana is a very busy thoroughfare that divides the Barri Gotic in half. Thus the hotel is smack in the center of everywhere you ever want to walk to. The Cathedral is 1/2 block away. Our room looked across Laietana at Roman walls. The street noise did not bother us although it was there in the background. Rooms have at least two big windows with double-glazed glass and electronic shutter that create a total blackout if you want it but can be opened or shut to any position, There are also screened window treatments that let you see the view but keep out the glare. The beds were extremely comfortable. The rooms are a very good size for European hotels, and have beautiful wood floors and very modern furnishings. The hotel breakfast (small buffet) is excellent. The hotel has a small and decent fitness center and a beautiful rooftop terrace with a small lap pool and lots of comfortable seating and a bar. The staff is extremely welcoming and accommodating. They aim to please. It's nice to be able to catch a taxi or bus easily outside the door which is not the case for many hotels in the Gothic quarter which are on a maze of pedestrian streeta. Every location within the Gothic Quarter, Citat Vella, and the Born is within a ten minute walk. Both my 16 year old son and I would stay here again without any question.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: knightlites
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a modern hotel in the heart of the "old district" this is a great pick. We were able to walk to everything we wanted to see. The beds were very comfortable and the staff helpful and freindly. If you want a truly unique experience of Barcelona, go on the "fat Tire" bicycle tour of the city, it was a great way to see all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great rooftop bar”
Reviews.Author: NYCwanderlusty
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Hotel Central for 5 nights with a friend. The location is perfect - right between La Ribera/El Born and Barri Gotic and a short walk to La Eixample. Some reviews complain about the street noise, but we didn't hear any as our room did not face Via Laietana (we are also from NYC so that kind of thing doesn't bother us in general). Rooms could use better lighting, the bathrooms could be a bit more private, and the service on the amazing rooftop could be better (was hard to get a towel, order a drink, etc.) All in all, the hotel has great style for the price and I would definitely stay here again on my next trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect oasis”
Reviews.Author: beckycandlelady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent hours walking and enjoying the surroundings. The hotel's location was perfect so that we could pop-in relax, cool in the pool and head back out. The staff were ALWAYS helpful and helped made our stay very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Huge suite, perfect for a family.”
Reviews.Author: Adrianna_10
Reviews.Content: We were pleased to find that they had noted that our two children were different genders and ages. Both the pull out bed and a rollaway were set up in the living room upon arrival. Even with both of these there was ample space to move about. Magnificent spa bathroom, comfy beds, knowledgeable staff and centrally located. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: StephenIsleofMan_UK
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights here in June. Location is the hotel's USP. And the roof-top pool and bar are a haven of chilled tranquility in the heart of the city. The best sound-proofed hotel room we've have ever had (and that's important when you're staying slap-bang in the heart of the city). Across the road you have the Gothic quarter and everywhere else is a comfortable walk away. Front of house staff exceptionally friendly and efficient. Would stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice staff - but sinister, dark design, bad sound insulation and no bar”
Reviews.Author: parataxideumenos
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, staff seems sometimes a bit lost, probably junior guys with limited training. However, very polite but sometimes missing the right go-get-it attitude. Also reflected at the pool - service incredibly slow. The only real off putting was the very bad sound-insulation. (The windows couldn't be opened either.) Seems to be very en vogue in Spain to have a derk design - you permanently think you can't find the right switch, but no, it's 'design'! It's a pity the hotel has no bar and when you return late and would like a drink you'd have to look for bars elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, very secured, elegant, and in outstanding location.”
Reviews.Author: Desli
Reviews.Content: Hidden treasure, with outstanding service. The rooms spacious and clean. Free minibar (not that many options) but at least a cold glass of water or coke comes in handing when you arrive from a long flight (12hrs). Location is excellent, central to Cathedral, Las Ramblas, Port, Gotic and Born sections of Barcelona, in addition to private and public transportation around the corners. Two girls in a foreign country never felt uneasy about the hotel secure access to the floors or the location of the hotel. The price is high but security and location are a priority in my book. Highly, recommend, early booking saves you $$$$.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to relax as well as sightsee”
Reviews.Author: EmilyBrewster
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in a loft suite, to celebrate a big birthday. The loft suites include "free" minibar ( I'm sure you pay for it in the room rate) with mineral water, soft drinks and cava refilled daily. The cava really helped us celebrate in style, and with an iPod dock provided we could add a soundtrack to match - it's not iPhone compatible though so phones have to go into airplane mode to play/charge. The bed was huge and very comfy. Our room was on the front of the building, road noise combined with the rumble of the underground trains meant it sometimes took a while to get to sleep, but once under we slept really well and thanks to blackout blinds slept late every morning. The rooftop pool itself is not heated so we didn't swim in it, but it was great to dip tired legs in after a day of sightseeing. The area surrounding the pool, including the bar, was great and we sat up there with our books for a few hours most days, allowing us to relax in between sightseeing. The bar was reasonable priced so we enjoyed a few glasses of wine there during our stay. Overall we had a fantastic stay in a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: soxfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at this well located hotel in Barcelona. Near Ramblas, Cathedral and Picasso Museum. Also the Gothic and Born districts are right outside your door. All facets of service at the hotel were excellent. Free mini bar is nice touch. The only suggestion is for the hotel to offer free wi-fi otherwise a very good choice when visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet calm oasis in a very centrally situated part of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: caroline031
Reviews.Content: Hotel and Barcelona were great - it was centrally situated but watch your bag and purse - had my purse stolen out of MY BUM BAG. Dont talk to anyone and keep vigilant. the on/off touor buses are great and high recommend them. Also ensure you get a quiet room at the hotel then you will have a great time. Go to the Market on La Rambla and buy your breakfast and lunch there from the fab fruit/veg, meat stalls as food is very expensive. The market is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Rooftop Terrace”
Reviews.Author: KarenBurgess
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is the location. It is located very close to the Jaume Metro station - we took the train / metro in from Barcelona airport and it was so easy to find. It was within walking distance to La Rambla, Playa de Catalunya, Waterfront, etc. The rooms are very trendy / modern - we had a room for me and my husband, and it was 2 twin beds together, but I think this is standard in many European hotels. It was a little tight for space to be honest - there was no area to put your suitcase. The rooftop was fantastic - a great place to have a drink at the end of a day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant hotel in the heart of Barcelona with a beautiful rooftop pool and fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: CocoCumbria
Reviews.Content: The 3 best things about this hotel are: The staff (especially reception and bell boys), tthe rooftop pool and surrounding area, and the location. The breakfast is good but we didn't eat in the hotel apart from that so can't comment on the restaurant. Its advisable to eat breakfast before 9 am as it gets very busy. The rooms were spacious and well equipped. My only complaint is that the rooms and the corridors in particular were very dark.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay and Excellent Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: ttc_8
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Grand Hotel Central was helpful, courteous and very responsive from the time I emailed them a few months before travelling to Barcelona. I was given a great rate which included the buffet breakfast (the breakfast was delicious!) for a triple executive room. The hotel staff even helped us arrange for a private cab transfer from the airport to the hotel, and provided us with tips on how to visit the best tourist sites in the city. Upon arrival at the hotel, we were greeted by the friendly concierge staff who quickly checked us in and brought our luggage to our room. The room was immaculate and the mini-bar was stocked with water, juice, and pop (these drinks were all included in the price of the room). We also liked the fact that the room had an iPod clock. The only complaint is the lighting, as the hallways and the room were a little too dim. Also, the shower, as typical in Europe, did not have a shower curtain nor a full door...it was like a half door, which made it difficult keep the bathroom area dry while showering. The beds and pillows were comfortable and there was adequate closet space. The rooftop pool is a nice concept, and there we had a great view of Barcelona. The hotel is close to all amenities (e.g. subway, tourist bus, restaurants, and shops). The buffet breakfast had a variety of breads, cheeses, jams, juices (including peach, orange, and apple), and other items such as eggs, ham, bacon, and tomatoes. I highly recommend this hotel. Once again, kudos to the wonderful staff who provided superior customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel - Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: thesixofusToronto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week in Barcelona staying at the Grand Hotel Central. This little treasure of a hotel is everything you could need while straying in Barcelona. The rooms were small and if you have a lot of luggage it will definitely take up a lot of room but hey - if you are in Barcelona staying in your room is not an option. Its a wonderful city and you more than likely will not be spending much time in your room other than to sleep!! The hotel has a cute little fitness room with a couple of bikes, a treadmill, an elipitical and a weight machine (which broke while we were there). The best thing about this hotel in our opinion is the location. The staff were friendly and quite helpful. The beginning of our trip was delayed because the airport in Barcelona was closed due to the volcanic eruptions in Iceland. Forcing us to stay in Frankfurt. When we did finally arrive in Barcelona (a day and a half later) our luggage did not. We arrived on a Sunday with nothing and had to try and find a place to buy some clothes. This was not an easy task as just about everything in Barcelona is closed on a Sunday. The hotel staff told us that we would not be able to shop for clothes because of the Sunday Closings. However, we did manage to find quite a large indoor type mall down by the water which worked until we could do some real shopping the next day. My tip would be to anyone travelling to Spain (or Europe for that matter) make sure you have a change of clothing and some small sizes of toothpaste etc. with you in your carry-on luggage. This volcanic dust is very unpredictable and can cause some serious delays for people. Also we called the Credit Card (Visa) that we paid for our tickets with were givin $500.00 each for clothing etc in travel insurance. You trip is automatically insured when you pay with Visa Gold. I loved Barcelona and was really happy with this hotel. Thanks to all of those who took the time to review this hotel in the past it helped us in our choice and I know that if you were to choose this hotel you won't be disappointed .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel to stay, everything was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Wekke01
Reviews.Content: I would advice this hotel to everyone. We have stayed here for three night and it was wonderful. The rooms were very spacious, clean and beautifull. The rooftop swimming pool en the view on the city is very impressive. The breakfast was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast, friendly staff, a little bit small room, free mini-bar great”
Reviews.Author: LINTokyo
Reviews.Content: 1. Buffe breakfast was great. We enjoyed delicious food every morning. 2. The staff at the reception are great. When we asked their advice for good restaurant, they were very helpful. 3. Tissue paper is necessary in a room. 4. Free mini-bar is great. We usually need just water, and water was provided every day. 5. Although we hang "Make up room, please" sign in the morning and went out for 3 hours, we came back and found out that the room was not cleaned several times. 6. We don't know why the housekeeper took away the bar soap in use and replaced it with the new one wrapped. They do not have to do that, it is not eco-friendly. 7. In addition to shampoo, we need conditioner. 8. In front of the elevator, there was a screen which showed weather forecast. However, it was not updated. (On wednesday, it showed still monday weather. 9. The space for washbowl need privacy. This space should be separated from bed space.

Reviews.Title: “Double Win - Location and Trendy”
Reviews.Author: adiscerningtrvlr
Reviews.Content: Excellent location across form the Medeval cathedral and Roman archeological museum and perfect location to enjoy the Gothic sector of Barcelona. Excellent location for a couple to explore both the intricacies of Barcelona and its history during the day and the delights of its nightlife. The rooms are well appointed, very trendy, the service is very good for European standards. We got a room facing the back of the hotel and it was very comfortable and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, excelent desigh, great location”
Reviews.Author: johnpao
Reviews.Content: We stay 3 nights in Grand Hotel Central. Large room with great design (there was a free mini bar with water and soft drinks) and grate loaction, few steps from the catedral.

Reviews.Title: “Great Style, Great Location, Friendly Staff but watch out for the metro underneath the hotel”
Reviews.Author: misterbitterpants
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights here in a great corner room on a lower floor. Great contemporary design with dark hardwood floors which I loved (hate gross hotel carpet). Decent sized room with lots of windows. Comfy bed, nice bathroom (but the shower overspray on the floor was out of hand). The windows open, quiet HVAC although getting heat into the room was a bit of a challenge for some reason. Our package came with breakfast at the restaurant downstairs. I wouldn't pay the regular rate for it but its convenient and the buffet was good with hot and cold items. Note: only one elevator so peak times can mean a bit of a wait. Staff was super helpful and friendly. Laundry service did a great job of removing a grease stain from my girlfriend's blouse. Unfortunately no free wi-fi which is pretty ridiculous these days. The hotel itself is about a half block from the Jaume metro stop. Its on the edge of the Born district and a short walk away from Las Ramblas and Placa Catalunya. Lots of great restaurants and shopping nearby. Speaking of the metro, that is my one complaint about the hotel. Its literally right on top of the metro line so in our room on a low floor the rumble was somewhat noticeable. The only reason I mention this is because this was our first stop after arriving from Canada so jetlag was in full effect magnifying any little disturbance. Once the jetlag wore off, we didn't notice it at all. A higher floor would probably alleviate this if its a concern. All in all, great design oriented hotel in a great location. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: ian1903
Reviews.Content: Wow is the only way to describe this hotel. Centrally located it has a modern and stylish design with some fantastic touches which makes it very special. We upgraded our rooms and they were spacious with a large bed and great bathroom. Lovely touches such as free soft drinks in the mini bar, smart map and phrase card, bathroom flip flops and soft lightning made it a great room. The breakfast was superb with the usual range of cold and hot food including an iced bottle of cava, a great way to start the day. We also used room service for late night drinks and it was first class.Staff were always very helpful. The most stunning part of the hotel is its roof top pool and sun lounge area. The pool appears to sit right on the edge of the building and took your breath away. Unfortunately at the time of year we were there for it was too cold to use but we could imagine after a hot day walking around the city there would be no better way than to cool down pool side. Cannot recommend the hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “exellent designhotel with an amazing Pool on the roof with a view on all the city”
Reviews.Author: fredAstaireParis
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very good location, even if it's on a large avenue not very nice. Rooms are very nice, design, with black and beige, and a large glass wall for the bathroom. But rooms are very small, and very dark, with a small window. The most amazing thing was the swiming pool on the roof witn a breathless view on all the city. The pool is small and it's difficult to have a chair in summer, but t's really makes the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel that helped make our perfect weekend”
Reviews.Author: SibboLondon
Reviews.Content: I chose Grand Hotel Central because of the location, a personal review, and also the mainly excellent reviews I have read about it here. All the plus comments are true, and some of the negative comments are true also, but it is rare that you find such a helpful and welcoming staff in any hotel, and that is a huge plus on it's own. Before staying at the hotel I had rung and let them know that I was planning to propose to my girlfriend. On arrival for check-in we discovered that we had been upgraded. A really nice gesture that I hadn't expected. The location of the hotel is a real plus (right in the heart of the Barri Gotic), but the hotel itself is everything that you would want from a luxury hotel. The only negative comment I would make is the same that some people have mentioned on here - the rooms can be a little hot and the aircon didn't have any effect on this. All in all though, a superb hotel that completed a perfect weekend for us!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, best hotel in years, great service and Staff. Good value”
Reviews.Author: Sandra035
Reviews.Content: I have been in the Grand Hotel Cental two times and every time I find it fantastic, is very clean , no expensive, grat service , great food ( don´t miss!!!) ...and a pool worth a visit!! The best of all is that is like beein in a luxury hotel with rates of a normal one....so great value!

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, good location, but Internet should be free!”
Reviews.Author: dj1471
Reviews.Content: A good central location within walking distance of The Ramblas. A taxi from the airport was about 30 Euro including tip. A few coffee shops, bars and restaurants in the vicinity catering to locals rather than tourists so prices are OK. Metro station just up the road providing direct trains to the CCIB if you're in Barcelona for a conference. The rooms are modern in design and comfortable enough, the free minibar was an unexpected surprise! The only negative really was the lack of free Internet (wired & wireless is available for 14 Euro a day), especially considering that free wifi is widely available in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “top class at a reasonable price, very central”
Reviews.Author: waiting4God
Reviews.Content: this was a business trip for my husband and i went along. i had a day to myself and the experience was first rate in the hotel. reception were extremely helpful, they gave me a city map, pointed me in the right direction and even warned me to keep safe. room was real luxury, bath shower and bidet. excellent black out curtains friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - was spoiled as it was my 30th birthday!”
Reviews.Author: EvaStan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights mid Jan 2010, hotel was fab! Very clean, staff were so friendly! We got upgraded as it was my birthday and had a bottle of champagne delivered to our room!! I would stay here again, was really sad to leave!! Location is spot on, across the street from the Metro Station Juame 1.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: pattygolfer
Reviews.Content: I was extremely delighted that I decided to go with this hotel after a lot of research and I am very particular. The location was perfect, as well as the staff, room and service. Very clean and upscale surroundings. I felt extremely safe. I highly recommend the executive room, #606. Lovely view and two large windows, offering a lot of light. The hotel is located just across from the Cathedral and you can walk everywhere. Trendy Born district on one side, Gothic on the other side. Several restaurants to walk to, my favorite being Montiel in Born Area and then Pla in Gothic area. The front desk staff was wonderful and helpful with directions, etc. We took Aero Bus #1 from the airport for 5 euros...goes to Playa de Catalunya, a 15 minute walk down the Ramblas to the Hotel. You can also catch the On-Off Bus there as well....a great way to see all the sites. We did take in a choral concert at the Palau de La Musica Catalan, a lovely venue as well as a ballet by Bolshi. The town offers a lot to do. It is a rather casual city, so dressy attire is not necessary anywhere. Pack comfortably, especially shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Great all round choice when in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: mrsbirdo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in quite a few hotels in Barca - The Grand Marina (many times), Hotel Claris, The Hilton, Hotel 1898, The Olivia Plaza, The Ab Skipper... In terms of all round enjoyment, location and service this is a great hotel. We stayed in a suite on on the 7th floor and it was very comfortable. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend and stay again when in Barca.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience , great location”
Reviews.Author: catherine076
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very well located , the ambience is elegant & calm . Very cool ; the lighting , the music , even the aroma! The staff was helpful and with a permanent smile Don´t miss the AVALON restaurant !!

Reviews.Title: “Uber Cool and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Daniel0000
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights with our young children (8 and 6 yrs), so we took a suite-style room where the bedroom had sliding doors and the sofa converted into a quality bed. This is an uber cool and trendy hotel, which is what we like. Bathrooms and products were of high quality, as were sheets, towels, and the like. The medieval district is just across the street, making this a very convenient spot... the famous market was an easy walk (El Quim is awesome), and the waterfront is also walkable - the children enjoyed the aquarium and the zoo. Although December isn't pool weather, we took a look at the roof pool and it looks incredible. Service was fine, albeit indifferent. For those who enjoy modern boutique hotels offering reasonable value, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Best location to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: cosimania
Reviews.Content: Just on the street that divides Barrio Gotico and Borne. In the heart of the city. Metro station Jaume I infront of the hotel. Close to all good bars in the city and you can't stay closer to be in the center. 10 min walking to the harbour. 20 min walking to the beach and if you don't want to walk take the metro infront which takes you direct to Barceloneta beach. La Rambla is just around the corner. Nice roof terrace with maybe one of the best views of the city. If you come by plane, safe on the taxi to go there. Take the airport bus to Placa Catalunya and then walk down Via Layetana. It's about 10 min walking. Like always in Barcelona - take care about your personal belongings! You look like a tourist, so don't walk in the streets with the camera around your neck and the handbag on one shoulder... Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Any hotel which sells its own fragrance...”
Reviews.Author: Sun_Mann
Reviews.Content: ...would come across as a little pretentious but this uber-cool boutique hotel manages to pull it off. The rooms are cramped, dark and frankly a dissapointment - however when you are in Bracelona, how important really is the room? The fashion shoot rooftop pool is probably this hotels best asset - apart from the staff who were awesome, always friendly, highly accomodating and came up with soem great eat/drink recommendations. Back to the pool....the juxtoposition of inifinity pool with old town Barcelona is brilliant and i can only imagine how popular this place is in the middle of summer. I recommend taking the hotels electic bikes out for a day, best (and laziest) way to see the sights in your own time, much better than the tourist busses. I think it is pushing a 4* rating, for E150 per night the room was dissapointing (we had a standard suite - although the staff turned our 2 singles into a double/king with one sheet and one duvet which was really good of them), but the hotel as a whole is great, and facilities like a great gym and FREE minibar made up for it. The Central location makes it perfect for a tourist or business trip and talking of business they have some great facilities there, they even loaned me their library space to host a teleconference!

Reviews.Title: “Totally cool Barcelona hotel with rooftop pool”
Reviews.Author: Ricardo25
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is fantastic - central location and great design, but for me the rooftop infinity pool makes this hotel the only place to stay in Barcelona. In the summer heat this city gets HOT, and there is nothing better than chilling out on the roof of this amazing hotel, taking in the views of the city, ordering a drink at the bar and having a swim!! I'll be returning to this hotel again and again....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maisieMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, in particular the location and the friendly and helpful staff. The rooms were large and beautifully decorated. Lovely rooftop pool, good restaurant and well equipped gym. We got great tips from the staff for restaurants and nothing was too much trouble.We would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous gem in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: calm1
Reviews.Content: We are delighted that we chose to stay in such a fabulous hotel. It is trendy without being impersonal and the little extras like the free goodies in the mini bar were much appreciated. Rooms are a good size and the bed comfortable. Its location is within easy reach of the harbour, la seu and the old town. We enjoyed the the roof top bar for an early evening drink before heading out on the town The pool looked small but inviting, sadly time did not permit us a quick dip. Our only small disappointment was when we asked a member staff to book a table on our behalf he told us the restaurant was fully booked, however on calling ourselves we bagged a table. Maybe they had a cancellation between calls, but maybe he could have tried a little harder? And when we asked if a reservation could be made for us at the theatre he told us it would be quicker to walk to the box office and do it ourselves as the line was busy. Which was possible true, but after a day of pounding the streets another 30 minute walk was not one that we particularly relished! However we would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff in a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UKResident
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a short break with my daughter and this hotel is made great by the great staff. Having read the reviews on this forum we requested a room at the back to alleviate noise. Unfortunately we were given a room on the second floor which,although at the back, still meant we heard a considerable amount of noise from the nearby bars,cafes etc. However we asked for another room and were given such excellent service from reception staff. Nothing was too much trouble, we were given a great room at the top of the building, at the back, with a great view over Barcelona. At all times the staff gave such a great service always with a smile. As others have mentioned, the rooms were dark and it was difficult to apply make-up but this was a minor problem. The room was immaculate the linen was changed every day and we had the use of bath robes. Our room had a great walk in shower which was great we also had two windows which gave more light and black out blinds was another good feature. All in all I would thoroughly recommend this hotel and it was also in a great location just across the road from the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Design hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: maociu
Reviews.Content: We spent a rainy and grey long weekend in September at the Grand Hotel Central and have to admit, we found the darkness of the interiors a bit depressing. But I also believe, this is a very rare condition in Barcelona and most guests will appreciate the suffused lights and the dark walls, which create a restful atmosphere. The Central room we booked was tiny but functional, had a very comfy bed but again was a bit too dark. The light needed to be always on while we were in there and showered, shaved, put on make-up, sorted out our clothes. On the other hand, the blackout blinds worked perfectly at night. The hotel is stylish and is in a great location, and that is what you seek in Barcelona. We had breakfast at the Avalon and though pricey, found it very good with a large choice of everything. The highlight of the hotel is the rooftop pool, which unfortunately we could not use, due to adverse weather conditions. The view from there is breathtaking. Close to the pool there is a nice fitness room, we had no time to try out. We definitely need to come back and use all the facilities we did not.

Reviews.Title: “Good Form, Mostly Functional”
Reviews.Author: EstesKrenshaw
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for someone who wants to do sightseeing and enjoy shopping and restaurants/bars nearby. It's half a block to a metro stop, across the street from the Cathedral and its Thursday antique market, 5 minute walk to Picasso museum and the Born, and 30-45 minute walk to the beach. Sleekly designed in a minimalist sensibility. Good sized rooms -- again, excellent design, although the room we stayed in was showing some wear with veneer peeling and chipping off the mdf furniture. Scratched wood floors. The glass door to the bathtub/shower looks good but is not functional at all. After showers, the bathroom floor was soaked. Big plusses in addition to the location were the rooftop pool (not the fellow patrons at the pool who were very pretentious); 4 bottles of water, 1 coke, and 1 pineapple juice for free each day in the mini bar; and prompt service. If you can get a good price on this place, I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Decor! Great location! Noisy plumbing!!”
Reviews.Author: rta124
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and were very impressed by the ambience and decor of rooms and Lobby, the room we had on the 2nd floor was quite large,very clean and well designed, the location of the hotel was perfect for us as we wanted to walk the sights and exercise my wife's bad back! we found the staff friendly and helpful. Lots of good Tapas and bars local and very easy for Metro, cabs etc! The only concerns for us was the very loud street noise during Saturday night with a bar entrance just below our window, shouting and screaming for several hours!! we thought this was a reasonable trade off against the location and should be expected for the centre of a lively city! The Great problem was the intolerable sound from the plumbing! everytime a toilet was flushed the sound in our room was that of a Sunami approaching! and this went on for much of the night!! earplugs are the way forward!! we did not try the £20 per person breakfast! we were far too busy looking around a great City eating fantastic food with the locals for a fraction of the price! the pool was very crowded and sunbeds for the early birds only!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: annu1234
Reviews.Content: Service, rooms and the roof top pool were nice. The breakfast was excellent. Location was good for central Barcelona but not the best for those whose main purpose is the beach. There is a metro station near by, so for combination of beach and city life, it would be great. I would definitely recommend this hotel. I did not find the bathroom doors transparent or the corridors dark as was mentioned in some reviews. I considered the design quite chic making neat ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: dwaynerik
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews (since early this year!) we decided to book at the Grand Hotel Central. Indeed, it is a sleek, cutting-edge hotel as far as I am concerned. It lived up to its' star rating. The front desk staff, pool bar staff (young lady originally from Reunion) and young man who ALWAYS had a smile on his face!) and housekeeping were A+ anytime we needed anything. We didn't eat at the restaurant as there were so many options in the Gothic Quarter/Born area - also thought 25 euros for a breakfast was outrageous. The central location really won our hearts as we could explore the city in the morning/early afternoon then head to the beach (25-30 min walk) in the late afternoon. We didn't go up to the pool until after 6 pm usually, always seemed to have open lounge chairs and was a great way to relax a bit before heading out to dinner. Only drawback (but definitely would stay there again!) was that there wasn't wifi in the pool area. But then again not "being connected" was welcoming! Also, the bathroom is a bit dark, so shaving wasn't easy and also the sleek glass wall in the shower area kept getting the floor quite wet. OVERALL, it was a great stay and would recommend it for a central location, good value for the price and wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the City”
Reviews.Author: alkIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week as a family of four in late July. Arriving about 10.pm from a flight, the receptionist and porter dealt really well with a taxi driver who tried to rip us off and were genuinely helpful with advice on restaurants and sights. As with many busy city hotels, they were courteous and helpful throughout our stay without being overly friendly. The compact rooftop pool is a welcome oasis from the city heat and that alone is well worth the stay. But the hotel delivered in all regards, and I would recommend highly. The location is excellent. Situated in the Gothic quarter, strolling the streets and discovering amazing restaurants and bars is a holiday in itself.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Jags_On_Tour
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group of 9 friends while attending a Barcelona game. The hotel could not have been more helpful for a group that looked like a stag weekend - we weren't but easily could have been. Rooms clean and exactly as expected and while no-one had time for the pool, this looked fantastic. 5 minute stoll to Las Ramblas but be careful of the locals later at night; it can get quite interesting to say the least. Great location for exploring Barcelona, the metro is very clean and very efficient, but most points of interest are in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, Classy, Excellent Location, Polite Helpful Staff, Great Food, Top Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Debsky68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Hotel Central for a week and had everything you could wish for in a holiday. On arrival we were greeted politely and helped immediately with our luggage to our room. Breakfasts everyday were faultless, something for every nationality and even Champagne! The best Pastries and bread baked fresh on the premises. Fabulous meals reasonably priced in the Avalon Restaurant. The beds are the most comfortable we have ever slept on and the room cleaned every day, free minibar (soft drinks) and toiletries. We were central for all the amenities, bus routes, Metro, Cathedrals, Las Ramblas and 10 minutes from the Sea. Barcelona is a beautiful City made even more welcoming by staying at a Fabulous Hotel. The pool was lovely on the roof to sit and enjoy the views. Highly recommended, will be staying again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Beware if nervous of creepy crawlies - cockroach!!”
Reviews.Author: Furry023
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, loved the shower room (if a little dark). Breakfast fab! Stayed two nights. Second night arrived back at 1am to find 3cm cockroach crawling across pillow! Room on 2nd floor. Reception's first comment "you are in the old city!" We insisted on being moved which they did very quickly to the 6th floor. Staff not at all interested when checking out the next day - voucher offered for free drink!!

Reviews.Title: “Front desk staff unknowledgeable, unhelpful and rude”
Reviews.Author: eastsideguynyc
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is centrally located and the rooms are hip and cool, some of the staff at this hotel were so unprofessional that I would urge people to stay elsewhere. Twice I had asked for directions to a well-known restaurant and sight, and both times the flustered front desk staff had to fumble around with maps and guidebooks, and ask other staff members for help.
