But the worst was the woman who worked at the front desk in the morning, who besides being rude and unhelpful to me numerous times when I was checking out, she hung up on a caller on purpose, only to transfer them to a manager's voicemail so she didn't have to help that caller. Then she was rude to a guest who asked if he could borrow a robe, even saying he would happily pay for it, and she still gave him attitude. I'm surprised they hire someone with such poor people skills to work at a front desk. I stayed at two other hotels on this trip, and would highly recommend avoiding this hotel. Not worth the aggravation.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in every way!!”
Reviews.Author: fymi
Reviews.Content: We were told of the Grand Hotel Central by a friend and stayed there for three nights at the end of June / beginning of July. We were new to Barcelona and the hotel couldn't be better located: right around the corner from the Cathedral and the Santa Caterina Market (both landmarks). The Hop On, Hop Off bus stops just a few doors down from the hotel, a big boon at the end of a long sightseeing day. Our room was beautiful. But perhaps the best aspect of the hotel was the service (Mercedes, Vinny, Victor and others at the front desk whose names I didn't catch). Every request was granted and every consideration made for our comfort. A FABULOUS hotel in every respect!!

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: Riobeard
Reviews.Content: If you are given room 101, ask for another one - if you value your sleep! We stayed three nights (last day in June, first two in July 2009). We were given room 101 for our three-night stay. The hotel claim the rooms are all soundproofed - well we were kept awake by non-stop noise from the reception area until the early hours of the morning on the first night of our stay, a combination of a group of guests shouting and laughing at the top of their voices, and the hotel's loud, piped music. We rang reception at 3.30am to complain. We asked for a different room - we were told the hotel was full. We were asked if the piped music was a problem - we said it was; it was eventually turned down. We asked if the people who were creating the racket could be asked to stop - we were told that this was not possible. The disturbance continued until about 5am in the morning. If you value your sleep, room 101 is a definite no-no - it's right around the corner from the reception area. When we challenged the chap at reception over the hotel's claim that all the rooms were soundproofed, he agreed it wasn't true. We were given a different room (on the sixth floor) for the last two nights of our stay the following morning, but at no point did we receive an apology. Even after we followed up with an email after we arrived home, we still didn't receive one; the issues we raised were ignored. This is not good enough

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly staff, amazing pool.”
Reviews.Author: xcbillyz
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat skeptical before staying at the Grand Hotel Central, mostly due to the mixed reviews on this site. However, I was pleasantly surprised by an amazing stay there. The property was a true four star, clean and upscale property, with friendly and helpful staff, good food and an amazing roof-top pool, with city wide views. However, the location is true to it's name, in a great part of the city center close to all the major attractions. I feel this hotel is well worth the money and if you're not happy hear, you better book a room at the ritz.

Reviews.Title: “friendly and trendy hotel in the centre of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: chris2c4
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, modern, trendy, friendly, customer minded, centrally located in busy Via Laietana. Small but nice rooftop swimming pool, excellent & healthy breakfast with fresh fruits & juices, loungy music everywhere. 2 minor points of critic : even with triple glass the street noise makes you think the window is open. Secondly the interior architect has done a nice very job but the number of (tiny) spot lights is just too little which gives the room a dark impression (and puts your face in the shade when looking close to the mirror).

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel with fantastic pool”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug225
Reviews.Content: If you like stylish modern interior, a pool that makes you feel like you're at a Vogue Photo Shoot and staff that will go the extra mile than this Hotel is for you. If you have children than the dark grey interior and endless halls might not be for you. Our Room was overlooking a busy square and thanks to the great insulation we could see but not hear it. We arrived in the evening and decided to take a quick dip in the pool. We were the only ones there and under the southern sky with the stars coming I cant imagine anything more luxurious that this infinity pool. The next day, with 30 other guests crowded around was a different story. We were there for my partners Birthday and the staff went out of their way to get me a surprise Birthday Cake. If you can pay for it, they will make it happen. The room had a great desk area and a super clean high spec bathroom plus we were greeted with a generous selection of complimentary chocolates. We were considering moving in. Another plus is the location, you can walk to the Harbour and Beaches in ten minutes and all major public traffic links are up the street. A small let down was the breakfast, not quite as good as we expected from this great hotel, but then again, what a small price to pay for this fantastic stay. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone who is looking for a luxurious get-away.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and value of money”
Reviews.Author: Jen1page
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for boutique and a trendy hotel this is the place! Everything in the mini bar is included in the rate of the room, this included soft drinks plus 2 beers, You don't get that any where! Nothings ever free! The rooms are excellent, the baths are massive which is great after a long day walking! The mood lighting in the room is very relaxing and also there is a ipod docking station in the room, so remember your ipods! The swimming pool on the roof terrace is very cool, i travelled in April and the pool was freezing, so i only managed to hang my feet in the water. I guess May - September would be easier to get in! You definately need to go to experience it for you're self!

Reviews.Title: “perfect perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: giust
Reviews.Content: my mom and her friend (age 58) went for a 5day trip to Barcelona and stayed to the Grand Central and they asked me to write a review for their wonderful stay. At first the location was perfect, you could go walking to every part of the town without using the underground. They chose a room for smokers in the back, no noise at all, which was really nice and cosy and very very clean. they think that the non smokers rooms would be even better and more spacious. The linen and the quality of the mattress and pillows were really good and they had a nice sleep. the decor of the room was minimal and it had a free mini bar. Another plus was the breakfast which had a wide variety of food -from tapas to omelets, fruits, croissants etc - The service was really friendly, helped with the maps, buses etc and they spoke perfect english. Overall, a perfect stay!! Totally recommended! Would definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Went for the pool and loved it”
Reviews.Author: Rubster
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Barcelona so our goal was simple: hang out by the pool. We were not disappointed. Lots of sun and cava. The Avalon restaurant in the hotel was a pleasant surprise. Excellent food at a very reasonable price. Even the wine list was reasonably priced. Try the pork shin, cod and tomato salad. Only get the breakfast buffet (20 Euros) if you are in a serious mood to eat 20 Euros worth of food. The hotel is very modern and minimalist which is cool except when it comes to storage in the room. Morern hotels often sacrifice practicalities in the name of coolness. I also don´t get these European showers with the half glass wall. You always end up flooding the bathroom. Visit the large market nearby. You can see the Gaudi-inspired tile roof from the pool. They also have a small fitness center which was fine.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: Nick6312
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, just a few brilliant streets, full of restaurants and shops, from La Rambla. Beautiful hotel restaurant and the pool is UNBELIEVABLE! Single room is very modern and the blackout blind is awesome on mornings that you wish to sleep for a few more minutes. Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location- sleek, comfortable, modern”
Reviews.Author: DCInsider
Reviews.Content: A fantastic location between the Born and Gothic Districts. The staff was friendly, the roof top was a nice place to relax and the room was larger than most European hotels. For the security, cleanliness and convenience, it is worth the price. Would definitely stay there again if I returned to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Value Chic.”
Reviews.Author: ostramundo
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay, with location true to its name: very central. We found it easy to explore the entire city by metro and foot from this hotel. The rooms were "value chic" -- semi-sparse modern design, not small by European standards, very clean, and good touches like wooden flooring, soft/indirect lighting, spacious closets, blackout shade, etc. The free mini-bar is a nice touch, with beverages refreshed daily. Free wi-fi would be nice, and is a suggestion to the hotel. Possibly the best feature of our room was the spacious, modern shower -- probably what is called "rainforest", with excellent pressure and ample hot water for those, like me, who enjoy the indulence of long showers. In all, the room is very good value for the modern touches the guest receives. The lobby area also fits this description. Comfortable lounging, nice lighting, marble touches, etc. The staff made our stay even more pleasant, with a high level of energy and friendliness. Mercedes and Lluis went out of their ways to help us enjoy Barcelona, and I applaud them for this in light of previous guests' reviews regarding service and the lack of a formal concierge. Overall, I would call this hotel a "value" version of the "W", and would definitely return, especially in these credit crunch times.

Reviews.Title: “not my first choice”
Reviews.Author: weemacs
Reviews.Content: We chose this location because it is close to our favourite part of Barca. The street is very busy indeed and traffic hurtles passed at speed and all day. Our room was small and dark. The whole hotel has a dark (colour) theme. It is also above the underground so expect vibrations every 12 minutes if, like us, you end up in the lower floors. There is no bar until May and we didn't try the restaurant. The infinity pool on the roof is very smart and must be good in the summer. Despite being in a city centre I like to be able to open the window but they are sealed. Staff very pleasant and helpful. The cost was high and the fact that the facilities were not all available. As the building is right on the busy street you get no sense of arrival. I think this hotel would suite young modern people. Lastly I was very disappointed that the Internet was €14 a day. When will hotels wake up that this needs to be free or included in the rate.

Reviews.Title: “just the job”
Reviews.Author: bwlondon
Reviews.Content: With a 40% discount it would be hard not to see this as the ideal hotel for a 5 day break. At full rates, maybe slightly less so. Good bits - location: brilliant and central; decor: seems to be love it or hate it, and we thought it restful, tasteful, pleasant; beds - really comfortable; noise: we were round the back, so, apart from scaffolders next door was very peaceful; extras: free mini bar, lovely toiletries; staff: friendly, helpful. Not so good bits - lighting: not as poor as some reviewers made us think (it was fine for reading in bed), but putting on makeup is a challenge; tv: it would have been nice to have something other than CNN in English. The pool was being refurbished so we didn't see it, but not an issue in early March. Didn't take advantage of well equipped gym either, but it looked good. One excellent feature was a library with free coffee near reception with books on Barcelona, design, art... Went to nearby cafes for breakfast rather than stump up 20 euros for the Michelin starred hotel restaurant. Just behind the hotel is a marvellous little food market if you fancy picnics, and you'll find plenty of quirky shops, bars and restaurants in that direction too - less commercialisd than parts of Barri Gotic. Easy walking distance to most of the old town and Barceloneta area, with a metro station also near.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona hotel, nice modern but small and noisy”
Reviews.Author: debbierocks
Reviews.Content: Nice modern hotel with lucious interior. Rooms were again well designed but unfortunately very small. This hotel suffers a little from being on the busy Laeitana street which is always very busy with traffic and not conducive to a relaxing time in lieu of this.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Thrillbill
Reviews.Content: Having read good reviews I had high hopes. The hotel was definitely cool and trendy, and its location is pretty central....but.....you knew there was a "but" coming....... Via Laientana is like a 6 lane Los Angeles freeway and the bedroom was anything but quiet, with constant traffic noise, right through the night. Add to that 1) the room lighting was dingy (problems with style v functionality), 2) the temperature was impossible to get right (too hot or too cold) and 3) even though it was March and I had no intention of swimming, I had hoped to get up to the pool to see the city views. No chance...closed for maintenance. I walked away thinking I could have done better, both in terms of comfort and value for money. In the same class and a kilometer down the road is the MurMuri Hotel,..... much better. Alternatively about 100m away is the Banys Oriental, just a chic and much cheaper (but no pool). Disappointing

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laura_c_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Central for 5 days with my Boyfriend (ages 21/22) We really enjoyed the stay, the bedroom was very modern. 3 things i didnt like was the beds were a bit hard, you couldnt open the window, and the room service was Very expensive (cheese toastie was 10.60e) but very minor things didnt spoil it. Great Location. The Gym was very good and also the rooftop pool was fab shame it wasnt heated but it would be excellent in the summer. Will definatley be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, large rooms”
Reviews.Author: deepballer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here our last night of our honeymoon in Europe. While we stayed at a different hotel the week prior, we were very happy we chose this hotel vs. going back to the other one (987 Hotel). This was modern and sleek with larger rooms and a better location in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel But Pricey”
Reviews.Author: mfoundas
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel but very Pricey! Rooms were fantastic very clean and very modern and the best hotel bed ever! Roof top pool was lovely with a great view and the breakfast was very good indeed. Location was fantastic just over the road from Gothic and the staff were friendly and helpful. Would love to stay there again but would have to be for a special occasion as was the most expensive part of our trip in Spain

Reviews.Title: “Could do better..”
Reviews.Author: louisegreen
Reviews.Content: Slightly disappointed with our stay here... The location is amazing and the main reason that we picked it The second reason was for the rooftop pool - however - when we arrived in late September we discovered that it wasn't heated and that there were no facilities (such as a bar) with it - despite the suggestion on their website that there was.. The third reason we selected it was for the interiors (we stayed in a suite). The room was certainly a good size and we had a great view overlooking the Cathedral but as over reviewers have suggested the lighting is TERRIBLE and impossible to see anything in the room in the evening.. We were also kept awake most of the night by the noise every evening - but then - who comes to Barcelona to sleep? All in all - probably a little too pricey for what it is - but certainly a great location

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not top quality”
Reviews.Author: JJWAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: We found it to be a nice hotel. Everything looks sharp and the hotel is well-run. Roomservices and questions are dealt with quickly by the friendly staff. This is all good, and the location is excellent. What was not so good is the fact that you cannot open the windows yourself, and they turned of the airco as it was getting cold outside. The atmosphere in the room got hot, damp and unpleasant and having to get someone to open en close your window for you is every time you want to do something about it is irritating. The lighting is a weak point as well, and so is the noisyness between rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Well done !”
Reviews.Author: WimLeuven
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a group of 12 persons (6 couples) and liked a lot : - location - what they have done with the building - the staff (very helpfull !!) - the breakfast - the restaurant (not much choice but excellent quality food) - the service It's not always easy to fit a group to everybodys satisfaction in the same hotel, but they did, so congratulations ! It was everything we needed for a three day stay in lovely Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Buffy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at room 520 for 4 nights. The design 'look' modern but in a cheap way, think about a dark brown room shown in an IKEA catalogue. In terms of staff, a few of them are ok (you ask, they answer that kind of thing) but some are just stone cold, not even a smile or "good morning" after we pass them by so many times. I saw other people's comment about the poor lighting inside (and outside) the room, I thought not a big deal. How wrong was I. I can't even see my zit when I want to put zit cream on it. Forget make up, eye liner, mascara etc...(if you are a low maintenance male, may be not a problem for you). The poor lighting also cause problem with cleanliness, maybe their housekeeping staff can't see well enought to clean. Bedsheets got stains, the shower stall got brown and grey molds all around, it's disgusting. (If the staff are nicer, we would try to as for a room change, but just didn't bother because they look so cold) The room we had face the back street, so no street noise, BUT you can heard water running and hairdryer sound from the next room. The toiletries are minimal, nothing fancy, no clock/alarm in the room. They do provide free non-alcoholic drinks in the mini-fridge, The location is great, close to everything, but there are a lot of hotels around that area, I will definitely try another one if I go back to Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Bliss in Barca”
Reviews.Author: Cornishkitty
Reviews.Content: From the second our taxi door was opened and cases taken to our room we were looked after really well. I booked a small suite as a treat to my boyfriend and it was a great 3 days. The staff were really helpful - a blind was broken when we arrived but it was fixed as soon as we mentioned it. I liked the little extras like the weather forcast pillow cards being delivered to your room and the fresh pilow cases. The room was a corner suite on the 4th floor and provided a great view of the La Merce festival. The room was noisy, I stay in hotels across London for work each week and this was much louder at night so I suggest you pack some ear plugs. The nice touches such as the Cava and chocolates are great - but you get a bit narked when they forget to refil the fridge and you cannot have a Cava in your lush bubble bath before you go out. They also forgot to fill up the water but we got some more from the pool. The pool was quite quiet when we went and always had a choice of loungers. It is very subtle lighting, made darker by dark wall treatments but overall it is really relaxing. However as an interior designer I agree that they should do something to make the bathroom lighting better for shaving and make up. Then I really think it would make the room perfect. There are some lovely architectural features such as the old stair well and the reception area. I would certainly stay again and think the location was perfect, apart from a trip to Parc Guell we didnt need taxi's or the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “All style, no substance”
Reviews.Author: ZoeeoZ
Reviews.Content: I'll preface this review by stating that I'm quite grouchy due to the fact that I haven't been able to sleep for the past four nights, so take these comments for what they're worth, but I am so horribly disappointed by this hotel that I have decided to write my first TripAdvisor review as a rebuttal to all the glowing reviews that led me to book here in the first place. As most people do, I'll start with the positive, what little there is. This hotel oozes with style. From the lobby to the rooftop pool, everything is visually quite stunning. It's sophisticated and modern in an urban way that seems just right in such a stylish city. The room I'm in has a beautiful wood floor, a lovely minimalist bathroom with sliding glass doors and slate tile floor, and the furnishings are very cleverly laid out so as to maximize space. The location is very convenient, walking distance from just about everything and the Jaume I metro station is about a block away for what lies outside of walking distance. There's an organic supermarket down the street (and room in the minibar fridge to put things) as well as cafes and banks and pharmacies - anything you'd need. I'll admit that I picked this hotel mainly for its location and I was not at all disappointed in that regard. The staff, too, at least the ones I've encountered so far, have been nothing but friendly, helpful and gracious. Nothing all that exceptional, but definitely everything you would hope for. I don't fault them one bit. HOWEVER Underneath this sleek exterior is a whole wealth of aggravatingly poor design and planning. The bed, for example. It looks beautiful the way they make it up and very inviting after an arduous cross-Atlantic flight. It's quite bouncy, good for jumping, I'd imagine, and I'm seriously not at all picky about beds - I'll happily dream away on the hardest of futon mattresses - but I can actually feel the springs poking up through the skimpy cushioning and I can't fall asleep for more than a few hours without one of my limbs falling asleep. This morning I noticed a bruise on my hipbone from lying on one side for too long. My neck and shoulders ache something fierce and I now understand why they put little note cards everywhere advertising in-room massages. After sleeping on their beds, you'll need one. My second major complaint: the lighting in the rooms. There is not enough of it. And what little there is is so infuriatingly poorly positioned it makes me want to scream. In the lobby, the poor lighting feels moody and seems almost appropriate. But there is no excuse for what they've managed to do in the rooms. There are three recessed overhead lights, one directly above (maybe slightly behind) the head of the bed, one directly above the sink and one above and slightly in front of the toilet. There is also a desk lamp on the desk, some sort of lighting inside the closet and a coil of Christmas lights behind the headboard that serves only to add atmosphere. That sounds like enough, doesn't it? Well, the desk lamp is perfectly functional, I won't complain about it. And the atmospheric closet and bed lights do what they set out to do well enough. But the light above the bed is pointed in such a way so as to blind you should you want to read in bed lying on your back and if you should try to turn over and lie on your stomach, it takes some real effort to position yourself and the book in such a way that the pages are illuminated. And it also somehow fails to sufficiently light the side of the room it is responsible for. The light over the sink also points straight down, casting shadows on the face, making it impossible to see in the mirror. I caught a reflection of myself in the mirror of a well-lit bathroom yesterday and I absolutely looked like a clown, having applied too much blush and crooked eyeliner. And my boyfriend keeps cutting himself shaving. The third overhead light, over the toilet is totally mysterious to me. It allows you to see the floor in front of you perfectly, and somehow fails to pour any of its light into the shower, making it the darkest single corner in the room. I simply don't understand it. Speaking of the bathroom, it certainly looks very pretty and modern and spotlessly clean. But if anyone anywhere in the hotel flushes their toilet while you happen to be in the shower, the water turns scalding hot for a good 10 seconds. The showerhead is on one of those poles where you can slide it up and down to your desired height, which seems quite nice until you realize that there is no way to make the showerhead stay where you have put it and have to do a kind of dance in order to remain in the stream of water. And the shower has no door or curtain, only a panel of glass 2 or 3 feet wide that does nothing to prevent the entire bathroom from getting wet. The walls are very thin and poorly soundproofed and, even though I thought I had booked an "Executive Room" on a high floor with views over the city, I was instead lucky enough to be assigned a (cheaper, smaller) room overlooking a playground where children can be heard screaming until well past midnight. I have a few other smaller complaints, like the food we ordered from room service late last night being pretty bad, though admittedly very prompt and convenient at 4 in the morning when we couldn't sleep, the air conditioner is rigged so that it turns off when you leave the room, meaning you always come back to a room that is hot and stuffy, and the rooftop pool, albeit totally picturesque, doesn't have nearly enough seating to accommodate the number of hotel guests who want to spend time there, and from what I can tell, all the seats are snagged up early in the day by the middle-aged British tourists who sit there all day swilling their wine and discussing their assets (I'm not even being facetious - at the pool today I overheard two distinct groups of people discussing their vast finances) and, at least for me, standing room only and people twice my age acting half as mature makes enjoying a glass of wine on the rooftop at sunset more or less impossible. I haven't been to the gym yet, but I passed by it today and it looks like all the equipment is brand new and, like the rest of the hotel, it's very clean. Same goes for the business center. In short, it seems to me that what you are paying for when you book a room at the Grand Hotel Central is the decor, the location and the courteous staff. Everyone and everything is nice and pretty. But take all that away and you are left with a hotel I wouldn't spend $60 a night to stay in, let alone 200 Euros. This hotel has everything you could possibly desire, except for what's most important: beds you can sleep on, showers you can shower in and functional lighting - pretty serious oversights in my book.

Reviews.Title: “very central, very chic”
Reviews.Author: fiftys0methings
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Barcelona, for a special occasion (50th birthday) we couldn't have picked a better location, as most of the other reviews state. The hotel does have a cool and calm atmosphere as soon as you walk in the door, the staff were pleasant and helpful but not intrusive nor over effusive either. it is true that the rooms are a little dark, but the bathroom is bright enough for make up etc, the black out blinds are brilliant and together with our ear plugs you can sleep till noon if you wanted to (you definitely need ear plugs as there is a lot of traffic noise as well as the metro rumble). We were on the 4th floor. We were slightly disappointed as although we had made it clear on our booking that we were celebrating a special birthday, we didn't get the room we requested (double bed). However the room was well designed and spacious and the soft drinks in the fridge were very welcome and were always topped up, there is also complimentary water available when you visit the pool area. It is very popular at the end of the day, so you might not get a sunbed. We would definitely stay at the Central again, the breakfast choice was excellent and the hotel has all the essentials and more besides.

Reviews.Title: “The coolest hotel in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireDevil
Reviews.Content: This hotel does 'exactly what it says on the tin'-its very grand-in a cool contemporary way & also very central-close to the cathedral & just a 5 min walk to La rambla & the port. I looked at many hotels & this one ticked all the boxes for my first visit to Barcelona & I was not disapointed. As soon as you pass through the revolving door,you enter a cool contemporary retreat from the hot city summer. The lobby is very impressive-look at the striking steel wall of the lifts-very cool. The room was fantastic. Loved the electronic blackout blinds & had a good view from room 206, positioned at the front left of the building. You can hear the odd rumble fron the underground during the night but we were only 2 floors up. One of the many highlights was the rooftop pool-fantastic views,gets busy during the daytime but nice on an evening to chill out. I have no hesitation on recommending this hotel to anyone. I loved it-can I move in please?!! Next stop Aimia Hotel, Port de Soller, Mallorca

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Emmina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights and although we did have some minor troubles (check in delayed by half an hour, water pressure) the staff of the hotel and the manager in particular demonstrated great understanding and excellent customer service. Interiors are very well designed, minimal being the key word. I'd go back there as the location is perfect, we walked everywhere and didn't need to take the tube at all! One highlight: the breakfast! Eating out in Barcelona can be pretty pricey so the huge buffet with savory and sweet choices, cooked brekfast with tortillas, eggs, bacon, etc is definitely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a few days in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: C_and_MH
Reviews.Content: Grand Hotel Central has a perfect location mid way between the barrio gotic and el born. The rooms are modern with internet access but some are a little dark with views to a courtyard with brick walls. The sundeck would be gorgeous if only it were not packed with guests. The best time to go is at night.

Reviews.Title: “Soothing and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: davenrich
Reviews.Content: We visited Barcelona during a heat spell in August when all of Europe heads for the beaches. The Grand Hotel Central was a wonderful place to return to after a busy day visiting this busy very lively city. Everytime we walked into that wonderfully air conditioned lobby we went, "Aahhhhhhh!" Our room was on the small side but very efficiently laid out and super attractive and clean. The bed and the pillows were comfortables. The roof top eternity pool was another big plus with great views of the city. I also loved and used the library quite a bit to read, use our laptop, and grab a free expresso. The staff was also very friendly and always willing to go the extra mile to help.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nigel029
Reviews.Content: In the heart of Barcelona, yet quiet, great room, breakfast, efficient service, could not fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Great roof top pool”
Reviews.Author: Paris75009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Central for its location close to the trendy Born and the roof top pool… super location, beautiful views from the pool, international clientele. Some of the rooms are huge, some small (we had 3 over the weekend: the first was a smoking room, the second had LOUD noises from toilets flushing above and the third was small. Large modern bathrooms are great, the rooms are done with rather cheap materials.

Reviews.Title: “Best Little Hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: NanaAnne
Reviews.Content: My granddaughter and I spent 4 nights at the Grand Hotel Central and loved every minute of it. The desk staff was friendly and helpful, the rooms were very hip, beds were fabulous, and the roof-top pool was icing on the cake. There were a number of restaurants nearby, and public transportation was only a block or so away.

Reviews.Title: “Great City, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gavin-Kent
Reviews.Content: Just got back after a long weekend break in Barca, celebrating our 10 year wedding anniversary. The City is amazing, and the hotel is in a great location for you to get the best out of your stay. If you're there for a short time, then this place is ideally situated for you to get around to all the best places - whether that be Rambla, Beach, Sightseeing, Museums, Catherdrals, Shopping, or just wandering around the many squares and back streets. The swimming pool is a welcome place to rest and recharge before going out in the evening, and has great views across the City. The facilities and finishings are good - not amazing, but good. If it it was a high street shop it would be a Habitat, if a car marque it would be a VW. The hotel interior design is subdued lighting (not dark & pitch black as some reviews imply!), modern, and relaxed. The staff are polite and attentive. If you look for problems, you could probably find them, but really nothing worth geting in a stew about. It's worth bearing in mind that the hotel is on one of the main roads in the city, so if you are a (really) light sleeper you might get irritated by traffic noise, but you'd only get upset about it if you were trying to listen for it. Besides, by the time you go to bed in this city there's hardly any traffic...

Reviews.Title: “Your very own mausoleum”
Reviews.Author: BlackberryLondon
Reviews.Content: Booked an Executive Room which promised extra space and the best views. Reality was a tiny room,with horrible views, which was dark and claustrophic Only decent thing is the location, but the combination of poor lighting and black walls did nothing for me. It may be trying to be chic, but it has zero style Horrible

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: BakerStreetLondon
Reviews.Content: A great boutique hotel; stylish and smart, but not so dark you can't see. The staff were courteous. Fantastic location just round the corner from the cathedral. I had an executive room which was clean and spacious. The minibar was inclusive in the price, and even contained non-alcoholic beer. Great rooftop pool too!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: Julie-Suhr
Reviews.Content: I was so confused about which hotel to chose but finally after booking and cancelling a few others, I decided on Grand Hotel Central. We have been to Barcelona several times and we usually stay at 5 star hotels. I booked a loft room as we got a special deal for 259 euro per night. The minibar is free and replenished every day. Even though the website says it's non alcoholic, they do put 2x20 cl bottles af cava in it every day. The shower is great, the bed was comfy and even though it is true that the rooms are a bit dark, the ambience of the hotel is lovely. The rooftop pool is nice too and the hotels location couldn't be better. I would definetely recommend this for people between 25-40 years.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Service, Atmosphere - all GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: phsinfla
Reviews.Content: What a nice hotel! The location can't be any better - a block away from the Cathederal. The rooms appeared to be recently decorated - dark colors and wood, but very nice. All of the hotel employees were very friendly and helpful. I was staying at this hotel for work and it was paid for by someone else, but at 180 Euro per night it was a good deal for the size, service, and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Julie031
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel, location was excellent for the major attractions, very close to the old city with easy walking to reach the metro & sightseeing buses. Staff were pleasant, buffet breakfast was ample. Really thought the complementary soft drink mini-bar was a welcome change. Our room faced a corner street & was very quiet. Lighting is quite subdued in the room & the only problem was that the mirror was a bit underlit. Would certainly return - great city!

Reviews.Title: “Great, relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: NANASMAD
Reviews.Content: Its taken me while to get around to this, but here it is. Stayed a long weekend at Grand, it was superb, staff so helpful; and dare I say their English was much better than my Spanish. Rooms were clean and spacious, mine had a walk in shower room, could have had a party in there. We didn't eat in the restaurant apart from breakfast, which you couldn't fault; purely because there was so many other places to eat. Try Gloria, bar opposite, superb food, fantastic atmosphere and reasonable on the purse. Location of the hotel is brilliant you can walk to all the central points, takes about 5 minutes to walk to Plaza Catalonia and maybe 10 to the port. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool!”
Reviews.Author: clemu2127
Reviews.Content: The decor at the Grand Hotel is lovely and the amenities are nice. Everything in the mini bar is free, but there is no alcohol. The bathroom was very cool and modern. The roof-top pool was definitely the higlight of this hotel! The pool is beautiful and there are plenty of comfortable chairs to lounge. There is a bar on the roof that provides beer and wine. The views of the city are stunning! The location was absolutely perfect - walking distance to Las Ramblas and a subway station. I'm not a coffee freak, but my travel companion is and she was delighted to find a Starbucks and several other more "authentic" coffee shops very close to our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 333judi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for exploring Barcelona on foot. However, when we stayed the weather was dreadful from arriving to leaving (two days early), this was nothing to do with hotel. However, the bad weather highlighted certain points. 1. No radiators in room for drying, but hotel staff took clothes away and returned them promptly. 2. The restaurant appeared 'cafe like' and functional and no bar to relax in. 3. The minimalistic decor was very despressing in bad weather, i.e. grey walls and spotlights, which left us yearning to get outside for some daylight. 4. Staff were excellent and helpful. Would certainly return here, but only if sunny :)

Reviews.Title: “Central Chic Choice”
Reviews.Author: Vonneytraveldotcom
Reviews.Content: Excellent central location - chic minimum in style - fabulous infinity pool with City views - excellent breakfasts. Very comfy beds, bathrobes okay if you are a size 8 or below or don't mind revealing all! I wouldn't recommend the Romantic package - really not worth the extra and the restaurant is not conducive to romance - too sparse! Although the "pretty" food is okay (international not spanish) - there are much better restaurant in close proximity. Would return and would recommend, bit on the pricey side - but Barcelona is not a cheap place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel overlooking the Gothic Cathedral”
Reviews.Author: LondonTowns
Reviews.Content: Booked this via lastminute, offered a really competitive package (seeing as the Euro is currently straining a few wallets!). Unlike my stay in Rome last year, this hotel really lived up to it's 4* rating. Rooms were spacious, with free minibar which was especially welcome for trawling round the city! Situation is fantastic, close to the beach and port, while being right on the arterial road connecting the Gothic quarter with the trendier Born district. Saw some negative feedback on the lighting and, while I would agree that the spotlights above the bed have a bizarrely overcomplicated dimmer setting, we found this fine. Overheard some fellow clients complaining about the dim lighting in the corridors, but we just found this ambient, and pretty welcome after a long day in the sun! Would also disagree with some comments about the noise. Living just off one of the main roads into London, noise was no issue, and the traffic (all 5 lanes of it) was pretty quiet. And we were there during the boisterous Mayday protest marches, so it's saying something! Overall, a great stay. Breakfast is excellent, but would recommend only if included in package--otherwise, there is an excellent bakery just across the road, outside Liceu metro station, which would prove far more economical! Oh, and I would warn about the hotel-booked taxi--not sure if it was on their side, but the cab the hotel booked cost us double the fare of the first trip from the airport to the hotel--when we were stuck in traffic for 30 mins! Not sure if it was just dodgy cab driver, but did leave a bad taste.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnBGuernsey
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The situation was perfect, in the heart of the old town and all the places we wanted to see were within walking distance. It was stylish, peaceful and the breakfasts were excellent. The non-alcoholic mini bar was free and the beds comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Lost in the dark”
Reviews.Author: iradier
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a nice renewed decoration, the room was clean but not enough lights to see very much around. Excellent blankets and a big barhroom also poorly illuminated. I also missed a bidet which is common in all Europe. The price rather high.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TresPlumas
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a fabulous location. Walking distance to all the big attractions, right in the heart of the "old" city. Super friendly and helpful staff. Easy to get to from the airport via the bus which stops at Placa de Catalunya and then its a 10 minute walk. Rooms won't blow you away with opulence but comfy beds and trendy "chocolate and cream" coloured decor. Free minibar is just cola and water, one bottle of non-alcoholic beer. All basic and next level rooms are twins not doubles although a couple exist. Room 616 has a queen for basic prices. For location, quality of the rooms and how helpful the staff were you can't go wrong with this hotel. Thoroughly recommend and will stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: sparky1971
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd trip back to Bareclona & opted for this hotel due to its location. We were really pleased with the choice, the check-in was great & the staff were very helpful. I agree that the hotel has gone for the chic uber feel but we really did appreciate it after a full day out sightseeing & the blackout blinds were perfect. It has a real calming feeling when you walk in but if your after oppulence & indulgence then this is probably not the hotel for you although I definately would go back there. The rooms were a good size & we did not suffer with any noise but are room was on the side of the hotel. The only fault I could say was that the bathroom got very steamy after a shower & this made the bedroom quite warm & you aren't able to open the windows obviously for safety reasons. We only had one bathrobe in the room but a quick call to reception & they brought another 1 up to us. My over all opinion of this hotel is that its very central, clean & good value for money. I would definately stay there again !

Reviews.Title: “Great location - very nice room - noise is a problem”
Reviews.Author: pollotim
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a City Suite for 3 nights in March - nice large corner room - very well decoreted. This is a nice deisgn hotel without being pretentious. Staff were friendly and informed. Best about this hotel is the location - right at the corner of the Born destrict - which has lots of nice streets with bars and places to eat. Only gripe would be the noise - we were on 5th floor so although you could hear the traffic from below it was not terrible. However there appears to be no soundproofing between rooms - We only someone next door for one night - but could hear everything - luckily silent for the rest of the time.

Reviews.Title: “privacy”
Reviews.Author: MustardseedAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: The Grand Central is a DESIGN Hotel, that means that the design is important and not if the room is practical. Result.1. Almost black corridors, you had the feeling that it was night even if outside the sun was shining, very weard. 2 The bathroom was seperated from the room by a glass door, that means that when you were sitting on the toilet you were seen (with all the details) in the room. No privacy though. Be very careful when you plan a visit to this hotel with somebody you don't know well for example a collaegue. The level of the hotel is OK, good breakfast, good location, good service. Jaap Holland

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED THE GRAND CENTRAL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: SurreyScarlett
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel stylish, chic and trendy and loved the cool brown and cream colour scheme and Japanese style decor. However if you like bright lights, pictures on the walls and patterned curtains this hotel is not for you! The lobby is furnished with low black leather sofas and tables with burning candles and is very welcoming and calming. We were in one of the smaller bedrooms which was decorated in the same style with cream and brown walls, wooden floors and Japanese style furnishings. The twin beds were very comfortable, but annoyingly, for some reason my husband's bed kept sliding away from the wall when he was trying to read in bed. I didn't have this problem, maybe because I am lighter. The other two slight irritations were that the reading lights needed adjusting as the spot lights focused in the wrong direction and the door to the bathroom, as has been mentioned in a couple of other reviews was almost transparant, which looked very smart and in keeping with the decor, but is not very practical - luckily, we were not too bothered as we have been married for nearly 40 years! We only had a stool in our room, but that was fine as we were usually so exhausted from our sight seeing, that we were quite happy to lie on the beds and watch TV. In our case the breakfast was included and we found it excellent, apart from the sausages and bacon not being quite hot enough. There was a very good choice of cold meats, cheeses, rolls and pastries, fruit and fruit juices, even champagne! The hotel is very central and about a 10 minute walk to the Ramblers, but we preferred the local area where there are some lovely shops and tapas bars. The best tapas bars are to be found at the end of the road next to the metro - turn left out of the hotel and then, I think it was the 3rd road on the left. Our favourite tapas bar was called Taller de Tapas. Don't take an expensive taxi from the airport, as there are regular buses right outside which will take you within a 10 minute walk of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not really convinced of any claims towards luxury....”
Reviews.Author: llamafarm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel recently and found it rather odd. For a start, everything is extemely dark and I competely agree with some other reviewers that this can get to you after a while. Above the beds are two spotlights which shine directly into your eyes...there was only one bathrobe in our room, rather than two, and only one chair, despite the fact that it was a twin-bedded room. It was comfortable - sort of - but certainly nothing special and I'm not at all sure whether the word 'luxury' should apply. It was all very functional and basic, we found. The reception looks nice but, again, it's all a bit too dark! You begin to feel as though you're making your way through mole-like tunnels - when you get out of the lifts, it's all dark grey and black....the lighting is turned down so low that it really does give a subterranean feel. The black out blinds are good and really work, but it was SO dark in our room that we had to leave the blinds up a little so we could see something, otherwise it was completely black! The breakfast is a total rip off at around £17.50 each - don't bother. You can walk two minutes and find Starbucks which whilst not wondrous, is at least cheap and you can have the same pastries as in the hotel. The scrambled eggs, tomatoes, mushrooms etc were stone cold and there was nothing remotely special about the breakfast to justify that kind of cost. Ridiculous. We definitely won't be back, though the location is good - in the old Gothic quarter - we'll look for something else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: michelle1986
Reviews.Content: Hotel is absolutely amazing and fitted all our needs for comfort and location. Our room was an ok size, for a centraly located city and had all the mod cons and all. We especially loved the remote control black out blind. The bathroom was large with a bath/power shower. The free mini bar was great and cut down on some of our costs. Breakfast was ok, glad we didn't have to pay for it! Cold fried and scrambled egg didn't go down to well. But the pasteries were gorgeous. The location was great and it only took 5 mins to get to the playa de catalunya. We throughly enjoyed our stay and would reconmend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelAgent23
Reviews.Content: As a travel agent myself when booking this hotel, I did so much research, into all the hotels in Barcelona in the end I was getting on everyone's nerves!! But in my opinion I feel this is the best hotel in Barcelona, not only for price and cleanliness but as the name suggests it was very central, and could walk everywhere from my hotel and only once did we use the metro, and that was to visit camp Neu. I found the system very easy to use, as I don't speak Spanish, but once you have used one metro service in one country they are very much the same. Upon arrival at our hotel, which was about 10:30 am, the hotel let us keep our luggage at the hotel until our room was ready, when we were upgraded to a superior room! not sure if was because I was a travel agent (it helps) or because the receptionist was so lovely. Fantastic rooms, great shower and the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. The cleanliness of hotel is great, and the breakfast was the best, lots of choice of breads, jams and cheese etc, but a hot selection of bacon sausages and eggs etc, and a wide choice of fresh fruit. I had such a great time at this hotel that I'm going back in April but for 3 nights as there is so much to do I couldn't fit it in, I have even booked a few of my clients after recommending it. Overall a great hotel in a great location, and a honest review from someone who knows what they are talking about!!

Reviews.Title: “Style over Substance”
Reviews.Author: Gems-Dad
Reviews.Content: Boutique hotel that has gone for style over substance. Dark Gray and Silver everywhere isn't necessarily my taste, but it's really not helpful when you come out of the rooms and there are no directional signs. The room was freezing, and no amount of changing the aircon temperature could encourage warmth. Finally the bathroom waste from floors above came down a non-soundproofed pipe in the corner of my room.

Reviews.Title: “Love Grand Hotel Central”
Reviews.Author: PaulyWalton
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. I went to Barca with my friend for a weekend. We were unsure where to stay as there are so many choices with different location. I just picked this. The location is fantastic. Walk out of the hotel and go straight forward you get to La Rambas within 5-10mins walk. Turn left and then bear left, you get to bars and cafes which are more local i.e. away from the English / cheap tourists. Good food and good spanish company. Turn left and continue to walk you are in the marina area (5-10 walk). Hotel itself is of good standard. Very relaxing place to be and the roof terrace is just fantastic. Would be a great place to hold a small gathering for a party or something. The rooms are very modern and clean, again to a very good standard. I would highly recommend this hotel on basis of location and standard of hotel. The only down side I could find was that the rooms never had an iron or ironing board. You had to pay 7euros per shirt which is a complete rip off. If you are going to Barca and you are looking for a hotel and just not sure - book this one. I booked with BA.com and overall not bad price I think. cheers Paul

Reviews.Title: “Sorry, but I hated it!”
Reviews.Author: piwismum
Reviews.Content: While location for the Grand Hotel Central is excellent, I absolutely hated the hotel. In an effort to be 'uber cool' the decorators have ignored all sense of comfort. I thought the furnishings e.t.c. were very 'industrial' - no armchairs in the rooms, in fact nothing at all extra in the room to make your stay just that little bit more comfortable - just bed and built in desk unit . Don't forget to take a torch - the corridors are painted black / grey with very subdued lighting. The bathroom doors are glass - if you're travelling with husband / wife a lack of privacy in the bathroom I suppose is not so essentaial but I went with my daughter and bathroom doors that are see -through and because made of glass do not shut flushly, leave nothing to the imagination. Staff were helpful and internet access good but if like me, you like a little comfort and welcome in your hotel bedroom and don't mind paying for it - stay well away. Try the Barcelona Center instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Nieff
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel Central in Barcelona is a great hotel in the heart of Barcelona. We came to Barcelona for a 3 day stay to go shopping & sightseeing. Being at the heart of the city this is just perfect to stay. The rooms are stylish & clean, the staff members were all very friendly and helpful when needed. The breakfast however was awfull -- perhaps they just had a bad day. But overall really a hotel to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in City Centre”
Reviews.Author: countingsmiles
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and were very satisfied. The decor is ultra modern and the room was very chic and comfortable. The front desk staff were very helpful and friendly. Our location was great as the hotel is on the edge of the old city centre with all the narrow streets to explore and there are many good restaurants all around it. The rooftop pool is really cool and has a wonderful view of the city. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: MsRobynG
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location to see the sites of Barcelona. The hotel interior is stylish and very clean. The only downsides is that as part of the "stylish" interior, the hotel and the bedrooms are very dark!! I could hardly generate enough light in the room after turning on all of the lamps, etc. to read a book at night. If the hotel would just sort out this problem and add some more lamps, it would receive a higher rating. This hotel is modern, clean, and sylish for travellers, but probably not what I would call romantic, if that is what you are looking for..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for central Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: timffm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Central, with an all adult family group and found it ideal The hotel is very central, straddling the Barri Gotic and Born and in a very imposing building. The rooms are very stylish, no flowery patterns and old towels here. The only slight downside were the public areas. It would have been nice to have somewhere to meet up before we went out. There is a small bar but it is tucked away and not very welcoming The staff were great and in nicer weather I would have spent lots of time up in the pool, where the views are stunning

Reviews.Title: “Weekend at the Grand Hotel Central”
Reviews.Author: SuperSig
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a weekend in Barcelona, and decided on The Grand Hotel Central after a thorough research in this website, reading a vast amount of reviews on the many hotels in Barcelona. Every compliment is deserved by this amazing hotel. The decor is breathtaking, the huge shower is AMAZING (I hope that Barcelona does not have a water shortage after our stay), the beds extremely comfortable and the breakfast was excellent. One word of advice to fellow travelers: If you have only a few days to spend in this beautiful city - try not to spend them during a weekend. The city was quite full of people, and there were queues for just about everything. Also - many restaurants and ALL the shops are closed on Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Location, style”
Reviews.Author: sugaraki
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during the last week of August. It was a leisure trip, intended for sightseeing, shopping and relaxation. THe hotel is ideally located in the gothic area, walking distance from many sights. The blue tourist bus has a stop 2 minutes away and there is a metro stop on the opposite side of the road. What I also liked was the room decoration (a bit small though ). The pool has a great scene, really unique. I just hope it wasn't so cold that week so I could have enjoyed it more. I didn't try the breakfast (our room rate didn't include it). I hope you enjoy Barcelona, it's a very vivid city, full of young people, restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Hip factor high - needs to work on practical amenities”
Reviews.Author: nancylarry
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 5 nights in mid sept. Hotel is located in a fabulous pneighborhood with easy walking to the best areas in the city. However, it is on a busy street and between the noise from the street and the construction nearby, we had a problem with our room and had to move. Yes the hotel lobby and halls are very dark but that did not bother us - it was the lighting in the rooms. All the lights are down lights - including the bathroom and so was horrible for putting on makeup and seeing what was in your luggage! We had an executive room #223, and it was tight for two people to move around the room at the same time. The only place to put luggage was on the desk - no luggage rack was provided. The bathroom had a shower/tub combo and only a artial glass partition so water got all over the floor and they provide a teeny 1x3 rug to compensate. Despite the above, the rooms were very clean and the quality of the furniture, linens, window treatments, etc were high. The rooftop pool is outreageous - we used it a few times during our stay - definately check out the nighttime view. The dissappointment there was no one to serve drinks or hand out towels, etc. we had to search around and eventually found them in the fitness room. OVerall, this hotel is in a great neighborhood, but I can't say that I recommend it highly for the price. I would much rather have been on a quieter street with a larger room and less hipness.

Reviews.Title: “friendly efficient service in Hotel Central”
Reviews.Author: UkSkipper
Reviews.Content: We have juust returned form a 4 night stay at the Hotel Central. As the name suggests the hotel occupies a central position in Barcelona. It is close to all the most popular tourist attractions. The Ramblas is an easy walk, as are the very good tapas bars and cafes etc close to the hotel. The metro is also close by and it is easy ot travel to some attractions which are more than a walk away, for example Parc Guell or the church of Sagrada Famille. The Hotel Central is excellent. The decor is dark and I must admit I was unsure about its cave like atmosphere, but many people found it restful, the lobby is partially lit by candles and there is sometimes a faint smell of incense which for us increased the sense of peace and cool tranquillity. The staff are wonderfully friendly, helpful and efficient. Our room whilst quite small was perfectly adequate. It was quiet and beautifully clean. The beds were comfortable. Breakfast was very good. Plenty of very fresh food, fruit, bread, meats, cheese etc We would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again. UK Skipper

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Pool and with a central location”
Reviews.Author: nickpotter1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in mid September and had a fantastic experience. We booked it through expedia and got 1 night free as part of one of their offers. The roof top pool is great, it's a fantastic place to relax after a long days site seeing (although they could do with keeping the pool bar attended over the weekend). We booked an executive room on the 6th floor which we found more than adequate, we had great views from our window over looking the Gothic Cathedral opposite. You also get access to a free mini-bar in you room which is good, although don't expect a jam-packed fridge, it contains 2 bottles of coke, 2 bottles of sparkling mineral water, 2 bottles of still mineral water, 1 bottle of alcholol free beer and a small bar of chocolate. The staff at the hotel are friendly and pleased to help in any way they can. The location is good with most tourist sites well within walking distance and for those sites that aren't there is the Jaume metro station 2 minutes walk away. The only downside to this hotel is that the road on which it is situated Via Laietana is particular busy during the day monday to friday, although it did get quieter at the weekend. Next time we visit Barcelona we will be sure to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jimmie_Waldron
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 8 nights in August and I was very impressed with it. The hotel itself is situated in a very good location. The district has some cool streets and some nice little bars and restaurants nearby and is quiet at night, owing to the fact that its 10 minutes walk away from La Rambla and Placa De Catalunya which also makes those places easily accessable. The room we were staying in (617) was an executive suite and was very nice and of moderate size (not a fantastic view due to roadworks being done in main yard on 1 side-which got noisy some mornings around 8), The free minibar is cool (a real beer rather than that nonsense 0% stuff would be much better though). The room has brilliant air conditioning and the bathroom was great. The only downside to the room was not even the fact that it's 2 singles rather than a double but the fact that the beds roll about much too easily, could benefit from roller stoppers. The staff couldn't have been nicer and were very helpful with anything we needed to know and they all had very good English.There are 2 PCs with free internet access in the lounge area too. My girlfriend didn't like the grey hall walls but I didn't care, I thought it suited, one thing I will agree on was that after coming from the pool on a bright day without wearing sunglasses it's very hard to see in the halls because they're quite dark. The rooftop was excellent and the pool was really cool for dipping in while looking out over the Barcelona rooftops.There is a Tourist bus stop just outside which is very handy for seeing the sights and it's right opposite La cathedral which is a pretty cool building. The hotel restaurant I thought was cool. Very chic setting with lounge music (Theivery Corporation style) and is a nice place to go for a relaxed drink with your other half. Service there is excellent and the food is original and inventive (definitely worth checking out but get full 3 courses as the portions won't fill you). I noticed there are a few complaints about room lighting, the lights are on dimmers which if set too full are more than bright enough. For ours to work you had to turn the switch to whatever level you wanted BEFORE you turned the light on for it to work at that level (i.e. dimmer didn't work while the light was turned on - strange). I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: SSLCC
Reviews.Content: Such a relief to find a hotel booked online that exceeded expectations. Really cool styling decor. Liked the thoughtful touches such as free minibar and library for guest use. Extremely helpful staff who did their best to help. Excellent breakfast buffet with cooked to order hot options. Location opposite the cathedral very convenient for sightseeing. Our 3 children were given an upgrade to a loft suite so that there was more space for a third bed (upon request on arrival so don't be shy to ask). Only drawbacks were the somewhat small rooftop pool - but a pool in the city centre is a plus anyway - and the traffic noise - not entirely dealt with by the double-glazing. Would highly recommend and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Clare2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights in July and overall found the hotel to be very good. Really nice room and the blackout blinds and free mini-bar are a nice touch. It no longer does the free Molton Brown toiletries by the way but that wasn't a problem for us. The pool is great but does get busy. The breakfasts were excellent, some of the best we've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Papamoomin
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel Central is in a fantastic location away from the tourist trap of the Ramblas but just a 10 minute walk too its 'delights'. It has a lovely rooftop pool with fantastic views. The rooms are of a nice size - we were upgraded upon checkin - with plenty of amenities including a free minibar which is a nice touch. Breakfast is pleasant but there are too many staff milling around trying to make themselves look busy and the genuine service provided by the hotel is let down a little here. I would definitely stay here again and if you like a little luxury in an amazing location, I would recommend you give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy small rooms”
Reviews.Author: CSN
Reviews.Content: Dad took the family to barcelona to celebrate his retirement. His contact in Barcelona booked the hotel but Dad got the name wrong. So when we arrvied late he took to this hotel only to find they didn't have a booking for us but had two rooms. The reception staff were really good about all of this. We stayed here for the first night which was great, unfortunately though we didn't get to try out the roof top pool but did have breakfast which was great - champagne, strawberries etc. Molton Brown in the petite bathroom. We called the contact the next who took us to the hotel he had booked which was the other side of town and nearly as nice.

Reviews.Title: “loved the grand hotel central”
Reviews.Author: walker50lion
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Excellent location central but not too noisy. rooms, staff and food all excellent. The roof top pool is great for a quiick dip but a little too crowded for longer use. the free mini bar was appreciated as was free iced water at the pool

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Position”
Reviews.Author: Zella
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a perfect location. We stayed for four nights and were very impressed. Got a great deal through lastminute.com, so were given a room overlooking the central courtyard( which they dont tell you is going through major roadworks!...which look like will be going on for a long time)) we complained and got a much better room on the 7th floor overlooking the city( worth paying extra for). Room spacious, clean and modern..wonderful views! The hotel breakfast is fab, full buffet with champagne and hot food cooked to order.. Rooftop pool..SUPERB but you must get there early if you plan on sunbathing. We got up and sunbathed from 8 and all the beds( only 16 of them!!) were gone by half 8!! People were coming up all day to try and get one FORGET IT!!!! Hotel is centrally placed for everything...all 10 mins walk..perfect. It was our first time in Barcelona and we loved it. Restaurants get totally booked up so you should always make reservations if you like the look of somewhere. All in all a great experience..reccommed highly!!

Reviews.Title: “An Absolutely Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MillieStar
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights, one night in the central room and 3 nights in the city suites. Highly recomend pay a bit more for the latter! The hotel and rooms are very tastefully designed, staff are sooooooooo nice and helpful. The mini bar in the rooms are free!!! In the city suites, they offer you champagne every day! The location was perfect, situated right in the city centre, 5-10 mins walk to La Ramblas, Bottic center, beach, shops, and the taxi fare is soooooooo cheap, only €20 to airport, but make sure you agree a price with the taxi driver if you are going to the airport. The highlight of the stay must be the beautiful roof pool! We used it every day, morning is the best time to go, I mean, really around 10am. There is no downside whatsoever for this hotel!!! Will definitely return to it and have recomend it to all the friends and relatives!!!

Reviews.Title: “Uber Cool....highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: tuffjam
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Grand Hotel Central last weekend with my girlfriend to celebrate my birthday and booked it based on the excellent reviews here. I wanted somewhere fairly classy and central and this hotel definitely delivered on those counts. I can see what people mean about it being a little dark inside but it's not so bad that you can't see, just very low level lighting. It's done well and overall the designer nailed the 'cool' factor throughout. Walking into reception it just oozes class with a lovely lobby. The staff look smart without appearing aloof and all we encountered were very friendly and spoke excellent English (shame on us for not learning more Catalan....). We stayed in a 'Central' Room which wasn't the biggest but perfect for us. It was nicely laid out with wooden floors and plenty of cupboard space. The in-room safe was very welcome too, especially after hearing the horror stories about pickpockets. The bathroom was a decent size and spotlessly clean. Again, the mirrors and mood lighting are very contemporary and cool. The electric black out blinds were not only a great toy but also very effective. Although we weren't in direct sunlight they managed to completely black out the room when we wanted an afternoon nap. So well that we only woke up at 9pm. The only downside was the bed. On booking the hotel it seemed impossible to get a double bed unless I splashed out on a suite at double the price. Instead it was two beds pushed together. Usually I don't mind that and can get over it but since the beds aren't connected in anyway (zip down the middle for example) and they're on wooden floors, they slide apart at the slightest touch! Any bedroom 'activity' (catch my drift?) resulted in the bed sliding across the floor and we weren't exactly going crazy! Effectively, if I wanted to cuddle up with my girlfriend we had to sleep in a single bed. Not good. Another minor quibble is the room lighting is so low that if you do want a bit extra and you're in bed, the only way is to put the spotlights on, shining right in your face. The pool on the roof is stunning. It's a shame I didn't get to use it but the views are incredible. There weren't too many loungers up there so if you're planning on using it I'd get there early and lay your towel down, German style. The location on Via Laitana is PERFECT. No doubt about it, we couldn't have been in a better place. It was just a 5 minute stroll to the Ramblas and Placa Catalunya. The Born area, Bari Gotic and Olympic port areas were all maybe 10 or 15 minutes walk. There's a Bus Turistic stop 5 minutes left or right out of the hotel. Overall, even despite the slidy beds I'd have no hesitation in staying here again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and friendly right in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: lordandlady
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Central Hotel for 3 nights in July. The rooms were stylish and contemporary. All the staff were friendly and spoke excellent English. The concierges were very helpful and informative about the city. Service at breakfast was sketchy and hot food was not terribly hot! The help yourself buffet element was extensive and of good quality. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “All good aside from service, which was lacking”
Reviews.Author: alesato
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine, the rooms nice and the location great. However, the service provided was lacking. I'm pretty sure the reason was the need for more staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Morilla
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the Hotel we were greeted by friendly staff and were able to check in very quickly, although the hotel is very dark it's music and lighting gave it a relaxing atmosphere. Our room was spacious and on the fourth floor of the hotel, the beds were comfortable and the bathroom was large. Overall the hotel was very clean. The breakfast's were extensive - fresh fruits, cereals, cold cheeses and meats, assorted breads and cake etc along with the cooked breakfast., lovely fresh fruit juices. The staff were very helpful when my credit card was stolen and friendly throughout our stay. The pool area was a real plus - early morning or early afternoon visits are the best times, there was iced water with lemon available and a small selection of soft drinks which could be purchased. Towels were also available at the pool area. The hotel is in a great location - very central. Expect to pay between 25-30 Euros for a cab from and to the airport each way (traffic being the delaying factor). Would definately re-visit (we visited mid week and the Hotel didn't appear to be too full).

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time until hotel lost our luggage”
Reviews.Author: luggagefreeLeicester
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner visited Barcelona on 5th June for a 3 night break, it was also to celebrate my partners birthday which was the day of our 'supposed' departure, Friday 8th June 2007. The hotel location was great, the hotel room was great, totally agree with a majority of the other reviews about the beds beind really comfortable. We were having a fantastic time and on the eve of our last day (Thursday 7th June) we enquiried as to whether there was a safe locked room which our luggage could go until we returned from sightseeing, as our flight was a late evening flight and we had to vacate our room at the hotel by 12 noon. We were advised that the hotel had a concierge room which was locked at all times and only staff had access to this. We felt comfortable with this as with the hotel being a 4 star, lovely hotel we didnt feel we had anything to worry about. Low and behold, when we returned to the hotel early evening to collect our luggage before going to the airport we were advised that unfortunately it looked like the hotel had 'mistakenly' given it to someone else!!!! We had everything in our suitcase, passports, car keys, house keys, as people who have visited Barcelona in the past, and all the tour books advise not to carry personal belongings when sight seeing/visiting the beach as there are pickpockets/handbag snatchers. We finally got back to the UK on the Saturday, after a visit to the police station to report the 'lost' luggage, and the hotel manageress booked us flights and contacted the British Consulate to enable we were allowed to get back home without passports etc. After nearly 3 weeks of returning home, we are still trying to sort out the paperwork/keys etc which was in the suitcase, and havent unfortunately had any positive news from the hotel about the luggage. For all the years that myself and my partner have travelled, we have never heard of a 'good' hotel to loose your luggage while it's in their conceirge room - can understand the luggage being lost at an airport but not at a hotel. Has this happened at this hotel before - as I have asked the hotel and they dont seem keen on given me an answer strangely enough. I plan to take this further as I believe it may have been a member of staff, as when I've asked them to check their cctv footage they say that they cannot see the luggage being removed - very bizarre.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DebbeChristy
Reviews.Content: We moved from another totally unsatisfactory hotel in Barcelona to the Grand Central. The location is perfect! The hotel itself is very dark inside the lobby and passages to the rooms. We had a corner room which was very light. The hotel is very modern and stylish which I loved! The bed was so comfortable I wanted to find out the brand! All the room windows have electric roll down blackout blinds (Great if you jetlagged and need to sleep in the day!) The staff were friendly and helpful. There is a stunning pool right on the top of the hotel as well as a well-equiped gym. The one and only downside is that you cannot open any windows in the rooms and some people might find it claustrophobic... But otherwise I would definately stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel, superb location”
Reviews.Author: vikian21
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel through airmiles.... i was talked into parting with all my airmiles and a wadge of cash... however... i am glad i did!!!! A lovely modern hotel, rooms are lovely, toiletries are a nice touch, bathroom fab. free minibar greatly appreciated.. but don't expect to get drunk on it! Then again it's free so who's complaining! minibar contained water (needed on a hot day in barcelona). coke, alcohol free beer (!) and a couple of mini bottles of cava... nice touch. The swimming pool was delightful, but even on a very hot day it was a bit cold for me! The breakfast is great, everything you could want (even cava). The location of the hotel is great. I would suggest you ask for a high floor, it can be a bit noisy outside. We started every evening in the hotel bar for a swift one, a nice bar with reasonable prices, and the location of the hotel meant bars and restaurants were all around. As already suggested, don't eat on las ramblas, it's really expensive, there's some really tidy places in the bourn district, really nice bars and restaurants and all very reasonably priced. We loved it and would have no reservation in coming here to this hotel again. barcelona is a great place (make sure you visit casa batillo, sagrada familia - amazing and the arc de triomphe area behind the hotel). it's also worth going to the top of the mountain for the amazing view of the city whilst drinking an ice cold beer. superb!

Reviews.Title: “You won't beat the bed... or location”
Reviews.Author: Owenowen
Reviews.Content: I stayed just the one night in this ultra-chic, centrally located city hotel. Of course, all people are different and expectations in hotels vary widely.
