But, for me, when it comes to hotels in big cities there are very few aspects which I demand to be spot-on and nothing less. First up, location. Few people spend their annual fortnight's hols in somewhere like Barcelona, Amsterdam, Munich or similar, so time is often tight. Grand Central is slap-bang in the middle of town, on a busy but stately road close to the cathedral. The old town with its alleyways, tapas bars, shops and sights are within very easy reach on foot. Weekend trips traipsing around from sight to sight can be tiring, so the next thing you want is a good bed. At this hotel I can honestly say as soon as my head hit the pillow I was off. I didn't wake up again until gone 9am - a sleep from heaven. Well filled but soft pillows, crisp sheets and a mattress with true firmness without being hard. Another bonus, the electronically-controlled blackout blinds keep out the sun should you want to turn in early-ish or have a lie-in. Oh, and the room, corridors, lifts etc were spotlessly clean. One of the cleaning ladies also gave me a very friendly smile and a "hello" - how often does that happen? Nice. I didn't have the breakfast (I had just a coffee, not really being a breakfast person) but looking around I didn't see any disgruntled people. Another real bonus is the rooftop swimming pool. The view of Barcelona is simply stunning, and if sunbathing is your thing you'll be delighted. My only criticisms: the rooms could do with better lighting; and the minibar, included in the price, contains only water, cola and a drab alcohol-free beer. A bottle or two of the excellent local Estrella Damm lager would have been a nice touch. Come 1am I really didn't have the energy to phone down for some for a nightcap. Would I stay here again? Definitely. I won't be wasting valuable weekend break time getting to and from the sights and I'll get a fabulous sleep in cool, air-conditioned surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Parisianlady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel a lot to excellent hotels and we had been recommended this place by friends. The reception staff was warm, friendly and professionnal, speaking all the languages needed.. The style, design and architecture is hip and trendy. In a way that it provides a true escape which most formal urban big hotels don't. Can't stand design over the top not connecting with simple well being and lifestyle. There I very much liked the simple elegance of the design. The location is perfect, we could walk to all historical and shopping spots,and also to great restaurants. The Cuina Santa Caterina, around the corner, offers in a trendy market atmosphere the best food and wines. Don't miss it. Manage also to go to Actual the hotel restaurant. It is delicious and their breakfast is spot on. I can't wait to go back and we are planning our return with our teen ager children. Staff, location, food, design, and service all was perfect. From a new fan of Barcelona..!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Nibbles
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at this hotel and were very pleased with our choice. The hotel is very stylish and chic looking. Since we booked our room via airmiles (and consequently didn’t actually ‘pay’ for it) we were unsure what the standard would be. Whilst we were allocated the smallest room on the floor it was still ample for our needs with a VERY comfortable bed. The rooms are stylish and modern but, as is often pointed out in reviews, the lighting is quite subdued and via lamps or downlighters so for anyone wanting to apply make up or put in contact lenses it can be a bit of a struggle! The mini bar with free water and coke was much appreciated. The bathroom was small but adequate and very clean, Molton Brown toiletries were supplied (although only 1 small container of shampoo and 1 of bath gel). The wardrobe contained 1 robe and 2 pairs of flip flops, only 6 hangers and a room safe. Although the bed was a double bed I have a feeling this room may be one which is often used as a single. Since the hotel is on a very busy road we had requested (via e-mail) a quiet room and were allocated a room at the back of the hotel – no view, but at least no traffic noise. I would imagine that rooms on the front can get very noisy. The wooden flooring can also mean noise can be heard from rooms above. We were particularly impressed with breakfasts here. Plenty of fresh juices (and even cava on ice!), f resh fruit, cereals, yogurts, meats and cheeses and a wide variety of lovely breads and pastries. We loved the little sandwiches made with freshly baked baguettes. There was also a menu of cooked items if required. The rooftop pool is a real bonus, although we didn’t get to use it I imagine it’s a great place to chill out in the heat of the day. I’m surprised to read criticism of staff at this hotel as we found all staff, without exception, to be helpful, charming and efficient –no request was too much trouble and they all spoke excellent English. The hotel is in an fantastic location, only a few hundred yards from the metro (Jaume 1) and less than 10 minutes walk to Placa Catalunya and Las Ramblas, It’s also on the edge of 2 fabulous areas for bars and restaurants – Barri Gotic and El Born. We decided to use the open top Bus Turistic on a 2 day pass and found it a great way to see the city – one of the stops on the Blue Route is also just 100 yds from the hotel. I wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again, or to recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Laid back sophistication”
Reviews.Author: JulianandGillian
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a break in Barcelona. Modern rooms, comfy beds, fantastic breakfasts. Well equipped with Moltlon Brown and the free water in the minibar was much apprecitated. Rooftop pool with a view to die for. Staff couldn't have been more helpful. Avoid eating on The Ramblas, there are much better restaurants in the Gothic Quarter. See out a cava bar to start your evening with a swing

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SJ123
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights at the beginning of May 2007 with my husband. This is our 3rd visit to Barcelona and this hotel is the best we have stayed in in this beautiful city. The rooms are fantastically decorated with really comfortable beds. The bathrooms are well equipped with a shower over the bath. The minibar is filled with soft drinks and water and is on the house, which is a nice touch. The only negative about the room is that I would have liked there to be more light, the rooms and bathrooms were very dark, and the lights were not sufficient. The hotel is in the best location, right in the old town opposite the cathedral, and there are 100's of restaurants and bars surrounding the hotel. Please be aware that pickpockets are rife in Barcelona so be very careful of your bags, and leave as much as possible in the hotel safe. Finally the pool is amazing, it is on the roof of the building and overlooks the whole city. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: DiscerningTravellor
Reviews.Content: I booked a 3-day stay at this hotel to celebrate my birthday, which was to take place during my stay. I booked with the hotel directly, by phone, and asked for a quiet no-smoking room. The hotel’s website state all bedrooms have soundproof bedroom windows but this is untrue. When I arrived the reception staff took ages to decide what room they were going to give me. I was shown to a bedroom with dark walls and spot lighting on the ceiling. As the room did not have much natural light, it needed the electric light on constantly. Even then the room was still dark. Although the room was on a high floor of the hotel you could hear constant traffic noise and additionally the intermittent sound and vibration of the metro. At night, it was necessary to use blackout curtains to prevent the lights from surrounding buildings and the cathedral shining into the room, which had the undesired feeling of sleeping in a box Next day I asked to change room. I refused a room with direct views of neighbouring TV aerials and in close proximity to what I believe is a mobile phone mast. I also refused a room that smelt of smoke. I eventually accepted another room, similar in design to my existing room although much smaller, but it was quieter. It was a lower category room and was promised a refund. Yet when it was time to leave the reception staff did not want to give me this refund. After 30 minutes of discussion they reluctantly agreed to give me a very small reduction indeed. The reduction given does not reflect in any way the price difference between the categories of rooms when I look at the prices on the website. The reception refused to show me or print off the prices of the rooms or inform me how they came to this reduction figure. Additionally during my stay, I asked the reception staff for a nice restaurant nearby for dinner, about 10 minutes walk, which served local food. One person just said that there are many restaurants in Barcelona! Other reception staff told me of a restaurant that looked like a dingy workman’s café down a narrow alley that was serving pizza and pasta, another restaurant that was very expensive and empty and another that was 40 minutes walk away. In short, in my opinion, this is a pretentious and expensive hotel that suffers from both noise and light pollution. The reception staff seemed to take great delight in being unhelpful as possible at every opportunity. This whole experience was very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location but book direct”
Reviews.Author: pedro3gb
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. My husband booked two rooms for myself and three friends to celebrate my birthday. On arrival were two small bottles of Cava in each room with a Happy Birthday message on one and Welcome to Barcelona on the others. Rooms were modern with the most comfortable beds ever (anybody know what make the beds are??). Molton Brown smellies and small boxes of chocolates, slippers (albeit one medium pair and one large - obviously for a couple), gowns and free soft drinks in the minibar. The downside in the room - glass doors to the bathroom!! and the decor could have been a bit lighter - the corridors were quite dark. Unfortunately I was robbed whilst I was there near the hotel. Four young men ripped my handbag from me taking all my money, cards and passport (yes I know I should have used the in room safe as my husband keeps pointing out). The first person I spoke to on reception was NOT helpful and refused to call the Police saying they would not come out. We had to go by taxi to the Police Station. On our return the second receptionist could not have been more helpful and friendly making us all a cup of tea, calming me down and passing the phone over when my husband rang from home. He even offered me replacement cash to be paid for by my husbands credit card if necessary. All in all its a recommended hotel but please be careful of bag snatchers in the Barri Gotic - there are lots of them and the police do not seem that interested. Final tip - book direct - its cheaper!!

Reviews.Title: “Cool, sleek and funky!”
Reviews.Author: siagor81
Reviews.Content: I first saw this hotel in a magazine on my way home in the train one wet day...i saw the fablous photo of the swimming pool and decided i wanted to try it for myself...I was not disappointed! I was lucky that the weather was sunny and hot and managed to sunbathe (not hot enough for a swim tho) on the terrace which is even better than the photo i saw. The hotel is very stylish with a relaxing atmosphere and the staff were helpful. More light in the bathroom and corridors would be useful i thought but the rooms were comfortable enought. I found some amazing shops and boutiques close to the hotel as well as some very funky bars at nightime. All is all a very relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars for location”
Reviews.Author: surfera
Reviews.Content: Having researched Barcelona quite thoroughly, I decided to book a 5 night stay at Grand Hotel Central. First and most importantly, the staff at this hotel are very friendly, attentive and eager to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. The rooms are all very nice, spacious and with very comfortable beds. Beautiful laminate floorings (was a little noisy with our neighbours heels!) and very cool fixtures, plus a DVD player and television (with DVDs that you can rent at the front desk). My room number "602". The breakfast was excellent, with everything you need to start the day well. I would have to say that the best thing about this hotel, aside from its exceptional staff, is the LOCATION. It is right in the heart of Barcelona, across the street from the Cathedral and the old quarter, with the Rambla just after. A clear 5 stars for location. It is for all of these reasons that I give this hotel 4 stars out of 5. Great staff, comfortable and stylish rooms and fantastic location

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Mcould
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at Grand Hotel Central on business in February. I was very impressed with the hotel. The location was fantastic, only 5/10 mins in taxi to the exhibition centre (and a peak times). Efficient staff on reception, clean rooms, relaxing breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as they say!”
Reviews.Author: Ladycake
Reviews.Content: Just back from a long weekend in Barcelona and had a fabulous weekend!! Having read some of the reviews before we went i was a bit apprehensive about the hotel. However it wasnt as bad as many of the comments on here. The biggest positive was its fantstastic central location. The staff were also very helpful, always smiling. The hotel itself is well designed and maintained but the rooms were hot though...a little uncomfortable to be honest and it was a little noisy with the traffic from the street, so I recommend you ask for a high floor. Apart from that it was a good hotel with a great location, perfect for sightseeing and seeing the city!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we've visited in Europe (so far!)”
Reviews.Author: melvillinho
Reviews.Content: I surprised my girlfriend for her birthday and took her on a romantic weekend, 4 nights for a long weekend …and we loved it! Fabulous city and a fabulous hotel. We had a romantic dinner in the hotel restaurant and wine and candles in our room. Great location, everything on the doorstep!! The staff spoke fluent English and were very helpful suggesting some cool bars to go for some drinks. Definitely looking forward to going back! We've done quite a bit of travelling round Europe and I have to be honest: Barcelona wasn't my choice, it was my girlfriend's... And i've never been happier to be proven wrong!! The city is amazing, and thanks to the staff we managed to sample all of the great restaurants and bars most tourists know nothing about!! We're already planning our next visit...

Reviews.Title: “Amazin time!”
Reviews.Author: crazywolflady
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend suprised me with a romantic getaway to Barcelona, staying in this wonderful hotel as a January pick me up...and we had an truly amazin time. It was the first time i had been and really loved the city...there is so much to do and see...it was handy that the hotel was so central and with the help of the guys at reception we found some really cool bars for drinks and dancing. The hotel itself was very plush, we had a city room (you have to ask for 624) as part of our package with a fab king size bed and views of all the rooftoops...it was so lovely at nightime! We also had included dinner in the restaurant which would have been nicer if there had been more people (but it was a tues night), some wine and candles in out room! There was also cava in the mini bar...bonus! The pool looked lovely but unfortuately its not heated so didnt get to try it. The breakfast was really good, be sure to ask for the hot breakfast menu tho, we only found out about it cos i seen someone with bacon and eggs! I am very surprised about the comments made before as we had such a lovely time and couldnt fault the hotel at all, that is why i felt i had to write. Everyone is different i suppose but i would certainly recommend this hotel...especially for the pool in the summer!

Reviews.Title: “Theft in room !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kalleanka
Reviews.Content: We had things stolen from our room!!!!!! -:( No management attention when reporting the incident, even though the theft was made with the hotel keycard access. Sorry to say, I do not recommend this hotel due to the poor service provided, even though it is modern and have a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: qwerty
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 2 nights at this hotel. Rooms were very clean and modern, with a bathroom to die for. Location was the main reason for choosing this hotel and we where not let down. Idealy located for "Rambles" Picasso Museum and the lovely Gothic area. Pool on the roof is lovely, though a bit chilly in December. Would definately stay here again. Make sure you get an upgrade to a superior room and have breakfat in bed! Geoff & Sue

Reviews.Title: “Designed in darkness”
Reviews.Author: Taisteal
Reviews.Content: On one of the busiest streets in Barcelona the triple-glazed Grand Central is perfectly located for exploring this exciting city. The cathedral and Ramblas are across the road and El Born beside it The staff at the hotel and slightly aloof but efficient. Overall the hotel is dark, black-painted corridors, black mesh blinds and lit by spotlights. Perfect for vampires. The beds are comfortable, water pressure good and the breakfast was lovely. Overall we had a great stay for four nights, the only drawback was the fact the windows don't open. Places we loved were Tast of Argentina on calle Argentina and El Rovell tapas bar/restaurant on the same street. The restaurant in the Santa Caterina market was also a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and good location”
Reviews.Author: GoLeafsGo0907
Reviews.Content: It was in a great location and was quite stylish. The rooms were pretty small, and having two grown men in them made it feel tight. Air conditioning was non-existent and we weren't able to get irons in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: The-Ox
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. No more than a ten minute walk from anywhere of interest and anywhere further afield is easily accesible from one of the many metro stops in the area. The staff, although initially slightly difficult, were friendly and courteous (the only one who let them down was a tall skinny guy with Leo Sayer hair). Our only major complaint was that we got a twin room when we had requested a double. Leo Sayer tried to tell me that all the rooms were like this, I'm not sure this is true but my Spanish is pretty poor and I didn't fancy the old Basil Fawlty approach. The room was really nice the bathroomhad a deep bath and really nice sink. I have to say the free drinks in the minibar were also a nice touch. I would definitely recommend this hotel, but make sure you get a double if you request one.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel staff!”
Reviews.Author: MeParker
Reviews.Content: Could not fault this hotel! It was truly excellent! On arrival and check in me and girlfriend were greeted by the very friendly and helpful staff. We went up to our room it was modern, clean, fresh and cool, We dumped our bags and went up to the roof. The views from the top are great and you get to see a lot of Barcelona. Breakfast was a fantastic, plenty to choose from with the best fresh orange juice ever!! The hotel staff are great, I quizzed them (in English) about lots of the usual holiday stuff, best way to see the city, places to eat, places to drink and they couldn't have been more helpful.
